folders.Crooked Moon Named NPCs: 歪曲之月命名的非玩家角色

Fists.name: 拳击
Fists.description: 近战武器攻击：命中 [[/attack]]，触及 5 尺，单一生物。伤害：[[/damage average]]伤害。

Mud Breath.name: 泥泞吐息
Mud Breath.description: 该魔蝠向5尺内的单一生物喷吐黏稠泥浆。若目标为中型或更小的，它必须进行一次DC 11敏捷豁免，豁免失败则被&Reference[Restrained apply=false]持续1分钟。受术生物可于每个自己的回合结束时重复该豁免，豁免成功则终止其身上的该效应。

Death Burst.name: 死亡爆发
Death Burst.description: 当该魔蝠死亡时，它会炸裂成一滩粘稠的泥浆。每个位于其5尺范围内的中型或更小的生物必须进行一次DC 11的敏捷豁免，豁免失败则被&Reference[Restrained apply=false]直到该生物的下个回合结束。

False Appearance.name: 伪装外表
False Appearance.description: 当该魔蝠静止不动时，它与普通的泥堆一模一样。

Crooked Man.name: 歪扭人
Crooked Man.description:
歪曲人

背叛的破碎精魄

栖息地: 任意

宝藏: 无

歪曲人是破碎信任与目标扭曲的亡灵化身。那些背叛自身信仰并彻底拥抱奸诈而死之人,可能以这副骨骼断裂,挂着扭曲笑容的破损躯壳归来。该生物指尖生有弯曲的钩爪,其心中的双重标准会渗透而出,令盟友相互对抗。尽管名为"歪曲人",任何人都可能成为这种背叛的具象。

秘密. 歪曲人无法忍受自我牺牲的行为,在此类存在面前会逐渐枯萎。

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击Multiattack。
Multiattack.description: 该扭曲之人发动两次[[/item Crooked Claw]]攻击，并且可以用一次[[/item Snap Limb]]取代其中一次攻击。若可用，他还能施展困惑术。

Crooked Claw.name: 弯曲之爪
Crooked Claw.description: 近战攻击检定: [[/attack]], 触及5尺. 命中: [[/damage average]]伤害. 如果目标是中型或更小的生物, 它会因其中一只爪子而获得&reference[grappled apply=false]状态 (逃脱DC 16). 直到受擒状态结束, 目标都会处于&reference[restrained apply=false]状态.

Snap Limb.name: 断肢一击
Snap Limb.description:
体质豁免: DC 19, 单一生物, 该生物正被扭曲之人擒抱, 且拥有可折断的肢体。

失败: [[/damage average]]伤害, 并且目标的一个肢体(由扭曲之人选择)中的骨骼(或等同物)断裂, 造成下述相应效果。断裂的肢体在40天内愈合, 或者当该生物通过魔法或再生能力恢复任何生命值时愈合。

成功: 仅受到一半伤害。

  • 断臂. 攻击检定具有劣势。无法用该肢体持握任何物品或操纵物体。

  • 断腿. 速度减半。如果该生物执行疾走动作, 它必须进行一次DC15的敏捷豁免, 否则将获得&reference[prone apply=false]状态。

  • 断翼. 飞行速度降为0。

Confusion.name: 困惑术
Confusion.description: 歪扭人施放@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplConfusion0]{困惑术}，该法术无需材料部件且使用魅力作为施法关键属性（法术豁免DC 17）。

Blinking Teleport.name: 闪烁传送
Blinking Teleport.description: 扭曲之人获得&reference[invisible apply=false]状态，持续1分钟，并传送至其视野范围内60尺内一个未占据的空间。扭曲之人造成任何伤害后，该状态立即结束。

Aversion To Self-sacrifice.name: 对自我牺牲的厌恶
Aversion To Self-sacrifice.description: 当歪曲人目睹一个生物自愿为替代他人或为他人利益而承受伤害或获得状态时，他将受到[[/damage average]]伤害。

Magic Resistance.name: 魔法抗性
Magic Resistance.description: 该驼背人在为抵抗法术或其他魔法效应而作的豁免上具有优势。

HSa8booR4YOdeYi2.name: 困惑术
HSa8booR4YOdeYi2.description:
该法术冲击并扭曲生物的心智，滋生幻觉并引发失控行为。施法时，在你选择射程内一点为圆心、半径10尺球状区域内的每个生物必须成功通过一次感知豁免，否则将受到该法术影响。

受影响的目标无法执行反应，并且在其每回合开始时必须投掷@{UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables.RollTable.LHEts1oDaDwcehuj]{困惑术}}表格以确定该回合的行为模式。

升环施法效应。 当你用五环或更高法术位施展该法术时，作用范围的半径你使用的法术位每四环高一环增加5尺。

1tTSb3yEAjsgEU7H.name: 困惑术
1tTSb3yEAjsgEU7H.description:
在你选择范围内一点为圆心，半径10尺球状区域内的每个生物必须进行一次感知豁免，若失败则目标无法执行附加动作或反应，并且必须在每个自己回合开始时投掷1d10以根据下表确定其该回合的行为。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.phbsplConfusionB rollable cite=false classes="caption-top"]{回合行为}

在每个自己的回合结束时，受影响的生物重复该豁免，若成功则法术对其终止。

使用更高法术位。 使用4环以上法术位施展该法术时，法术的球状半径每比4环高一环就增加5尺。

Confused.name: 困惑
Confused.description:
目标不能执行附加动作或反应，并且必须在每个自己回合开始时投掷1d10，根据下表确定其该回合的行为。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.phbsplConfusionB rollable cite=false classes="caption-top"]{回合行为}

在每个自己的回合结束时，受影响的目标重复进行[[/save ability=wis]]豁免，成功则自身终止该法术。

The Harvest Terror.name: 丰收恐惧之影
The Harvest Terror.description:
收割恐惧之影

秘密与绝望者恶魔

栖息地：草原，位面（无底深渊）

收割恐惧之影曾是注入名为老杰里科·斯蒂克斯的稻草人躯体内的欢快灵魂，如今却成了噩梦般的可憎存在。它是恶魔血肉的拙劣模仿品，塑造成乌鸦状稻草人的形态。其扭曲的身体由发霉的柳条构成，背部生长着四只破败的黑色羽翼。过大的鸦科动物头颅安在宽阔的肩膀上，琥珀色的眼睛闪烁不定，暗色鸟喙呈锯齿状裂口，手持一柄沾满陈旧血迹的缺口邪恶镰刀。永远饥渴的收割恐惧之影以秘密和保守秘密者为食。

秘密。 老杰里科·斯蒂克斯的灵魂仍存在于收割恐惧之影意识的黑暗深处。吟唱或演奏杰里科最喜爱的歌曲会打破对其被盗躯体的控制平衡。

收割恐惧之影的巢穴

收割恐惧之影的巢穴是被称为鸦之领域的跨位面玉米田迷宫。

包含收割恐惧之影巢穴的区域会因其存在而产生以下变化：

琥珀之眼。 在巢穴1英里范围内，琥珀色眼睛的乌鸦监视着一切。收割恐惧之影的敌人在该区域进行敏捷（隐匿）检定时具有劣势。

泄密之域。 在巢穴1英里范围内，除收割恐惧之影外的生物为保守秘密而进行魅力（欺瞒）检定时具有劣势。

若收割恐惧之影死亡或将巢穴迁至他处，这些效果立即终止。

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击Multiattack。
Multiattack.description: 该恐惧之影发动一次[[/item Claw]]攻击和一次[[/item Scythe]]攻击。

Claw.name: 爪击
Claw.description: 近战武器攻击：[[/attack]]命中，触及5尺，单一目标。命中：[[/damage average]]伤害。如果目标是中型或更小的生物，它将被击倒&Reference[Prone apply=false]。

Scythe.name: 镰刀
Scythe.description: 近战武器攻击: [[/attack]] 命中, 触及10尺, 单一目标。命中: [[/damage average]] 伤害。

Dirge Of Secrets.name: 秘密挽歌
Dirge Of Secrets.description: 恐惧之影发出一阵充满恐怖秘密的尖啸。每个距离恐惧之影30尺内的生物必须进行一次DC15的感知豁免。豁免失败，目标受到11（[[/r 2d10]]）心灵伤害，并且在1分钟内进行属性检定和攻击掷骰时具有劣势。豁免成功，目标仅受到一半伤害。受影响的生物在每个自己的回合结束时重复此豁免，成功则结束对其自身的该效果。

Legendary Actions.name: 传奇动作
Legendary Actions.description: 恐惧之影拥有3个传奇动作，从下列选项中选择。每次只能使用一个传奇动作选项，且只能在另一个生物的回合结束时使用。恐惧之影在其回合开始时恢复所有已消耗的传奇动作。

Averting Winds.name: Averting Winds
Averting Winds.description: The terror casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ew6GA8dJy2spQmFW] (which can’t appear in a creature’s space), requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

Crow’s Swoop.name: Crow’s Swoop
Crow’s Swoop.description: The terror moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Devour Secrets.name: Devour Secrets
Devour Secrets.description: The terror’s beak gapes and devours secrets. Each creature within 20 feet of the terror must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw (with disadvantage if the target has given up one of its secrets to the terror). On a failed save, a target takes 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) psychic damage, and its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Harvest Terror’s lair is the extraplanar corn maze known as the Fields of the Crow. The region containing the Harvest Terror’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Harvest Terror dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Amber Eyes.name: Amber Eyes
Amber Eyes.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, amber-eyed crows watch everything. Enemies of the Harvest Terror have disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in the region.

Spilled Secrets.name: Spilled Secrets
Spilled Secrets.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, creatures other than the Harvest Terror have disadvantage on Charisma (Deception) checks made to keep secrets.

Demonic Mimicry.name: Demonic Mimicry
Demonic Mimicry.description: The terror can mimic voices and sounds it has heard. A listener can discern the mimicry for what it is with a successful DC 18 Wisdom (Insight) check.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the terror fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The terror has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Unraveling Song.name: Unraveling Song
Unraveling Song.description: As an action, a creature can play or sing Jericho Sticks’ favorite song, “Coal-Eyed Birds,” and the terror is &Reference[Charmed apply=false] until the end of the creature’s next turn. The &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition ends early if the creature damages the terror or forces it to make a saving throw.

Wind Wall.name: Wind Wall
Wind Wall.description:
A wall of strong wind rises from the ground at a point you choose within range. You can make the wall up to 50 feet long, 15 feet high, and 1 foot thick. You can shape the wall in any way you choose so long as it makes one continuous path along the ground. The wall lasts for the Duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Strength saving throw. A creature takes 3d8 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The strong wind keeps fog, smoke, and other gases at bay. Small or smaller flying creatures or objects can't pass through the wall. Loose, lightweight materials brought into the wall fly upward. Arrows, bolts, and other ordinary projectiles launched at targets behind the wall are deflected upward and automatically miss. (Boulders hurled by Giants or siege engines, and similar projectiles, are unaffected.) Creatures in gaseous form can't pass through it.

materials.value: A tiny fan and a feather of exotic origin

Undead Fortitude.name: Undead Fortitude
Undead Fortitude.description: If damage reduces the [[lookup @name lowercase]] to 0 Hit Points, it makes a Constitution saving throw (DC 5 plus the damage taken) unless the damage is Radiant or from a Critical Hit. On a successful save, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] drops to 1 Hit Point instead.

The Chained Reaper.name: The Chained Reaper
The Chained Reaper.description:
The Chained Reaper

Burdened Harbinger of Death

Habitat: Any

The Chained Reaper is all that remains of a once-noble orc caretaker of the departed called Yorgrim. Having been corrupted by the mists of death known as the Shroud, the Chained Reaper is a being of hatred and bitterness, striving to cremate all living things in its balefire before binding them in chains of anguish.

Secret. The Chained Reaper carries a memorial stone upon its back. If one can read aloud the names inscribed there, their purity will burn away the reaper’s fury.

The Chained Reaper’s Lair

The Chained Reaper’s lair is a mausoleum holding its own empty grave and those of its former companions.

The region containing the Chained Reaper’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Chained Vitality. A creature that isn’t a Construct or Undead that finishes a long rest within 1 mile of the lair must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by 5 (to a minimum of 1 HP) until it next finishes a long rest.

Falling Shroud. Thin mist arises within 1 mile of the lair. Undead with the Incorporeal Movement trait in that area have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

If the Chained Reaper dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The reaper makes one [[/item Balefire Scythe]] attack and one [[/item Chain]] attack, and it uses either Chain Slam or Fling.

Balefire Scythe.name: Balefire Scythe
Balefire Scythe.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target begins burning.  It takes Necrotic damage instead of Fire damage while burning in this way.

Chain.name: Chain
Chain.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 20 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 15) from one of four chains.

Chain Slam.name: Chain Slam
Chain Slam.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature Grappled by the reaper.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[Stunned apply=false] condition until the start of the reaper’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Etherealness.name: Etherealness
Etherealness.description: The reaper casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplEtherealne]{Etherealness} spell, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability. The reaper is visible on the Material Plane while on the Border Ethereal and vice versa, but it can’t affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

Fling.name: Fling
Fling.description:
The reaper throws a Large or smaller creature Grappled by it to a space it can see within 30 feet of itself that isn’t in the air.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 17, the creature thrown and each creature in the destination space.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Success: Half damage only.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The reaper can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The reaper regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Drift.name: Drift
Drift.description: The reaper moves up to half its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

Lantern Flare.name: Lantern Flare
Lantern Flare.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature of the reaper's choice in a 20-foot Emanation originating from it.

Failure: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

OHVlJAW5yCCg3sht.name: Balefire Scythe
OHVlJAW5yCCg3sht.description: The reaper makes one [[/item Balefire Scythe]] attack. The reaper can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Chained Reaper’s lair is a mausoleum holding its own empty grave and those of its former companions. The region containing the Chained Reaper’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Chained Reaper dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Chained Vitality.name: Chained Vitality
Chained Vitality.description: A creature that isn’t a Construct or Undead that finishes a long rest within 1 mile of the lair must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by 5 (to a minimum of 1 HP) until it next finishes a long rest.

Falling Shroud.name: Falling Shroud
Falling Shroud.description: Thin mist arises within 1 mile of the lair. Undead with the Incorporeal Movement trait in that area have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

Ancestral Shame.name: Ancestral Shame
Ancestral Shame.description: If a creature that can speak Orc within 30 feet of the reaper takes an action to read aloud the names carved in the stone on the reaper’s back, the reaper takes 20 radiant damage.

Ethereal Sight.name: Ethereal Sight
Ethereal Sight.description: The reaper can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The reaper can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the reaper fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Wrapped Chains.name: Wrapped Chains
Wrapped Chains.description: The reaper is wrapped in ghostly chains. It adds its Charisma modifier to its AC instead of Dexterity.

LdrqF10ZINeFS8Mf.name: Etherealness
LdrqF10ZINeFS8Mf.description:
You step into the border regions of the Ethereal Plane, in the area where it overlaps with your current plane. You remain in the Border Ethereal for the Duration or until you use your action to dismiss the spell. During this time, you can move in any direction. If you move up or down, every foot of Movement costs an extra foot. You can see and hear the plane you originated from, but everything there looks gray, and you can't see anything more than 60 feet away.

While on the Ethereal Plane, you can only affect and be affected by other creatures on that plane. Creatures that aren't on the Ethereal Plane can't perceive you and can't interact with you, unless a special ability or magic has given them the ability to do so.

You ignore all Objects and Effects that aren't on the Ethereal Plane, allowing you to move through objects you perceive on the plane you originated from.

When the spell ends, you immediately return to the plane you originated from in the spot you currently occupy. If you occupy the same spot as a solid object or creature when this happens, you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space that you can occupy and take force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved.

This spell has no effect if you cast it while you are on the Ethereal Plane or a plane that doesn't border it, such as one of the Outer Planes.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you can target up to three willing creatures (including you) for each slot level above 7th. The creatures must be within 10 feet of you when you cast the spell.

3JNsjsgUK8kJEvsc.name: Etherealness
3JNsjsgUK8kJEvsc.description:
You step into the border regions of the Ethereal Plane, where it overlaps with your current plane. You remain in the Border Ethereal for the duration. During this time, you can move in any direction. If you move up or down, every foot of movement costs an extra foot. You can perceive the plane you left, which looks gray, and you can't see anything there more than 60 feet away.

While on the Ethereal Plane, you can affect and be affected only by creatures, objects, and effects on that plane. Creatures that aren't on the Ethereal Plane can't perceive or interact with you unless a feature gives them the ability to do so.

When the spell ends, you return to the plane you left in the spot that corresponds to your space in the Border Ethereal. If you appear in an occupied space, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and take Force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved.

This spell ends instantly if you cast it while you are on the Ethereal Plane or a plane that doesn't border it, such as one of the Outer Planes.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.You can target up to three willing creatures (including yourself) for each spell slot level above 7. The creatures must be within 10 feet of you when you cast the spell.

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

Deepdreck.name: Deepdreck
Deepdreck.description:
Deepdreck

Poisoned Subterranean Wretch

Habitat: Underground

Deepdrecks were miners long ago who found themselves far too deep beneath the earth, where they were cursed and corrupted by deforming powers. Now they tunnel and dig greedily, bloated with poisonous gases.

Astute observers have noted that these monsters occasionally bear a resemblance to missing loved ones who have long been thought dead.

Secret. The toxic essence of deepdrecks is disrupted by pleasant scents such as flowers, perfume, spices, or incense.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The deepdreck makes two attacks, using [[/item Claw]] or [[/item Putrid Emission]] in any combination.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] hit, reach 5 ft., one target., Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Putrid Emission.name: Putrid Emission
Putrid Emission.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target is &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] until the start of the deepdreck’s next turn.

Explosive Death.name: Explosive Death
Explosive Death.description: When the deepdreck dies, it explodes, and each creature within 15 feet of it must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 ([[/r 3d8]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Fragrance Aversion.name: Fragrance Aversion
Fragrance Aversion.description: The deepdreck has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws while within 10 feet of burning incense or a creature wearing Perfume.

Tunneler.name: Tunneler
Tunneler.description: The deepdreck can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 5-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

Spy.name: Spy
Spy.description:

Crowstorm.name: Crowstorm
Crowstorm.description:
Crowstorm

Fiendish Murder

Habitat: Grassland, Planar (Lower Planes), Urban

A crowstorm is a great, swirling mass of dark feathers accompanied constant, harshly malevolent crow calls. Hundreds of fiendish birds fly in unison, their beady eyes dripping blood as they swoop down to tear at the flesh of their victims. A crowstorm’s horrific caws mingle into an eerie cacophony of pleading whispers, and it robs the gift of flight from anything that draws too close.

Secret. While they might take the form of crows or possess crow bodies, crowstorms are held at bay by drawn images or crafted effigies of crows.

Peck.name: Peck
Peck.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, or 7 ([[/r 1d8 + 3]]) piercing damage if the swarm has half its hit points or fewer. If the target is a creature, it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of the swarm’s next turn.

Cacophony.name: Cacophony
Cacophony.description: Each creature within 30 feet of the swarm must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) psychic damage and is &Reference[Frightened apply=false] until the start of the swarm’s next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

False Crows.name: False Crows
False Crows.description: The swarm can’t enter a space with a drawn or painted image or crafted effigy of a crow. A creature holding such an icon has advantage on saving throws the swarm forces it to make.

Swarm.name: Swarm
Swarm.description: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny crow. The swarm can’t regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

Wing Bind.name: Wing Bind
Wing Bind.description: Each creature (other than a Fiend) with a flying speed that starts its turn within 30 feet of the swarm must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or have its flying speed reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn.

Knight.name: Knight
Knight.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Plate Armor.name: Plate Armor
Plate Armor.description: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The knight makes two melee attacks.

Greatsword.name: Greatsword
Greatsword.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+5 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

Heavy Crossbow.name: Heavy Crossbow
Heavy Crossbow.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) piercing damage.

Leadership.name: Leadership
Leadership.description: For 1 minute, the knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 ft. of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is incapacitated.

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee Attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

Brave.name: Brave
Brave.description: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

Phantom Hearse.name: Phantom Hearse
Phantom Hearse.description:
Phantom Hearse

Ghostly Coach of the Dead

Habitat: Any

Treasure: Any

Phantom hearses are ghostly carriages complete with horses and coachmen—amalgamations of tormented souls driven to claim the living and drag them to the land of the dead.

The spirit coachmen strike with phantom whips and weapons, and even fly out to harry foes at a distance, while the ghostly horses drive the hearse in a crushing charge that gathers victims and seals them into a spectral coffin that drains the warmth and vitality from flesh and bone. The tolling bell on the carriage precedes the apparition’s appearance, and its sepulchral sound has caused more than a few witnesses to drop dead on the spot.

Secret. Phantom hearses are driven to collect the living, and they can’t see a living creature that holds its breath.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The hearse makes two [[/item Ghostly Coachman]] attacks. It can replace one of the attacks with a use of [[/item Trample]], if available.

Ghostly Coachman.name: Ghostly Coachman
Ghostly Coachman.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 10 ft. or range 60 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a creature, it can’t regain Hit Points until the start of the hearse’s next turn.

Trample.name: Trample
Trample.description:
The hearse moves in a straight line up to its Speed.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature whose space the hearse enters during this action.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it has the &reference[grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 14), and it has the &reference[restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Success: Half damage only.

Tolling Bell.name: Tolling Bell
Tolling Bell.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature of the hearse’s choice that it can see in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the hearse.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the creature’s Speed is halved until the start of the hearse’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Entomb.name: Entomb
Entomb.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC 16, one creature &reference[grappled apply=false] by the hearse (it can have up to three creatures entombed at a time).

Failure: The target is entombed in a coffin in the hearse, and the Grappled condition ends. An entombed target has the &reference[blinded apply=false] and &reference[restrained apply=false conditions, has Total Cover against attacks and other effects outside the hearse, and at the start of each of the hearse's turns it takes [[/damage average]] damage and gains 1 &reference[exhaustion apply=false] level.

If the hearse takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside a coffin, the hearse must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or release all entombed creatures, each of which falls in a space within 5 feet of the hearse and has the &reference[prone apply=false] condition.

If the hearse dies, any entombed creature falls to the ground with the &reference[prone apply=false] condition in the hearse’s former space.

Breathless Warding.name: Breathless Warding
Breathless Warding.description: A creature holding its breath has the &reference[invisible apply=false] condition to the hearse. If the creature takes damage while holding its breath, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or let out its breath and become visible to the hearse until the start of the creature’s next turn, when it can hold its breath again.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The hearse can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes [[/damage average]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Hemonculus.name: Hemonculus
Hemonculus.description:
Hemonculus

Sanguine Servitor (Fresh blood and gem dust)

Habitat: Planar (Lower Planes)

Treasure: None

Hemonculus are servitors created by a blood magic ritual that binds a fiendish spirit into a blood-formed body. For the cost of a small sacrifice in blood (the creator’s own or otherwise), the creatures serve as spies and assist in procuring further blood for magical use.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description:
Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]] reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the hemonculus attaches to the target. While attached, the hemonculus automatically hits the target with its Claw attacks.

The hemonculus can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement.

The target or a creature within 5 feet of it can detach the hemonculus as an action.

Exsanguinate.name: Exsanguinate
Exsanguinate.description:
The hemonculus magically draws blood from nearby creatures.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature of the hemonculus’ choice in a 15-foot Emanation originating from the hemonculus.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target can’t regain Hit Points until the start of the hemonculus’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Success or Failure: If the hemonculus is attached to a creature, the hemonculus regains Hit Points equal to the Necrotic damage taken by that target.

Blood Sense.name: Blood Sense
Blood Sense.description: The hemonculus knows the location of any Bloodied creature within 60 feet of it, unless the creature is a Construct or Undead.

Flyby.name: Flyby
Flyby.description: The hemonculus doesn’t provoke an Opportunity Attack when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The hemonculus has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmRottingTouch00]] attacks.

Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
Leather Armor.description: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

Keen Hearing and Sight.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
Keen Hearing and Sight.description: The scout has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

Club.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Training.name: Training
Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has proficiency in one skill of the DM's choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

Divine Aid.name: Divine Aid
Divine Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpiritGuar]{Spirit Guardians}

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .hRwqUlEyM9TjOmHy]] or [[/item .mmRadiantFlame00]] in any combination.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. Choose the command from these options:

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target has the Prone condition and then ends its turn.

Halt. On its turn, the target doesn't move and takes no action or Bonus Action.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can affect one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpiritualW]{Spiritual Weapon} spell, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

The Jinxed Leviathan.name: The Jinxed Leviathan
The Jinxed Leviathan.description:
The Jinxed Leviathan

Curse-Wrought Swamp Monster

Habitat: Coastal, Swamp

Once a normal alligator that dwelled in a cursed swamp, the Jinxed Leviathan was warped by the strange hexes and twisted spells of nefarious magicians who sought to defeat the deathly spirit known as Snake Eye Jack. Growing to colossal proportions and infusing with the essence of misfortune itself, the Monstrosity could not be controlled and devoured its makers. Now, it lurks in the still, black water of hexed bayous, always seeking its next meal, upon which it unleashes its jinxcraft before feasting.

Secret. An idol of the fabled deal maker Snake Eye Jack that has been blessed by one of Jack’s followers can turn the Jinxed Leviathan’s own cursed power against it.

The Jinxed Leviathan’s Lair

The Jinxed Leviathan’s lair is a cursed swamp steeped in confounding magic. If encountered in its lair, the Jinxed Leviathan has a challenge rating of 24 (62,000 XP).

The region containing the Jinxed Leviathan’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Hanging Hex. Within 1 mile of the lair, when a creature other than the Jinxed Leviathan rolls a 1 or a 20 on an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, the next ability check, attack roll, or saving throw the creature makes has disadvantage, and it can’t have advantage.

Murky Waters. Within 1 mile of the lair, swamp water is cloudy and shows fleeting faces in the murk. Creatures in the water have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

If the Jinxed Leviathan dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The leviathan makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and one [[/item Tail]] attack.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. The target is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] (escape DC 20), and until the grapple ends, the target is &Reference[Restrained apply=false].

Tail.name: Tail
Tail.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and if the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false] and is pushed up to 20 feet straight away from the leviathan.

Accursed Breath.name: Accursed Breath
Accursed Breath.description: The leviathan breathes magenta light in a 120-foot-long, 10-foot-wide line. Each creature in that area must make a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 78 ([[/r 12d12]]) necrotic damage and is cursed. The cursed target has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws, and it can’t regain hit points. The target can end the curse early if it voluntarily fails a saving throw forced by one of its enemies. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

Swallow.name: Swallow
Swallow.description: One Large or smaller creature &Reference[Grappled apply=false] by the leviathan must make a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it is swallowed and no longer &Reference[Grappled apply=false]. A swallowed creature is &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Restrained apply=false], it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the leviathan, and it takes 24 ([[/r 7d6]]) force damage at the start of each of the leviathan’s turns. The leviathan can have up to four creatures swallowed at a time. If the leviathan takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the leviathan must succeed on a DC 25 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which falls in a space within 10 feet of the leviathan and is knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false]. If the leviathan dies, any swallowed creature is no longer &Reference[Restrained apply=false] and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The leviathan can take 3 legendary actions (4 in Lair), choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The leviathan regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Swamp Surge.name: Swamp Surge
Swamp Surge.description: The leviathan causes a swell of muddy water and grasping roots to fill the area within 20 feet of it. Each creature within that area must make a DC 20 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 21 ([[/r 6d6]]) bludgeoning damage, and its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

Tail Sweep.name: Tail Sweep
Tail Sweep.description: The leviathan moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and makes one [[/item Tail]] attack.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Jinxed Leviathan’s lair is a cursed swamp steeped in confounding magic. If encountered in its lair, the Jinxed Leviathan has a challenge rating of 24 (62,000 XP). The region containing the Jinxed Leviathan’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Jinxed Leviathan dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Hanging Hex.name: Hanging Hex
Hanging Hex.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, when a creature other than the Jinxed Leviathan rolls a 1 or a 20 on an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, the next ability check, attack roll, or saving throw the creature makes has disadvantage, and it can’t have advantage.

Murky Waters.name: Murky Waters
Murky Waters.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, swamp water is cloudy and shows fleeting faces in the murk. Creatures in the water have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

Jinxed Hide.name: Jinxed Hide
Jinxed Hide.description: When a creature within 60 feet of the leviathan hits it with an attack roll or targets it with a spell, the creature must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or become cursed until the end of its next turn. The cursed creature has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws and can’t regain hit points.

Amphibious.name: Amphibious
Amphibious.description: The leviathan can breathe air and water.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the leviathan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Returned Curse.name: Returned Curse
Returned Curse.description: If the leviathan curses a creature holding an idol of Snake Eye Jack blessed by one of his devoted followers, the creature is unaffected by the curse. The leviathan then takes 20 radiant damage and has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of its next turn.

Crimson Clergy.name: Crimson Clergy
Crimson Clergy.description:
Crimson Clergy

Vampiric Zealot

Habitat: Any

Treasure: Relics

Crimson clergy are Undead cultists, often created, led, and taught by a more powerful vampire. Crimson clergy view the consumption of blood—and in its use during their rituals and when casting spells—not only as necessary but sacred. Their hunger reaches beyond the limits of their fangs and claws, calling to the blood of their victims and drawing it out in scarlet ribbons.

Secret. Crimson clergy struggle to accept how monstrous they have become. They can’t stand the sight of themselves and see their true visage in their reflection.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
Spellcasting. The clergy casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):

At Will: Disguise Self, Thaumaturgy

Consume.name: Consume
Consume.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. The target’s Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken, and the clergy regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

Crimson Blessing.name: Crimson Blessing
Crimson Blessing.description: The clergy casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8dzaICjGy6mTUaUr] using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The clergy can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures of your choice within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target can roll 1d4 and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

Vampire Weaknesses.name: Vampire Weaknesses
Vampire Weaknesses.description:
The clergy has the following weaknesses:

Self-Loathing. The clergy has Disadvantage on D20 Tests if it can see its reflection.

Sunlight Hypersensitivity. The clergy takes [[/damage average]] damage if it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Disguise Self.name: Disguise Self
Disguise Self.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear heavier or lighter. You must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs as you have. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC.

Disguised.name: Disguised
Disguised.description: To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv]] check against your spell save DC.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Lxhn4YfR1xnV4mbD.name: Bless
Lxhn4YfR1xnV4mbD.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Bayou Beast.name: Bayou Beast
Bayou Beast.description:
Bayou Beast

Spirit Hex-Bound to the Swamp

Habitat: Swamp

Bayou beasts are elemental spirits bound into great mounds of swamp plant matter through jinxcraft magic. These hulks obey their creators unfailingly, often lingering long after their death and carrying out their final orders. The hexed seals, fashioned from carved trinkets and masks, that trap the spirit in its form impart their curse on the creature’s enemies.

Secret. The jinxcraft seals can be washed away with alcohol, hindering and even destroying the bayou beast.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The elemental makes two [[/item Hexed Slam]] attacks.

Hexed Slam.name: Hexed Slam
Hexed Slam.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be cursed until the start of the elemental’s next turn. While cursed, the creature subtracts [[/r 1d4]] from its attack rolls and saving throws.

Swamp Grasp.name: Swamp Grasp
Swamp Grasp.description: Swamp water and plants roil on the ground or a liquid surface within 20 feet of the elemental. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or take 11 ([[/r 2d10]]) poison damage, and the target is &Reference[Restrained apply=false] for 1 minute, until the elemental becomes &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false], or until the elemental dies. The target or a creature within 5 feet of it can take an action to make a DC 16 Strength (Athletics) check, ending the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition on the target on a success

Spirits Susceptibility.name: Spirits Susceptibility
Spirits Susceptibility.description: The elemental takes 9 ([[/r 2d8]]) force damage for every bottle of alcohol splashed onto it, and its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is [[lookup @activation.condition activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]]. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] adds [[lookup @roll.formula activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]] to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Use.condition: hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon

The Horned King.name: The Horned King
The Horned King.description:
The Horned King

Sin Made Manifest

Habitat: Forest, Planar (Lower Planes)

Every sinful, selfish action in the world pours a fraction of itself into the Horned King, a being composed of every mortal who has surrendered to temptation. Fortunately, under normal circumstances, the Horned King exists as an ephemeral spirit with no physical presence. During times of upheaval, when a great many mortals give in to their selfish desires or when another power—such as a deity, demon lord, or archfey—interferes, the Horned King is made manifest, and with it comes the weight of sin flooding back into the world that created it.

The Horned King’s Lair

The Horned King’s lair is the forest clearing where a twisted tree focuses the malevolent will that gave rise to the king’s physical presence.

The region containing the Horned King’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Sweet Temptation. Within 1 mile of the lair, a creature that acts on a sinful impulse to the detriment of a friendly or indifferent creature increases its hit point maximum and current hit points by 10 until it finishes a long rest. Creatures are aware of this effect. This can’t occur again for that creature until it finishes a long rest.

Tenacious Curses. Within 1 mile of the lair, saving throws against curses have disadvantage.

If the Horned King dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Horned King makes three [[/item Cursed Strike]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Terrorizing Breath]].

Cursed Strike.name: Cursed Strike
Cursed Strike.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]] (against a cursed target, scores a Critical Hit on a 19 or 20 on the d20), reach 10 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage (Horned King’s choice for the bludgeoning, piercing or slashing portion). If the target is a creature, it is cursed until the end of the Horned King's next turn. While cursed, it must subtract [[/r 1d4]] from D20 Tests.

Breath Of Corruption.name: Breath Of Corruption
Breath Of Corruption.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 19, each creature in a 60-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target gains 1 &reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level that ends at the end of the target’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Terrorizing Breath.name: Terrorizing Breath
Terrorizing Breath.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 19, each creature in a 60-foot Cone.

Failure: The target has the &reference[Frightened apply=false] condition. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The Horned King can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The Horned King regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Taste of Wickedness.name: Taste of Wickedness
Taste of Wickedness.description:
The Horned King’s snakelike tongue whips out hungrily.

Charisma Saving Throw: DC 20, one cursed creature the Horned King can see within 15 feet.

Failure: The target takes [[/damage average]] damage, the Horned King regains Hit Points equal to the damage taken, and one curse of the Horned King’s choice affecting the target ends.

Temptation.name: 诱惑
Temptation.description: 角冠王对其视野内120尺范围内的一名生物低语，提供英雄激励或为其恢复20点生命值。若该生物接受，它将获得相应效益但会陷入诅咒缠身状态，持续1分钟。在诅咒持续期间，角冠王对目标造成的全部伤害具有抗性。角冠王在其下个回合开始前无法再次执行此动作。

Trample.name: 践踏
Trample.description: 角王移动至多一半速度，并发动一次[[/item Cursed Strike]]攻击。角王在其下个回合开始前无法再次执行此动作。

Lair Actions.name: 巢穴动作
Lair Actions.description: 角王的巢穴是一片林间空地，那里的一棵扭曲树木集中了赋予国王实体形态的恶意意志。包含角王巢穴的区域因其存在而发生改变，产生以下效果： 如果角王死亡或将巢穴移至他处，这些效果立即终止。

Sweet Temptation.name: 甜蜜诱惑
Sweet Temptation.description: 在巢穴1英里范围内，若一个生物基于罪恶冲动行事，对友善或冷漠生物造成损害，则其生命值上限和当前生命值增加10点，直至完成一次长休。生物知晓此效果。该生物在完成一次长休前无法再次触发此效果。

Tenacious Curses.name: 顽固诅咒
Tenacious Curses.description: 在巢穴1英里范围内，对抗诅咒的豁免检定具有劣势。

Sense Desire.name: 感知欲望
Sense Desire.description: 角王施放@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{侦测思想}，无需任何法术部件并使用魅力作为施法关键属性（法术豁免DC 20）。

Enduring Restoration.name: 持久恢复
Enduring Restoration.description: 若角王死亡，其躯体会在一阵灰烬中消散。它会化作其家园森林中一道无形的隐形精魄，且在[[/r 10d10]]年内无法重塑新的肉身。

Legendary Resistance.name: 传奇抗性
Legendary Resistance.description: 如果角王豁免失败时，可以将其改为豁免成功。

Magic Resistance.name: 魔法抗性
Magic Resistance.description: 角王在为抵抗法术或其他魔法效应而作的豁免上具有优势。

Detect Thoughts.name: 侦测思想
Detect Thoughts.description:
在此法术的持续时间内，你可以读取特定生物的思想。当你施展该法术时，以及在此法术终止前的每个回合中作为你的动作，你可以将你的意念集中在你能看到的、位于你30尺范围内的任何一个生物上。如果你选择的生物的智力为3或更低，或者不会说任何语言，则该生物不受影响。

你最初会得知该生物的表层思想——即那一刻它脑海中最重要的念头。作为一个动作，你可以将你的注意力转移到另一个生物的思想上，或者尝试更深入地探查同一生物的思维。如果你进行深入探查，目标必须进行一次感知豁免。若豁免失败，你会洞悉它的推理过程（如果有的话）、它的情绪状态，以及它脑海中挥之不去的某个重要事物（例如它所担忧、热爱或憎恨的事物）。若豁免成功，则法术终止。无论哪种情况，目标都会知道你正在探查它的思维，并且除非你将注意力转移到另一个生物的思想上，否则该生物可以在其回合中用一个动作进行一次智力检定，与你进行的智力检定对抗；如果它胜出，则法术终止。

口头向目标生物提出的问题自然会引导其思绪的走向，因此该法术在审讯过程中尤其有效。

你也可以使用该法术来侦测你无法看到的、具有思考能力的生物的存在。当你在持续时间内施展该法术或作为你的动作时，你可以搜索你周围30尺范围内的思想。该法术可以穿透障碍物，但2尺厚的岩石、2英寸厚的除铅以外的任何金属，或一层薄薄的铅板会阻挡你。你无法侦测到智力为3或更低，或不会说任何语言的生物。

一旦你以这种方式侦测到一个生物的存在，你就可以在此法术的剩余持续时间内如上所述读取它的思想，即使你无法看到它，但它必须仍然在范围内。

OfCdNKvPp2QGh1j1.name: 侦测思想
OfCdNKvPp2QGh1j1.description:
你激活下列效果之一。在该法术持续期间，你可以在之后的回合中以一个魔法动作激活任一效果。

感知思想。 你能感知到30尺内知晓语言或具有心灵感应能力的生物的思想存在。你并非读取思想，但能感知到有思考能力的生物存在。

该法术会被1尺厚的石头、泥土或木材，1英寸厚的金属，或薄铅板所阻挡。

读取思想。 指定一个你能看到的30尺内的单一生物，或是你通过感知思想选项侦测到的30尺内的单一生物。你将获悉目标当前最主要的思绪。若目标不懂任何语言且不具备心灵感应能力，你将一无所获。

在你下一回合中，你可以以一个魔法动作尝试深入探查目标的思想。若进行深入探查，目标需进行一次感知豁免。豁免失败时，你将洞悉目标的推理过程、情感状态以及其心中最强烈的执念（例如忧虑、爱恋或憎恨）。豁免成功则法术终止。无论何种结果，目标都会察觉你正在探查其思想，且在你将注意力从目标思想移开前，目标可以在其回合动用一个动作进行[[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]]检定对抗你的法术豁免DC，检定成功则法术终止。

The Jailbird.name: 囚鸟
The Jailbird.description:
迷途怨魂

被悔恨束缚的迷失灵魂

栖息地: 任意

宝藏: 无

迷途怨魂是困在生者与亡者领域之间的不安精魄。无论是诅咒还是前世未解的冲突，怨魂在未尽之事解决前都无法安息。

怨魂仅会显露生前身份的零星痕迹，呈现出与无法释怀的伤痛或失落相关的象征形态。它们往往永恒重复着单调行为——通常是模仿生前动作或重演悲伤往事。被激怒时，它们会爆发出不稳定的脾气，用束缚其精魄的悲痛与彷徨化作毁灭性的冲击。

秘密. 若被诱骗或强迫穿过空瓶，迷途怨魂会被困于瓶中。

Bottle Trap.name: 瓶子陷阱
Bottle Trap.description: 任何进入直立空瓶空间的怨灵必须进行一次DC 16的魅力豁免，若失败则会被吸入瓶中，同时瓶口会出现软木塞或瓶盖将其封闭。被困的怨灵可以透过瓶子看到和听到10尺范围内的动静，该范围内的任何生物也能听见怨灵的声音。若瓶子破裂或其他生物打开瓶塞，怨灵便会获得释放。

Incorporeal Movement.name: 虚体移动
Incorporeal Movement.description: 鬼魂可以穿过其他生物和物件，如同穿过困难地形。若它在固体物件内结束回合，将受到[[/damage average]]伤害。

Draining Regret.name: 汲能悔恨
Draining Regret.description: 近战攻击检定: [[/attack]], 触及5尺. 命中: [[/damage average]]伤害, 且目标获得1级&reference[exhaustion apply=false]. 这无法使目标的力竭等级超过5, 且所有通过此动作获得的力竭等级将在目标完成一次短休或长休时结束, 或如果它受到一个@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.F0GsG0SJzsIOacwV]{次级复原术}法术或类似魔法

Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]。 [[/damage average extended]]。

Petrifying Gaze.name: 石化凝视
Petrifying Gaze.description:
体质豁免： DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=mN9aF1WkHQWLIN4B]]，每个[[lookup @target.affects.type activity=mN9aF1WkHQWLIN4B]]位于[[lookup @target.template.size activity=mN9aF1WkHQWLIN4B]]尺[[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=mN9aF1WkHQWLIN4B]]内。若[[lookup @name lowercase]]在[[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=mN9aF1WkHQWLIN4B]]中看见自身倒影，则[[lookup @name lowercase]]必须进行此豁免。

首次失败： 目标获得&Reference[Restrained apply=false]状态，若其仍处于束缚状态则于下个回合结束时重复豁免，成功则终止自身效应。

再次失败： 目标获得&Reference[Petrified apply=false]状态以替代束缚状态。

Restrained.name: 束缚
Restrained.description: 目标获得&Reference[Restrained apply=false]状态，如果它仍然处于束缚状态，则在其下一回合结束时重复豁免，成功则自行结束该效果。

Petrified.name: 石化
Petrified.description: 目标获得 &Reference[Petrified apply=false] 状态而非束缚状态。

Hide Armor.name: 兽皮甲
Hide Armor.description: 这种粗糙的护甲由厚实的毛皮制成。通常被野蛮人部落、邪恶类人生物以及其他缺乏制造精良护甲所需工具和材料的族群所穿着。

Reckless.name: 鲁莽
Reckless.description: 在其回合开始时，该狂战士可以在该回合内使其全部近战武器攻击检定具有优势，但针对它的攻击检定也具有优势，直到其下一回合开始。

Greataxe.name: 巨斧
Greataxe.description: 近战武器攻击:+5命中,, 5尺, 单一目标。命中: 9 (1d12 + 3) 挥砍伤害。

4hGJOuAps5FC729H.name: 锁链死神
4hGJOuAps5FC729H.description:
锁链收割者

背负宿命的死亡先驱

栖息地: 全部

锁链收割者曾是名为约尔格林的兽人亡者守护者，如今只剩下这副残骸。被名为裹尸布的死亡之雾腐蚀后，锁链收割者成为怨恨与苦痛的化身，致力于用其怨火焚尽所有生灵，再用痛苦锁链束缚它们。

秘密. 锁链收割者背负着一块纪念石。若能大声念出石上铭刻的名字，其纯净之力将燃尽收割者的狂怒。

锁链收割者的巢穴

锁链收割者的巢穴是一座陵墓，其中安放着它自己的空棺以及昔日同伴的墓穴。

锁链收割者的存在会改变其巢穴周边区域，产生以下效果:

锁链生机. 非构装生物或亡灵的生物在巢穴1英里内完成长休时，必须进行一次DC15体质豁免，若失败则其生命值上限减少5点（最低降至1点生命值），直至下一次完成长休。

垂降裹尸布. 巢穴1英里内会升起薄雾。该区域内具有虚体移动特性的亡灵在进行敏捷（隐匿）检定时具有优势。

若锁链收割者死亡或将巢穴迁至他处，这些效果立即终止。

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击Multiattack。
Multiattack.description: 收割者发动一次[[/item Balefire Scythe]]攻击和一次[[/item Chain]]攻击，并使用链缚猛击或投掷。

Balefire Scythe.name: 灾厄镰刀
Balefire Scythe.description: 近战武器攻击： [[/attack]] 命中，触及15尺，单一目标。命中：[[/damage average]] 伤害，且目标开始被怨火燃烧。在火焰5尺范围内的生物未用一个动作扑灭火焰前，目标在其每回合开始时受到2（[[/r 1d4]]）暗蚀伤害。

Chain.name: 链甲
Chain.description: 近战武器攻击: [[/attack]] 命中, 触及20尺, 单一目标。命中: [[/damage average]] 伤害。如果目标是大型或更小的生物, 它会被四条锁链中的一条&Reference[Grappled apply=false] (逃脱DC 15)。

Chain Slam.name: 链击猛击
Chain Slam.description: 收割者将其锁链中的生物猛砸向彼此或环境。每个被收割者&Reference[Grappled apply=false]的生物必须进行一次DC 17体质豁免。豁免失败时，目标受到9（[[/r 1d8 + 5]]）钝击伤害并被&Reference[Stunned apply=false]直到收割者的下个回合开始。豁免成功时，目标仅受到一半伤害。

Etherealness.name: 以太化
Etherealness.description: 收割者施放@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.PQuEgKyCdovOvhqN], 无需任何法术部件并以魅力作为施法关键属性。收割者位于边界以太时在物质位面可见,反之亦然,但它无法影响另一侧位面的任何事物也不会被其影响。

Fling.name: 投掷
Fling.description: 死神将一个被它擒抱的大型或更小的生物投掷到它自身30尺内一个它能看见且不处于空中的空间。被投掷的生物和目的地空间内的每个生物都必须进行一次DC 17的敏捷豁免。豁免失败时，目标受到9（[[/r 2d8]]）钝击伤害并被击倒。豁免成功时，它仅受到一半伤害。

Legendary Actions.name: 传奇动作
Legendary Actions.description: 该收割者可以执行3次传奇动作，从下列选项中选择。每次只能使用一个传奇动作选项，且只能在另一生物回合结束时使用。收割者在其回合开始时恢复所有已消耗的传奇动作。

Drift.name: 漂移
Drift.description: 该收割者移动至多一半其速度，且不触发借机攻击。

Lantern Flare.name: 提灯闪耀
Lantern Flare.description: 收割者的提灯闪烁着怨火。由收割者选择的，位于其20尺范围内的每个生物必须进行一次DC 17的感知豁免，豁免失败则在其下一回合结束前，在进行属性检定和攻击掷骰时具有劣势。

OHVlJAW5yCCg3sht.name: 灾厄火焰镰刀
OHVlJAW5yCCg3sht.description: 该收割者发动一次[[/item Balefire Scythe]]攻击。

Lair Actions.name: 巢穴动作
Lair Actions.description: 锁链收割者的巢穴是一座陵墓，其中安放着它自己的空墓穴以及它昔日同伴们的墓穴。锁链收割者巢穴所在的区域因其存在而发生改变，产生以下效果： 如果锁链收割者死亡或将巢穴移至他处，这些效果立即终止。

Chained Vitality.name: 链锁活力
Chained Vitality.description: 在巢穴1英里范围内完成长休的非构装生物或亡灵生物，必须进行一次DC15的体质豁免，若失败则其生命值上限减少5点（最低降至1点生命值），直至其下一次完成长休。

Falling Shroud.name: 坠落帷幕
Falling Shroud.description: 巢穴1英里范围内升起薄雾。该区域内具有虚体移动特性的亡灵在敏捷（隐匿）检定中具有优势。

Ancestral Shame.name: 先祖之耻
Ancestral Shame.description: 如果一个能说兽人语的生物在收割者30尺范围内，用一个动作大声念出刻在收割者背上石头中的名字，收割者将受到20光耀伤害。

Ethereal Sight.name: 以太视界
Ethereal Sight.description: 当收割者位于物质位面时，它能看见以太位面内60尺的范围。

Incorporeal Movement.name: 虚体移动Incorporeal Movement。
Incorporeal Movement.description: 该收割者可以穿过其他生物和物件，如同它们是困难地形。如果它在物件内结束其回合，则受到5（[[/r 1d10]]）点力场伤害。

Legendary Resistance.name: 传奇抗性
Legendary Resistance.description: 如果收割者豁免失败时，可以将其改为豁免成功。

Wrapped Chains.name: 缠绕锁链
Wrapped Chains.description: 收割者被幽灵般的锁链缠绕。它将其魅力调整值而非敏捷调整值加到其护甲等级上。

LdrqF10ZINeFS8Mf.name: 以太化
LdrqF10ZINeFS8Mf.description:
你步入以太位面的边界区域，该区域与你当前所在的位面重叠。你将在法术持续时间内停留在边界以太中，或直到你使用动作解散该法术。在此期间，你可以向任意方向移动。若你向上或向下移动，每移动1尺需额外消耗1尺移动力。你可以看见和听见你所起源的位面，但那里的一切都呈现灰色，且你无法看见60尺外的任何事物。

身处以太位面时，你只能影响同样位于该位面的其他生物，且只会被它们影响。不在以太位面的生物无法感知你，也无法与你互动，除非其特殊能力或魔法赋予了它们此种能力。

你无视所有不在以太位面的物件和效应，使你能够穿过在起源位面所感知到的物件。

当法术终止时，你立即返回当前所处位置对应的起源位面。若此时你与固体物件或生物处于同一位置，你会被立即弹射至最近的可占据未占据空间，并受到等同于被弹射尺数两倍的力场伤害。

若你在以太位面或与其不相邻的位面（例如外层位面）施展该法术，则法术不产生任何效果。

升环施法效应。 当你使用7环以上法术位施展该法术时，每比7环高一环，你就能额外指定至多三个自愿生物（包括你自己）作为目标。这些生物在你施法时必须处于你周围10尺范围内。

Houndmaster Jaeger.name: 猎犬大师耶格尔
Houndmaster Jaeger.description:
代币艺术作品由 遗忘冒险提供。

代币艺术作品由 遗忘冒险提供。

Studded Leather Armor.name: 镶钉皮甲
Studded Leather Armor.description: 由坚韧而柔韧的皮革制成，镶钉皮甲通过密集的铆钉或尖刺进行加固。

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击Multiattack。
Multiattack.description: 船长发动三次近战攻击：两次弯刀攻击和一次匕首攻击。或船长发动两次匕首远程攻击。

Scimitar.name: 弯刀
Scimitar.description: 近战武器攻击：+5命中，, 5尺， 单一目标。命中：6（1d6 + 3）挥砍伤害。

Dagger.name: 匕首
Dagger.description: 近战或远程武器攻击：命中+5，触及5尺或射程20/60尺，单一目标。命中：5 (1d4 + 3) 点穿刺伤害。

Parry.name: 格挡
Parry.description: 船长对其AC增加2点，以对抗一次本将命中它的近战攻击。为此，船长必须能看到攻击者并持用一把近战武器。

Gilly Jenkin.name: 吉莉·詹金斯
Gilly Jenkin.description:
代币艺术作品由 遗忘冒险提供。

代币艺术作品由 遗忘冒险提供。

Club.name: 短棒
Club.description: 近战武器攻击：+2命中，，5尺，单一目标。命中：2（1d4）钝击伤害。

Training.name: 训练
Training.description: 该[[lookup @name lowercase]]在由DM选择的一项技能上具有熟练，并且每当它使用该技能进行属性检定时具有优势。

Club.name: 短棒
Club.description: [[/attack extended]]。 [[/damage average extended]]。

Will-o'-Wisp.name: 鬼火
Will-o'-Wisp.description: 代币艺术作品由遗忘冒险提供。

Ephemeral.name: 短暂
Ephemeral.description: 该[[lookup @name lowercase]]无法穿戴或携带任何物品。

Illumination.name: 照明
Illumination.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]]散发出20尺半径的明亮光照和额外20尺的微光光照。

Incorporeal Movement.name: 虚体移动
Incorporeal Movement.description: 该[[lookup @name lowercase]]可以穿过其他生物和物件，如同它们是&Reference[困难地形]。若它在物件内部结束其回合，则受到[[/damage 1d10 average type=force]]伤害。

Vanish.name: Vanish
Vanish.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] and its light have the &Reference[Invisible apply=false] condition until the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s &Reference[Concentration] ends on this effect, which ends early immediately after the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes an attack roll or uses Consume Life.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The attacking creature and its light have the &Reference[Invisible apply=false] condition until their Concentration ends on this effect, which ends early immediately after the wisp makes an attack roll or uses the Consume Life bonus action.

Consume Life.name: Consume Life
Consume Life.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=1Hy8CdhpwQlLxDPq]], [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=1Hy8CdhpwQlLxDPq]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=1Hy8CdhpwQlLxDPq]] feet. that has 0 Hit Points.

Failure: The target dies, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains [[/healing average activity=1waYTjY3NAIGZgrI]].

Failure: Dead.name: Failure: Dead
Failure: Dead.description: The target dies if the creature that is at 0 Hit Points fails a Constitution save.

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is [[lookup @activation.condition activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]]. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] adds [[lookup @roll.formula activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]] to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Use.name: Use
Use.condition: hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .mmVineStaff00000]] or [[/item .mmVerdantWisp000]] in any combination.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDruidcraft]{Druidcraft}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpeakwithA]{Speak with Animals}

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplEntangle00]{Entangle}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThunderwav]{Thunderwave}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplAnimalMess]{Animal Messenger}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLongstride]{Longstrider}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMoonbeam00]{Moonbeam}

Druidcraft.name: Druidcraft
Druidcraft.description:
Whispering to the spirits of nature, you create one of the following effects within range.

Weather Sensor. You create a Tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round.

Bloom. You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom.

Sensory Effect. You create a harmless sensory effect, such as falling leaves, spectral dancing fairies, a gentle breeze, the sound of an animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot Cube.

Fire Play. You light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a campfire.

Speak with Animals.name: Speak with Animals
Speak with Animals.description:
For the duration, you can comprehend and verbally communicate with Beasts, and you can use any of the Influence action's skill options with them.

Most Beasts have little to say about topics that don't pertain to survival or companionship, but at minimum, a Beast can give you information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever it has perceived within the past day.

Thunderwave.name: Thunderwave
Thunderwave.description:
You unleash a wave of thunderous energy. Each creature in a 15-foot Cube originating from you makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d8 Thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

In addition, unsecured objects that are entirely within the Cube are pushed 10 feet away from you, and a thunderous boom is audible within 300 feet.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Entangle.name: Entangle
Entangle.description:
Grasping plants sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into &Reference[difficultterrain]. They disappear when the spell ends.

Each creature (other than you) in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the &Reference[restrained apply=false] condition until the spell ends. A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Animal Messenger.name: Animal Messenger
Animal Messenger.description:
A Tiny Beast of your choice that you can see within range must succeed on a Charisma saving throw, or it attempts to deliver a message for you (if the target's Challenge Rating isn't 0, it automatically succeeds). You specify a location you have visited and a recipient who matches a general description, such as "a person dressed in the uniform of the town guard" or "a red-haired dwarf wearing a pointed hat." You also communicate a message of up to twenty-five words. The Beast travels for the duration toward the specified location, covering about 25 miles per 24 hours or 50 miles if the Beast can fly.

When the Beast arrives, it delivers your message to the creature that you described, mimicking your communication. If the Beast doesn't reach its destination before the spell ends, the message is lost, and the Beast returns to where you cast the spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell's duration increases by 48 hours for each spell slot level above 2.

Carrying Message.name: Carrying Message
Carrying Message.description:
The Beast travels for the duration toward the specified location, covering about 25 miles per 24 hours or 50 miles if the Beast can fly.

When the Beast arrives, it delivers your message to the creature that you described, mimicking your communication. If the Beast doesn’t reach its destination before the spell ends, the message is lost, and the Beast returns to where you cast the spell.

Longstrider.name: Longstrider
Longstrider.description:
You touch a creature. The target's Speed increases by 10 feet until the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Longstrider.name: Longstrider
Longstrider.description: The target’s Speed increases by 10 feet until the spell ends.

Moonbeam.name: Moonbeam
Moonbeam.description:
A silvery beam of pale light shines down in a 5-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, Dim Light fills the Cylinder, and you can take a Magic action on later turns to move the Cylinder up to 60 feet.

When the Cylinder appears, each creature in it makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d10 Radiant damage, and if the creature is shape-shifted (as a result of the Polymorph spell, for example), it reverts to its true form and can't shape-shift until it leaves the Cylinder. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. A creature also makes this save when the spell's area moves into its space and when it enters the spell's area or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 2.

Shuck.name: Shuck
Shuck.description:
Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Keen Hearing and Smell.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
Keen Hearing and Smell.description: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+4 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage.

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

The Barrow King.name: The Barrow King
The Barrow King.description:
The Barrow King

Undying Monarch of the Damned

Habitat: Any

The Barrow King is known only by the armies of Undead he commands, which all slumber in tombs and burial mounds. Wights and their zombie conscripts arise when trespassers violate the resting place of the king’s army, and tales speak of a tide of death that will sweep across the world if the king himself should awaken. Records of the king’s living exploits and identity are near nonexistent, but rumors abound, and the storm of stories and myths may conceal grains of truth.

Secret. The Barrow King’s only true weakness is his name, written in the runic form of his lost native language. A weapon inscribed with his runic name becomes his bane.

Barrow King’s Lair

The Barrow King’s lair is his burial mound and the surrounding region of resting places for his vast army. If encountered in his lair, the Barrow King has a challenge rating of 23 (50,000 XP).

The region containing the Barrow King’s lair is changed by his presence, creating the following effects:

Empire of Desecration. A Hallow spell cast within 1 mile of the lair fails, but any resources used to cast it aren’t wasted.

Necrotic Shroud. When a living creature within 1 mile of the lair regains hit points as part of finishing a long rest, it can only regain up to half its hit point maximum.

If the Barrow King dies or moves his lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The king makes three [[/item Soul Blade]] attacks. He can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Life Drain]].

Soul Blade.name: Soul Blade
Soul Blade.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 40/80 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. Hit or Miss: The blade magically returns to the king’s hand immediately after a ranged attack.

Life Drain.name: Life Drain
Life Drain.description: The king touches a creature. The target must succeed on a DC 22 Constitution saving throw or take 16 ([[/r 2d8 + 7]]) necrotic damage, and the target’s hit point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken until it finishes a long rest. A Humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a Wight under the king’s control, unless the Humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed.

Blade Storm.name: Blade Storm
Blade Storm.description: The king’s blade flies in a deadly arc around him. Each creature of the king’s choice within 20 feet of him must make a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 35 ([[/r 10d6]]) force damage and is knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false]. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The king can take 3 legendary actions (4 in Lair), choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The king regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

Death Grasp.name: Death Grasp
Death Grasp.description: One creature the king can see within 100 feet of him must succeed on a DC 22 Strength saving throw or a ghostly, skeletal arm pulls the target up to 40 feet closer to the king, and the target’s speed is halved until the end of its next turn.

Grim Charge.name: Grim Charge
Grim Charge.description: The king moves up to his speed (or commands his mount to move up to its speed) and makes one [[/item Soul Blade]] attack.

Lord’s Call.name: Lord’s Call
Lord’s Call.description: The king magically summons two Wights into unoccupied spaces he can see within 30 feet of himself. The wights obey the king and take their turn immediately after him on the same initiative count. A wight vanishes after 1 hour, when it or the king dies, or when the king uses this action again. A creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of a wight must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) Psychic damage and be &Reference[Frightened apply=false] until the start of its next turn. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description:
The Barrow King’s lair is his burial mound and the surrounding region of resting places for his vast army. If encountered in his lair, the Barrow King has a challenge rating of 23 (50,000 XP). The region containing the Barrow King’s lair is changed by his presence, creating the following effects:

If the Barrow King dies or moves his lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Empire of Desecration.name: Empire of Desecration
Empire of Desecration.description: A Hallow spell cast within 1 mile of the lair fails, but any resources used to cast it aren’t wasted.

Necrotic Shroud.name: Necrotic Shroud
Necrotic Shroud.description: When a living creature within 1 mile of the lair regains hit points as part of finishing a long rest, it can only regain up to half its hit point maximum.

Undying Mount.name: Undying Mount
Undying Mount.description: The king casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.wpx42mtoZ5BmXRs1], requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability. The conjured steed takes no damage from areas of effect. The spell ends early if the king casts it again.

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: When the king is hit by an attack roll while holding a weapon or shield, he adds 7 to his AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Plate Armor.name: Plate Armor
Plate Armor.description: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the king fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The king has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Marshall Undead.name: Marshall Undead
Marshall Undead.description: Undead creatures of the king’s choice (excluding himself) within 60 feet of him have advantage on attack rolls and saving throws. He can’t use this trait if he is &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false].

Name Of Rest.name: Name Of Rest
Name Of Rest.description: The king has AC 10 against attack rolls made with a weapon inscribed with the runic form of his original name, and the king has disadvantage on attack rolls made against a creature holding such a weapon.

Phantom Steed.name: Phantom Steed
Phantom Steed.description:
A Large quasi-real, horselike creature appears on the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. You decide the creature's appearance, but it is equipped with a saddle, bit, and bridle. Any of the equipment created by the spell vanishes in a puff of smoke if it is carried more than 10 feet away from the steed.

For the duration, you or a creature you choose can ride the steed. The creature uses the statistics for a riding horse, except it has a speed of 100 feet and can travel 10 miles in an hour, or 13 miles at a fast pace. When the spell ends, the steed gradually fades, giving the rider 1 minute to dismount. The spell ends if you use an action to dismiss it or if the steed takes any damage.

The White Worm.name: The White Worm
The White Worm.description:
The White Worm

Eldritch Devourer of Memories

Habitat: Coastal, Underground, Underwater

Born of a forgotten realm beyond the stars, the White Worm is an eldritch horror resembling a humungous, pallid grub that ravenously hungers for memory. Greedily consuming the memories of any beings capable of remembering, its mere existence sends out shockwaves of alien psychic energy. It also serves as the queen of a hivemind colony of infinite wormlike spawn that seek mortal hosts to feast upon and control.

Secret. A specific series of constellations and star paths through the heavens is a deadly poison to the White Worm if it consumes that memory.

The White Worm’s Lair

The White Worm’s lair is a secluded lake and the shores surrounding it. If encountered in its lair, the White Worm has a challenge rating of 20 (25,000 XP).

The region containing the White Worm’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Alien Growth. Strange life grows rampant within 1 mile of the lair. In that region, Gricks, Purple Worms, and Wormhost Surgeons* are common.
