Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Hospital Horror.name: Hospital Horror
Hospital Horror.description:
Hospital Horror

Mutated Experiment

Habitat: Any

Hospital horrors were once people, but now they are repulsive mockeries created through surgical and magical alteration. They have no memory of their past lives, existing only within a chemically induced rage. Often, they are conditioned by the use of specific command phrases that allow them to be controlled.

Secret. Hospital horrors have spent much of their existence being prodded with needles, so being pierced frays what few wits they retain.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The horror makes two [[/item Graft Blade]] attacks.

Graft Blade.name: Graft Blade
Graft Blade.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Stim Burst.name: Stim Burst
Stim Burst.description: The horror takes the Dash action and can jump up to 30 feet by spending 10 feet of movement.

Aversion To Needles.name: Aversion To Needles
Aversion To Needles.description: If the horror takes piercing damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The horror has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the horror’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false].

Riding Horse.name: Riding Horse
Riding Horse.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Hooves.name: Hooves
Hooves.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+5 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmGore0000000000]] attacks.

Gore.name: Gore
Gore.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended average]]. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moved 20+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: The target has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition if the attacking creature used its moving attack feature.

Trample.name: Trample
Trample.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=QckCIpsC3BdEHycI]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=QckCIpsC3BdEHycI]] within [[lookup @range.value activity=QckCIpsC3BdEHycI]] feet that has the Prone condition.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Lightning Absorption.name: Lightning Absorption
Lightning Absorption.description: Whenever the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to Lightning damage, it regains a number of Hit Points equal to the Lightning damage dealt.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .mmChargedTendril]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item .mmEngulf00000000]].

Charged Tendril.name: Charged Tendril
Charged Tendril.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] pulls the target 5 feet straight toward itself.

Engulf.name: Engulf
Engulf.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=5o0Bh8PQaojx5XMx]], one [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=5o0Bh8PQaojx5XMx]] within 5 feet.

Failure: The target is pulled into the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s space and has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]). Until the grapple ends, the target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Restrained apply=false] conditions, and it takes [[/damage average activity=Exfa4q7O4SvXjGt7]] damage at the start of each of its turns. When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves, the Grappled target moves with it, costing it no extra movement. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have only one creature Grappled by this action at a time.

Grappled, Blinded & Restrained.name: Grappled, Blinded & Restrained
Grappled, Blinded & Restrained.description: Until the grapple ends, the target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Restrained apply=false] conditions, and it takes [[/damage average 3d6 type=lightning]] damage at the start of each of its turns.

Reveler of Song.name: Reveler of Song
Reveler of Song.description:
Reveler of Song

Fiend of Music and Dance

Habitat: Planar (Lower Planes), Urban

Treasure: Implements

Revelers of song are Fiends of music and abandon who turn their art against their foes in destructive reverberation. The revelers dance and play at nearly all times and are known to fly into a murderous rage if their invitations to join the celebration are spurned. A variety of revelers of song exist, depending on the type of instrument a given reveler plays. Drone revelers play the hurdy gurdy and are surrounded by an accompanying swarm of bees. Drum revelers play drums or cymbals, and the world shakes to their beat. Bell revelers play some variety of bell, chime, or gong, and the ringing overtakes all other sounds.

Secret. Revelers of song can’t accept that any creature is more skilled at an instrument than they are and so can’t refuse a musical challenge.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The reveler makes two [[/item Instrumental Blast]] attacks.

Instrumental Blast.name: Instrumental Blast
Instrumental Blast.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. or range 90 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Infectious Rhythm (Drum Only).name: Infectious Rhythm (Drum Only)
Infectious Rhythm (Drum Only).description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 16, up to two creatures the reveler can see within 30 feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target is affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.TfRzwEgBHHkCc6Ql]{Irresistible Dance} spell (no Concentration required to maintain the spell).

Success: Half damage only.

Stunning Clangor (Bell Only).name: Stunning Clangor  (Bell Only)
Stunning Clangor (Bell Only).description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC 16, one creature the reveler can see within 60 feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[stunned apply=false] condition until the end of the reveler’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Compelled Contest.name: Compelled Contest
Compelled Contest.description: The reveler can’t refuse a contest of skill with Musical Instruments. As an Influence action, a creature can make a Charisma (Performance) check using a Musical Instrument. The reveler must succeed on a Charisma saving throw with a DC equal to the check’s total or take [[/damage average]] damage and have the &reference[stunned apply=false]condition until the end of the creature’s next turn.

Dancing Step.name: Dancing Step
Dancing Step.description: The reveler doesn’t provoke Opportunity Attacks when it leaves an enemy’s reach.

Ensemble Form.name: Ensemble Form
Ensemble Form.description: The reveler takes on a specific form: Drone, Drum, or Bell. The form determines certain traits and actions, as well as the instrument the reveler plays (hurdy gurdy, frame drum, or handbells, respectively).

Droning Swarm (Drone Only).name: Droning Swarm  (Drone Only)
Droning Swarm (Drone Only).description:
A droning swarm of bees surrounds the reveler.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature that ends its turn in a 10-foot Emanation originating from the reveler.

Failure: The target has the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

OCEVpnaPsC9lWM8d.name: Basilisk
OCEVpnaPsC9lWM8d.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Petrifying Gaze.name: Petrifying Gaze
Petrifying Gaze.description:
If a creature starts its turn within 30 ft. of the basilisk and the two of them can see each other, the basilisk can force the creature to make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw if the basilisk isn't incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save. If the basilisk sees its reflection within 30 ft. of it in bright light, it mistakes itself for a rival and targets itself with its gaze.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+5 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

Jay Wells.name: Jay Wells
Jay Wells.description:
Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Training.name: Training
Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has proficiency in one skill of the DM's choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

Club.name: Club
Club.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Devil’s Glove.name: Devil’s Glove
Devil’s Glove.description:
Devil’s Glove

Five-Fingered Fungus (Rare wood chips)

Habitat: Forest, Swamp, Underground

Comprised of five twitching, blood-red tendrils lined with black slime, the devil’s glove fungus feeds voraciously off decaying matter, unwary insects, and small creatures. Resembling a long-fingered hand, they grow from bulbous roots that look like leathery, white eggs and constantly emit an overpowering scent of death and rot. Despite their unpleasant aura, these fungus creatures can form beneficial relationships with others, providing nourishment and resilience in exchange for protection and a ready supply of decaying material to feed upon.

Tendril.name: Tendril
Tendril.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the devil’s glove attaches to the target. While attached, the devil’s glove can’t make Tendril attacks against other targets, and if the target is a creature, the target is &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] until the start of its next turn if it can smell the devil’s glove. The devil’s glove can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. The target or a creature within 5 feet of it can detach the devil’s glove as an action.

Decaying Bloom.name: Decaying Bloom
Decaying Bloom.description: The devil’s glove releases a cloud of spores. Each creature within 10 feet of the devil’s glove must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 9 ([[/r 2d8]]) necrotic damage and can’t regain hit points until the start of the devil’s glove’s next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only.

Symbiosis.name: Symbiosis
Symbiosis.description: The devil’s glove forms a magical bond with a willing creature it touches. The bonded creature doesn’t need to eat or drink, and the creature has advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. The bond ends when the devil’s glove dies, the creature dies, the devil’s glove ends the bond (no action required), or the devil’s glove uses this bonus action again.

Scent Of Death.name: Scent Of Death
Scent Of Death.description: Creatures that can smell have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to find the devil’s glove.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The devil’s glove can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Friar Olaf.name: Friar Olaf
Friar Olaf.description:
Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
Chain Shirt.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy

1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, guiding bolt, sanctuary

2nd level (3 slots): lesser restoration, spiritual weapon

3rd level (2 slots): dispel magic, spirit guardians

Divine Eminence.name: Divine Eminence
Divine Eminence.description:
As a bonus action, the priest can expend a spell slot to cause its melee weapon attacks to magically deal an extra 10 (3d6) radiant damage to a target on a hit.

This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If the priest expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d6 for each level above 1st.

Mace.name: Mace
Mace.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+2 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.

Sacred Flame.name: Sacred Flame
Sacred Flame.description:
Flame-like radiance descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw.

The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You create one of the following magical effects within range:

  • Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute.
  • You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.
  • You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.
  • You create a sound that originates from a point of your choice within range.
  • You cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.
  • You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

Guiding Bolt.name: Guiding Bolt
Guiding Bolt.description:
A flash of light streaks toward a creature of your choice within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 4d6 radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against this target before the end of your next turn has advantage, thanks to the mystical dim light glittering on the target until then.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

Sanctuary.name: Sanctuary
Sanctuary.description:
You ward a creature within range against attack. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn't protect the warded creature from area effects, such as the explosion of a Fireball.

If the warded creature makes an attack or casts a spell that affects an enemy creature, this spell ends.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and can end either one disease or one condition afflicting it. The condition can be blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral weapon within range that lasts for the duration or until you cast this spell again. When you cast the spell, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the weapon. On a hit, the target takes force damage equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the weapon up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

The weapon can take whatever form you choose. Clerics of deities who are associated with a particular weapon (as St. Cuthbert is known for his mace and Thor for his hammer) make this spell's effect resemble that weapon.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for every two slot levels above the 2nd.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

Spirit Guardians.name: Spirit Guardians
Spirit Guardians.description:
You call forth spirits to protect you. They flit around you to a distance of 15 feet for the duration. If you are good or neutral, their spectral form appears angelic or fey (your choice). If you are evil, they appear fiendish.

When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it. An affected creature's speed is halved in the area, and when the creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 3d8 radiant damage (if you are good or neutral) or 3d8 necrotic damage (if you are evil). On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. Until the spell ends, the object sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like. Completely covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action.

If you target an object held or worn by a hostile creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the spell.

Cure Wounds.name: Cure Wounds
Cure Wounds.description:
A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

Vermin Infestation.name: Vermin Infestation
Vermin Infestation.description:
Vermin Infestation

Swarm of Verminous Familiars

Habitat: Planar (Fey), Urban

Treasure: None

A nightmarish amalgamation of centipedes, pigeons, and weasels, vermin infestations are thankfully rare. These swarms of Fey roil and scratch and rend with individual pigeons streaking out to tear at distant foes, becoming a frenzied mass that throws all subtlety and coordination to the wind. At times, the constituent vermin-like Fey seem to be at each other’s throats as much as any victims of the swarm.

Secret. The Fey spirits that make up a vermin infestation loathe one another and can be tricked into fighting among themselves by a clever suggestion.

Shred.name: Shred
Shred.description:
Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., Hit: 14 ([[/r 4d4 + 4]]) Piercing damage, or 9 ([[/r 2d4 + 4]]) Piercing damage if the swarm is Bloodied.

If the target is a Medium or smaller creature in the swarm’s space, the target has the &reference[grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 14). The swarm can have one creature Grappled at a time. At the start of each of the Grappled target’s turns, roll [[/r 1d6]] to see which of the following effects it suffers:

  • 1–2: Centipede Sting. The target takes 4 ([[/r 1d8]]) Poison damage and has the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn.

  • 3–4: Pigeon Cry. The target takes 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) Psychic damage.

  • 5–6: Weasel Drain. The target takes 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) Necrotic damage, and its Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken.

Infighting.name: Infighting
Infighting.description: As an Influence action, a creature that insinuates that the components of the swarm are conspiring against each other and succeeds on a DC 15 Charisma (Deception) check deals [[/damage average]] damage to the swarm.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The swarm can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Swarm.name: Swarm
Swarm.description: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can fit through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. The swarm can’t regain Hit Points or gain Temporary Hit Points.

OezNlGyvTzCD5rHX.name: Rotweaver
OezNlGyvTzCD5rHX.description:
Rotweaver

Fey Thrall of Rot

Habitat: Forest, Planar (Fey), Swamp

Treasure: Relics

Rotweavers were Fey caretakers of the natural world or fey planes who’ve been corrupted by the power of rot. Rotweavers serve powerful beings of withering and blight as minor acolytes and hunters, working to spread the bounds of their beloved decay.

Secret. The rotweavers’ fey nature still holds; binding them with iron, such as manacles or a chain, mutes their strength.

Staff.name: Staff
Staff.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Call The Rot (Requires Hunting Horn).name: Call The Rot  (Requires Hunting Horn)
Call The Rot (Requires Hunting Horn).description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature in a 30-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Failure or Success: The horn call is audible out to 300 feet, and any non-creature plants in the Cone die from fungus and rot

Fungal Step.name: Fungal Step
Fungal Step.description: The rotweaver ignores Difficult Terrain caused by plants or fungi.

Hunting Horn.name: Hunting Horn
Hunting Horn.description: The rotweaver carries a hunting horn. The horn has AC 16, HP 10, and Immunity to Necrotic, Poison, and Psychic damage.

Iron Binding.name: Iron Binding
Iron Binding.description: If the rotweaver has iron wrapped around a part of its body, such as an iron bracelet, Manacles, or Chain (treat any of them as applying @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.tWJLHIL6ZIZUez9k]{Manacles}), the rotweaver can move, take an action, or a Bonus Action, but not all three.

OtCvUReRzsbKYFTf.name: Lurker in the Dark
OtCvUReRzsbKYFTf.description:
Lurker in the Dark

Thing That Goes Bump in the Night

Habitat: Planar (Shadow), Urban

Lurkers in the dark are wicked Fey creatures who prey upon the fearful, vulnerable, and alone. They resemble nightmarishly distorted people with gray skin, lank hair, and three-fingered, clawed hands. Their limbs move in impossible ways, allowing them to slip through and hide within spaces that seem far too small. They delight in stoking their victim’s fears by whispering from spaces a person couldn’t fit. When the terror crests, the lurkers strike, drag their victims into the dark, and vanish with them.

Secret. Frightened children know that lurkers in the dark can be held at bay by clutching a beloved stuffed animal.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The lurker makes two [[/item Claw]] attacks.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] (escape DC 14) from one of two claws. Until the grapple ends, the target is &Reference[Restrained apply=false].

Dark Teleport.name: Dark Teleport
Dark Teleport.description: While the lurker isn’t in bright light, it teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. If the destination space isn’t in bright light, the lurker doesn’t need to see it. A creature the lurker is grappling must succeed on a DC 13 Charisma saving throw or teleport with the lurker to an unoccupied space closest to the lurker’s destination.

Nightmarish Contortion.name: Nightmarish Contortion
Nightmarish Contortion.description: The lurker can fit into a space as small as a 1-foot cube and can pass through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The lurker can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Ward Of Innocence.name: Ward Of Innocence
Ward Of Innocence.description: The lurker can’t attack or willingly move to a space within 10 feet of a creature holding a stuffed animal once owned by a child.

Cultist Fanatic.name: Cultist Fanatic
Cultist Fanatic.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagHolySymbolV]{Holy Symbol (Varies)}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmLeatherArm]{Leather Armor}

Cultists

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.VICfYukXoYkWJ1yn caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm free-rules-embed"]

Cultist Fanatic

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.DHw4tAz06WzLz07b caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm free-rules-embed"]

Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]], +4 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

2/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCommand000]{Command}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHoldPerson]{Hold Person}

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpiritualW]{Spiritual Weapon} spell, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

z817Et9IPt6qHawH.name: Spiritual Weapon
z817Et9IPt6qHawH.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. Choose the command from these options:

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target has the Prone condition and then ends its turn.

Halt. On its turn, the target doesn't move and takes no action or Bonus Action.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can affect one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Water Elemental.name: Water Elemental
Water Elemental.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Freeze.name: Freeze
Freeze.description: If the elemental takes cold damage, it partially freezes; its speed is reduced by 20 ft. until the end of its next turn.

Water Form.name: Water Form
Water Form.description: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

Slam.name: Slam
Slam.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+7 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

Whelm.name: Whelm
Whelm.description:
Each creature in the elemental's space must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If it is Large or smaller, it is also grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and unable to breathe unless it can breathe water.

If the saving throw is successful, the target is pushed out of the elemental's space.The elemental can grapple one Large creature or up to two Medium or smaller creatures at one time. At the start of each of the elemental's turns, each target grappled by it takes 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. A creature within 5 feet of the elemental can pull a creature or object out of it by taking an action to make a DC 14 Strength check and succeeding.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .qFzUqCv1LU1T2l9W]] or [[/item .iqOpigRADMF7BFDu]] in any combination.

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is [[lookup @activation.condition activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]]. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] adds [[lookup @roll.formula activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]] to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Use.name: Use
Use.condition: hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon

Hugo.name: Hugo
Hugo.description:
Serum Brute

Cursed Giant Enhanced by Alchemy

Habitat: Underground, Urban

Treasure: Any

Serum brutes are descended from giants who suffered an enduring curse when they failed to take over a Fey domain. They have third eyes, usually in their foreheads, which channel the giants’ curse into the world around them. All three of their eyes are sewn or otherwise sealed shut to contain the curse. Serum brutes are further enhanced with—and get their name from—a series of alchemical infusions, often delivered through implanted vessels and tubes, which seek to deaden their sorrow and pain, as well as the disturbing power of their third eyes. They form deep emotional bonds with any who offer them comfort and an escape from the pain of their curse, and they are often willing to die for those allies.

Secret. Serum brutes are dependent upon their curse, and magic that breaks curses can leave the giants debilitated and bereft.

Curse Dependent.name: Curse Dependent
Curse Dependent.description: If the brute is targeted by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XZhdgVK3cLoxNCQl]{Remove Curse} spell or similar magic, until it finishes a Long Rest, the brute loses its Blindsight, its [[/item Withering Eye (Unleashed Eyes Only)]]{Withering Eye} trait, and its [[/item Cursed Gaze (Unleashed Eyes Only)]]{Cursed Gaze} action.

Stimulant Rush.name: Stimulant Rush
Stimulant Rush.description:
At the start of its turn, the brute must choose one of the following options (it can’t use that option twice in a row):

  • Catalyst Infusion. Until the start of its next turn, the brute’s Speed increases to 50 feet, it doesn’t provoke an Opportunity Attack when it leaves an enemy’s reach, and its Long Jump is up to 30 feet and its High Jump is up to 15 feet with or without a running start.

  • Caustic Secretion. Until the start of its next turn,
    its Fist attack deals an extra [[/damage average]] damage.

  • Stim Boost. Gain 10 Temporary Hit Points.

Unleashed Eyes.name: Unleashed Eyes
Unleashed Eyes.description: When the brute is Bloodied, its sealed eyes rip open and unleash its curse. It is no longer blind beyond 60 feet, and it can use its Withering Eye trait and Cursed Gaze action until it finishes a Long Rest, whereupon its eyes seal shut again.

Withering Eye (Unleashed Eyes Only).name: Withering Eye (Unleashed Eyes Only)
Withering Eye (Unleashed Eyes Only).description: When the brute moves to within 5 feet of a creature, the creature takes [[/damage average]] damage. A creature takes this damage only once per turn.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The brute makes two [[/item Fist]] attacks and can use Cursed Gaze if available.

Fist.name: Fist
Fist.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 10 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If Caustic Secretion is active, the target takes an extra 11 ([[/r 2d10]]) Acid damage.

Cursed Gaze (Unleashed Eyes Only).name: Cursed Gaze (Unleashed Eyes Only)
Cursed Gaze (Unleashed Eyes Only).description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature in a 30-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[frightened apply=false] condition until the start of the brute’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Devotion.name: Devotion
Devotion.description:
Trigger: An ally within 5 feet takes damage.

Response: The ally gains Resistance to the triggering damage, and the brute takes an amount of Psychic damage equal to the damage the ally takes.

Plgibu7fguyYVcTG.name: Pumpkin Head
Plgibu7fguyYVcTG.description:
Pumpkin Head

Fiendish Effigy of the Fields

Habitat: Any

Treasure: None

Pumpkin heads are scarecrows of straw, sticks, and clothing topped with a carved pumpkin for a head and animated by a fiendish spirit. They are crafted by demons to resemble their Humanoid victims and returned to wherever the unfortunate souls had been snatched from.

These living effigies speak with the voice of whomever they replaced, often repeating phrases and behaviors that the missing person said or did in life while stalking and killing new prey.

Secret. Pumpkin heads hold a shred of memory from the people they replaced. The sight of a keepsake or memento from a pumpkin head’s victim confuses the creature.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The pumpkin head makes one [[/item Claw]] attack and one [[/item Pitchfork]] attack, and it can use Personality Consumption if available.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Pitchfork.name: Pitchfork
Pitchfork.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 10 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the pumpkin head can push or pull it 5 feet.

Personality Consumption.name: Personality Consumption
Personality Consumption.description:
The pumpkin head consumes a victim’s memories.

Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 12, one creature the pumpkin head can see within 30 feet.

Failure: The target has the &reference[stunned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn, and its Intelligence score decreases by [[/r 1d4]]. The target dies if this reduces that score to 0. A Humanoid slain in this way is replaced by a Pumpkin Head* [[/r 1d8]] hours later unless its body is burned.

Mimicry.name: Mimicry
Mimicry.description: The pumpkin head can mimic the voice of the person it replaced or someone it used Personality Consumption on. A creature that hears the voice can tell it’s an imitation only with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.

Sorrowful Memento.name: Sorrowful Memento
Sorrowful Memento.description: If the pumpkin head can see a creature holding a possession of the person the pumpkin head replaced, it has Disadvantage on D20 Tests.

Shield.description: You gain the Armor Class benefit of a Shield only if you have training with it.

Q5mBrxGLx4qANawC.name: Giant Crocodile
Q5mBrxGLx4qANawC.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Hold Breath.name: Hold Breath
Hold Breath.description: The crocodile can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The crocodile makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+8 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) piercing damage.

The target is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the crocodile can't bite another target.

Tail.name: Tail
Tail.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+8 to hit,, 10 ft., one target not grappled by the crocodile. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

QBOw7GpJwHvRCaSS.name: Crooked Man
QBOw7GpJwHvRCaSS.description:
Crooked Man

Broken Spirit of Betrayal

Habitat: Any

The crooked man is an Undead embodiment of broken trust and the twisting of purpose. Those who die having betrayed what they hold sacred, embracing their treachery to their core, might return in this broken, gnarled form of snapped bones with a crooked grin. The creature’s fingers end in curling claws that hook and hold, and the duplicity in its heart bleeds out to twist allies against one another. Despite the creature’s name, anyone can become this manifestation of betrayal.

Secret. The crooked man can’t abide self-sacrifice and withers in its presence.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The crooked man makes two [[/item Crooked Claw]] attacks, and he can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Snap Limb]]. He can also use Confusion if available.

Crooked Claw.name: Crooked Claw
Crooked Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] (escape DC 16) from one of two claws. Until the grapple ends, the target is &Reference[Restrained apply=false].

Snap Limb.name: Snap Limb
Snap Limb.description:
One creature the crooked man is grappling must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw. A creature without limbs that can break is immune to this effect. On a failed save, the target takes 35 ([[/r 10d6]]) force damage, and the bones (or equivalent) in one of its limbs (crooked man’s choice) breaks, causing an appropriate effect below. A broken limb heals in 40 days, or when the creature regains any hit points from magic or Regeneration. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

Broken Arm. Disadvantage on attack rolls. Can’t hold anything or manipulate objects with the limb.

Broken Leg. Speed halved. If the creature takes the Dash action, it must succeed on a [[/save DEX DC 15]] saving throw or be knocked &reference[prone].

Broken Wing. Flying speed reduced to 0.

Confusion.name: Confusion
Confusion.description: The crooked man casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.9hQXdMSmerkTsHDe], requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17).

Blinking Teleport.name: Blinking Teleport
Blinking Teleport.description: The crooked man becomes &Reference[Invisible apply=false] for 1 minute and teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 60 feet. The condition ends immediately after the crooked man deals any damage.

Aversion To Self-sacrifice.name: Aversion To Self-sacrifice
Aversion To Self-sacrifice.description: The crooked man takes 20 necrotic damage if he can see a creature willingly take damage or gain a condition in place of someone else, or to someone else’s benefit.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The crooked man has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

HSa8booR4YOdeYi2.name: Confusion
HSa8booR4YOdeYi2.description:
This spell assaults and twists creatures' minds, spawning delusions and provoking uncontrolled action. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw when you cast this spell or be affected by it.

An affected target can't take reactions and must roll from the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables.RollTable.LHEts1oDaDwcehuj]{Confusion} table at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the radius of the sphere increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 4th.

Club.name: Club
Club.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Training.name: Training
Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has proficiency in one skill of the DM's choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

Divine Aid.name: Divine Aid
Divine Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpiritGuar]{Spirit Guardians}

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .hRwqUlEyM9TjOmHy]] or [[/item .mmRadiantFlame00]] in any combination.

Magpie of Omens.name: Magpie of Omens
Magpie of Omens.description:
Magpie of Omens

Bird of Fate and Fortune (Crystal or gemstone shards)

Habitat: Forest, Grassland, Planar (Fey)

To those who respect the Old Ways, this bird of black and white brings tidings both fair and foul. Although the omens the magpie delivers can bring joy and grief in equal measure, they are always trustworthy.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The magpie makes two [[/item Beak]] attacks.

Beak.name: Beak
Beak.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Bonded Voice.name: Bonded Voice
Bonded Voice.description: The magpie can form or dissolve a magical bond with a willing creature within 5 feet. While the bond lasts, the bonded creature can speak through the magpie using the creature’s own voice and language, but with a birdlike lilt. The bond ends when the creature dies or if the magpie creates a new bond.

One For Sorrow.name: One For Sorrow
One For Sorrow.description: When a creature within 30 feet of the magpie makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw with advantage, the target rolls [[/r 1d6]] and subtracts it from the total.

Two For Joy.name: Two For Joy
Two For Joy.description: When the magpie or another creature within 30 feet of it makes an ability check or a saving throw, the target rolls [[/r 1d4]] and adds it to the total.

Flyby.name: Flyby
Flyby.description: The magpie doesn’t provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

QNPhgYXg0U9kpwHC.name: The Horned King
QNPhgYXg0U9kpwHC.description:
The Horned King

Sin Made Manifest

Habitat: Forest, Planar (Lower Planes)

Every sinful, selfish action in the world pours a fraction of itself into the Horned King, a being composed of every mortal who has surrendered to temptation. Fortunately, under normal circumstances, the Horned King exists as an ephemeral spirit with no physical presence. During times of upheaval, when a great many mortals give in to their selfish desires or when another power—such as a deity, demon lord, or archfey—interferes, the Horned King is made manifest, and with it comes the weight of sin flooding back into the world that created it.

The Horned King’s Lair

The Horned King’s lair is the forest clearing where a twisted tree focuses the malevolent will that gave rise to the king’s physical presence.

The region containing the Horned King’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Sweet Temptation. Within 1 mile of the lair, a creature that acts on a sinful impulse to the detriment of a friendly or indifferent creature increases its hit point maximum and current hit points by 10 until it finishes a long rest. Creatures are aware of this effect. This can’t occur again for that creature until it finishes a long rest.

Tenacious Curses. Within 1 mile of the lair, saving throws against curses have disadvantage.

If the Horned King dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Horned King makes three [[/item Cursed Strike]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Terrorizing Breath]].

Cursed Strike.name: Cursed Strike
Cursed Strike.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit (against a cursed target, scores a critical hit on a 19 or 20 on the d20), reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 ([[/r 2d10 + 6]]) bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (Horned King’s choice) plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it is cursed until the end of the Horned King’s next turn. While cursed, it must subtract [[/r 1d4]] from ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws.

Breath Of Corruption.name: Breath Of Corruption
Breath Of Corruption.description: The Horned King breathes sweet-smelling shadow in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 21 ([[/r 6d6]]) necrotic damage plus 21 (6d6) psychic damage, and it gains 1 level of &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] that ends at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

Terrorizing Breath.name: Terrorizing Breath
Terrorizing Breath.description: The Horned King breathes bitter shadow in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or become &Reference[Frightened apply=false] for 1 minute. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The Horned King can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The Horned King regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Taste of Wickedness.name: Taste of Wickedness
Taste of Wickedness.description: The Horned King’s snakelike tongue whips out hungrily at a cursed creature within 15 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 20 Charisma saving throw or take 16 ([[/r 3d10]]) psychic damage. The Horned King regains hit points equal to the damage taken, and one curse of the Horned King’s choice affecting the target ends.

Temptation.name: Temptation
Temptation.description: The Horned King speaks to a creature it can see within 120 feet and offers to either restore 20 of its hit points or grant it inspiration. If the creature accepts, it gains that benefit but is cursed for 1 minute. While cursed, the Horned King has resistance to all damage the target deals.

Trample.name: Trample
Trample.description: The Horned King moves up to half its speed, and it makes one [[/item Cursed Strike]] attack.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Horned King’s lair is the forest clearing where a twisted tree focuses the malevolent will that gave rise to the king’s physical presence. The region containing the Horned King’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Horned King dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Sweet Temptation.name: Sweet Temptation
Sweet Temptation.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, a creature that acts on a sinful impulse to the detriment of a friendly or indifferent creature increases its hit point maximum and current hit points by 10 until it finishes a long rest. Creatures are aware of this effect. This can’t occur again for that creature until it finishes a long rest.

Tenacious Curses.name: Tenacious Curses
Tenacious Curses.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, saving throws against curses have disadvantage.

Sense Desire.name: Sense Desire
Sense Desire.description: The Horned King casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ppWAAEul0QHtm4er], requiring no spell components and using Charisma for the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20).

Enduring Restoration.name: Enduring Restoration
Enduring Restoration.description: If the Horned King dies, its body disappears in a cloud of ash. It becomes an intangible, &Reference[Invisible apply=false] spirit in its home forest, and it can’t reform a new physical body for [[/r 10d10]] years.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the Horned King fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The Horned King has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
For the duration, you can read the thoughts of certain creatures. When you cast the spell and as your action on each turn until the spell ends, you can focus your mind on any one creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. If the creature you choose has an Intelligence of 3 or lower or doesn't speak any language, the creature is unaffected.

You initially learn the surface thoughts of the creature—what is most on its mind in that moment. As an action, you can either shift your attention to another creature's thoughts or attempt to probe deeper into the same creature's mind. If you probe deeper, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, you gain insight into its reasoning (if any), its emotional state, and something that looms large in its mind (such as something it worries over, loves, or hates). If it succeeds, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and unless you shift your attention to another creature's thoughts, the creature can use its action on its turn to make an Intelligence check contested by your Intelligence check; if it succeeds, the spell ends.

Questions verbally directed at the target creature naturally shape the course of its thoughts, so this spell is particularly effective as part of an interrogation.

You can also use this spell to detect the presence of thinking creatures you can't see. When you cast the spell or as your action during the duration, you can search for thoughts within 30 feet of you. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 2 feet of rock, 2 inches of any metal other than lead, or a thin sheet of lead blocks you. You can't detect a creature with an Intelligence of 3 or lower or one that doesn't speak any language.

Once you detect the presence of a creature in this way, you can read its thoughts for the rest of the duration as described above, even if you can't see it, but it must still be within range.

QeOUG4DFogKxnwPo.name: Goatstealer
QeOUG4DFogKxnwPo.description:
Goatstealer

Hungry Livestock Snatcher (Incense and spoiled meat)

Habitat: Desert, Forest, Grassland, Hill

The hairless, reeking goatstealers are vicious predators and scavengers that earn their name from their habit of preying upon livestock. They latch onto prey with wicked, needle-like teeth, delivering lethal venom and devouring creatures far larger than its wiry frame would suggest is possible. Especially dangerous in packs, the carrion-yet-peaty stench of goatstealers is the stuff of legend.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] (escape DC 12). Until the grapple ends, at the start of each of the goatstealer’s turns, the target takes 3 ([[/r 1d6]]) poison damage.

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The goatstealer has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the goatstealer’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapcitated.

Stench.name: Stench
Stench.description: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the goatstealer must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the Stench of all goatstealers for 1 hour.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .w3cX0piuU875Hc2M]] and [[/item .2TB9ZSIbtbi4UtSv]] in any combination.

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is [[lookup @activation.condition activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]]. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] adds [[lookup @roll.formula activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]] to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Use.name: Use
Use.condition: hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Corn Dolly.name: Corn Dolly
Corn Dolly.description:
Corn Dolly

Grain Husk Companion (Curved blade plated in gold)

Habitat: Any

Treasure: None

Crafted from dried husks and bound with twine, corn dollies’ delicate forms are stitched together with rustic care. Their faces are ink-brushed with simple, childlike expressions—smiling mouths that curve a bit too wide and hollow eyes that seem to stare far beyond the physical world. The Constructs are spirits of deceased Humanoids drawn to the hollow corn husk shell, seeking refuge. These spirits retain faint traces of who they once were—a protective instinct entwined with a simmering fury. Once animated, the dolls reflect this dual nature: acting as silent guardians one moment and vengeful specters the next.

Husk Cut.name: Husk Cut
Husk Cut.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Blank Stare.name: Blank Stare
Blank Stare.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 13, one creature the corn dolly can see within 30 feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Sowing Dread.name: Sowing Dread
Sowing Dread.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature of the corn dolly's choice in a 15-foot Cone.

Failure: The target has the &reference[frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Silent Protector.name: Silent Protector
Silent Protector.description:
Trigger: A creature within 60 feet fails a saving throw against an effect that doesn’t deal damage.

Response: The corn dolly suffers the effects of the failure instead of the creature.

Husk Body.name: Husk Body
Husk Body.description: The corn dolly can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

Uneasy Visage.name: Uneasy Visage
Uneasy Visage.description: The strange, childlike inked face unnerves onlookers. While a creature is holding the corn dolly, creatures within 10 feet of it have Disadvantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks made against the creature.

Wraith.name: Wraith
Wraith.description:
Wraith

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. It takes [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Life Drain.name: Life Drain
Life Drain.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature, its Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

Create Specter.name: Create Specter
Create Specter.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] targets a Humanoid corpse within [[lookup @range.value activity=ypIQdXr13u7LATUP]] feet of itself that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute. The target's spirit rises as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmSpecter0000000]{Specter} in the space of its corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space. The specter is under the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s control. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have no more than seven specters under its control at a time.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The mummy makes two [[/item .mmRottingFist000]] attacks and uses [[/item .mmDreadfulGlare0]].

Rotting Fist.name: Rotting Fist
Rotting Fist.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature, it is cursed. While cursed, the target can't regain Hit Points, its Hit Point maximum doesn't return to normal when finishing a Long Rest, and its Hit Point maximum decreases by [[/r 3d6#HP Max Decrease]]{10 (3d6)} every 24 hours that elapse. A creature dies and turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points by this attack.

Cursed.name: Cursed
Cursed.description: If the target is a creature, it is cursed. While cursed, the target can’t regain Hit Points, its Hit Point maximum doesn’t return to normal when finishing a Long Rest, and its Hit Point maximum decreases by [[/r 3d6#HP Max Decrease]]{10 (3d6)} every 24 hours that elapse. A creature dies and turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points by this attack.

The Sweetheart.name: The Sweetheart
The Sweetheart.description:
Wayward Haint

Lost Soul Bound to Regret

Habitat: Any

Treasure: None

Wayward haints are restless spirits stuck between the realms of the living and the dead. Be it a curse or an unresolved conflict from their previous life, a haint can’t rest until their unfinished business is resolved.

Haints only show hints of who they were in life, taking on a more symbolic form related to the hurt or loss they can’t let go of. They tend to repeat their monotonous actions—often imitating those performed in life or reenacting their sorrow—over and over for eternity. When provoked, they can display a volatile temper and lash out with a crushing wave of the grief and indecision that binds their spirit.

Secret. Wayward haints can be trapped in empty bottles if they’re tricked or forced to pass over one.

Bottle Trap.name: Bottle Trap
Bottle Trap.description: A haint that enters the space of an upright, empty bottle must succeed on a DC 16 Charisma saving throw or be drawn into the bottle, and a cork or stopper appears to close the bottle. The trapped haint can see and hear through the bottle out to 10 feet, and any creature in that range can hear the haint. The haint is released if the bottle breaks or another creature opens it.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The haint can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. It takes [[/damage average]] damage if it ends its turn inside a solid object.

Draining Regret.name: Draining Regret
Draining Regret.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target gains 1 &reference[exhaustion apply=false] level. This can’t raise the target’s Exhaustion level above 5, and all Exhaustion levels gained from this action end when the target finishes a Short or Long Rest, or if it receives a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.F0GsG0SJzsIOacwV]{Lesser Restoration} spell or similar magic

If the target is prone, the horse can make another attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

Ferryman.name: Ferryman
Ferryman.description:
Ferryman

Cursed Undead Boatman

Habitat: Coastal, Swamp

Treasure: Implements

Ferrymen are Undead created through the use of curses and jinxcraft and are doomed to ply the waters where they were raised. They pole through the bayous and rivers, and even across land on a wave of swamp water, in coffin boats. They can focus the malice of their curse through the light of their lantern poles, jinxing enemies or those who try to force a ride without payment.

Secret. Paying a ferryman 3 copper coins lifts any curse the creature placed on the payer, and it entitles one to a single unnerving but safe ride in the ferryman’s coffin boat.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The ferryman makes two [[/item Lantern Pole]] attacks and uses Hexed Lantern if available.

Lantern Pole.name: Lantern Pole
Lantern Pole.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 10 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &reference[prone apply=false] condition.

Hexed Lantern.name: Hexed Lantern
Hexed Lantern.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature of the ferryman’s choice in a 30-foot Cone.

Failure: The creature is cursed for 1 minute and must subtract [[/r 1d4]] from D20 Tests.

Coffin Boat.name: Coffin Boat
Coffin Boat.description:
The ferryman rides an open coffin on a swell of swamp water, allowing it to travel with a Speed of 40 feet over any surface, including liquids, ignoring Difficult Terrain. The coffin can hold two other Medium creatures. Two Small creatures or four Tiny creatures count as one Medium creature.

While riding the coffin, the ferryman has Immunity to the Prone condition, and the coffin moves with the ferryman unless the ferryman has the Incapacitated condition. The coffin has AC 15; HP 25; Immunity to Necrotic, Poison, and Psychic damage.

If the coffin is destroyed, the ferryman can magically create a new one using a 10-minute ritual.

Payment.name: Payment
Payment.description: The ferryman must peacefully offer a ride in its boat to a creature that takes the Influence action to offer it 3 CP. If that creature is cursed by the ferryman, the curse ends. If the boat is full, the ferryman must return to offer the creature a ride once its current passengers leave the boat. If the creature or its allies damage the ferryman or force it to make a saving throw, this effect ends and the creature can't use that ferryman's Payment trait again.

Regeneration.name: Regeneration
Regeneration.description: The ferryman regains 10 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 Hit Point.
