Hooves.name: Hooves
Hooves.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature and the skeleton moved 20+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Boneflayer.name: Boneflayer
Boneflayer.description:
Boneflayer

Voracious Carrion Eater

Habitat: Desert, Forest, Grassland, Mountain

Boneflayers are cruel, vulture-like creatures that originated from a broken fey pact. The creatures aren’t content to wait for something to die and instead make their own carrion to gorge upon—they delight in snatching prey in their talons, carrying it into the air, and dropping it to its death. Boneflayers earn their name by using their sizeable, filth-riddled beaks to cleave flesh from bone and hoard the meat until it ages enough for them to enjoy.

Cults sometimes use boneflayer killing grounds as a source of bones to burn in ritual bonfires, occasionally making pacts with the creatures to pay or trade for the creature’s castoffs. Villages that fear boneflayer attacks ward them off with thundering drums or gongs whenever they circle overhead.

Secret. A lingering result of the fey bargain that created them, boneflayers are disoriented and diminished by loud, thunderous noises.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The boneflayer makes one [[/item Beak]] attack and one [[/item Talons]] attack.

Beak.name: Beak
Beak.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] until the end of its next turn.

Talons.name: Talons
Talons.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] (escape DC 14) from both talons. While &Reference[Grappled apply=false], the target is &Reference[Restrained apply=false].

Swoop.name: Swoop
Swoop.description: If the boneflayer has a creature &Reference[Grappled apply=false], the boneflayer flies up to half its flying speed without provoking opportunity attacks and drops that creature.

Flyby.name: Flyby
Flyby.description: The boneflayer doesn’t provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

Thunderous Ward.name: Thunderous Ward
Thunderous Ward.description: When the boneflayer hears a drum or gong, or takes thunder damage, it has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of its next turn.

The Harlequin.name: The Harlequin
The Harlequin.description:
Wayward Haint

Lost Soul Bound to Regret

Habitat: Any

Wayward haints are restless spirits stuck between the realms of the living and the dead. Be it a curse or an unresolved conflict from their previous life, a haint can’t rest until their unfinished business is resolved.

Haints only show hints of who they were in life, taking on a more symbolic form related to the hurt or loss they can’t let go of. They tend to repeat their monotonous actions—often imitating those performed in life or reenacting their sorrow—over and over for eternity. When provoked, they can display a volatile temper and lash out with a crushing wave of the grief and indecision that binds their spirit.

Secret. Wayward haints can be trapped in empty bottles if they’re tricked or forced to pass over one.

Draining Regret.name: Draining Regret
Draining Regret.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target gains 1 level of &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false]. This can’t raise the target’s &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level above 5, and all levels of &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] gained from this action end when the target finishes a short or long rest, or if it receives a Lesser Restoration spell or similar magic.

Bottle Trap.name: Bottle Trap
Bottle Trap.description: A haint that enters the space of an upright, empty bottle must succeed on a DC 16 Charisma saving throw or be drawn into the bottle, and a cork or stopper appears to close the bottle. The trapped haint can see and hear through the bottle out to 10 feet, and any creature in that range can hear the haint. The haint is released if the bottle breaks or another creature opens it.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The haint can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) force damage if it ends its turn inside a solid object.

Aberrant Ground.name: Aberrant Ground
Aberrant Ground.description: The ground in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=zVznqPXgYjETqpQz]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name]] is &Reference[Difficult Terrain].

Gibbering.name: Gibbering
Gibbering.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] babbles incoherently while it doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=PyGOI84k0PPYrru8]], any [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=PyGOI84k0PPYrru8]] that starts its turn within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=PyGOI84k0PPYrru8]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] while it is babbling.

Failure: The target rolls [[/r 1d8]] to determine what it does during the current turn:

1–4. The target does nothing.

5–6. The target takes no action or Bonus Action and uses all its movement to move in a random direction.

7–8. The target makes a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach or does nothing if it can't make such an attack.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition. The target dies if it is reduced to 0 Hit Points by this attack. Its body is then absorbed into the [[lookup @name]], leaving only equipment behind.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone] condition.

Blinding Spittle.name: Blinding Spittle
Blinding Spittle.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=JfU8KFZkAJxWtrhk]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=JfU8KFZkAJxWtrhk]]-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within [[lookup @range.value activity=JfU8KFZkAJxWtrhk]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Blinded.name: Blinded
Blinded.description: the target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the end of the user’s next turn.

Wou9MoWctZhNBzi0.name: Ferryman
Wou9MoWctZhNBzi0.description:
Ferryman

Cursed Undead Boatman

Habitat: Coastal, Swamp

Ferrymen are Undead created through the use of curses and jinxcraft and are doomed to ply the waters where they were raised. They pole through the bayous and rivers, and even across land on a wave of swamp water, in coffin boats. They can focus the malice of their curse through the light of their lantern poles, jinxing enemies or those who try to force a ride without payment.

Secret. Paying a ferryman 3 copper coins lifts any curse the creature placed on the payer, and it entitles one to a single unnerving but safe ride in the ferryman’s coffin boat.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The ferryman makes two [[/item Lantern Pole]] attacks and uses Hexed Lantern if available.

Lantern Pole.name: Lantern Pole
Lantern Pole.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Hexed Lantern.name: Hexed Lantern
Hexed Lantern.description: The ferryman unleashes a burst of light from its lantern in a 30-foot cone. Each creature of the ferryman’s choice in that area must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be cursed for 1 minute. While cursed in this way, the target must subtract [[/r 1d4]] from ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws.

Coffin Boat.name: Coffin Boat
Coffin Boat.description: The ferryman rides an open coffin on a swell of swamp water, allowing it to travel with a speed of 40 feet over any surface, including liquids, ignoring difficult terrain. The coffin can hold two other Medium creatures. Two Small creatures or four Tiny creatures count as one Medium creature. While riding the coffin, the ferryman has immunity to being knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false], and the coffin moves with the ferryman unless the ferryman becomes &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false]. The coffin has AC 15; HP 25; immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. If the coffin is destroyed, the ferryman can magically create a new one using a 10-minute ritual.

Payment.name: Payment
Payment.description: The ferryman must peacefully offer a ride in its boat to a creature that takes an action to offer it 3 cp. If that creature is cursed by the ferryman, the curse ends. If the boat is full, the ferryman must return to offer the creature a ride once its current passengers leave the boat. If the creature or its allies damage the ferryman or force it to make a saving throw, this effect ends and the creature can’t use that ferryman’s Payment trait again.

Regeneration.name: Regeneration
Regeneration.description: The ferryman regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 hit point.

Wildpyre.name: Wildpyre
Wildpyre.description:
Wildpyre

Spectral Blazing Beast

Habitat: Any

Treasure: None

When animals perish in flames, their escaping spirits can cling to the fire that took their lives and arise as wildpyres. These Undead resemble the kind of animal they were in life, though made of ghostly flames. They lash out at anything in their vicinity, fanning the flames that consumed them.

Secret. Water can extinguish the undying flames of wildpyres, despite their ephemeral existence.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The wildpyre makes two [[/item Blazing Rend]] attacks and uses Flame Bind if available.

Blazing Rend.name: Blazing Rend
Blazing Rend.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target begins burning. If the target is a creature no larger than the wildpyre, it has the &reference[prone apply=false] condition.

Flame Bind.name: Flame Bind
Flame Bind.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 15, one creature the wildpyre can see within 60 feet.

Failure: The target has the &reference[restrained apply=false] condition. At the end of each of the target's turns, it repeats the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. During the target's turn, it can choose to end the Restrained condition by taking [[/damage average]] damage.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The wildpyre can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. It takes [[/damage average]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Quenching Water.name: Quenching Water
Quenching Water.description: Any water affects the wildpyre as if it were Holy Water.

Wormhost Surgeon.name: Wormhost Surgeon
Wormhost Surgeon.description:
Wormhost Surgeon

Parasitical Physician

Habitat: Any

Treasure: Implements

Alien parasitic worms that infest the brains of Humanoid bodies mutate their hosts into wormhost surgeons. These aberrant husks are obsessed with anatomical study and with finding new Humanoids to infest with larval worm slurry to propagate their kind. They can pass for ordinary people in most cases but must take care to hide their exposed brains and the wriggling worms within their flesh.

Secret. Wormhost surgeons are drawn to seek out and infest sapient victims, so intelligent creatures with veiled minds slip beneath the surgeons’ notice.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The surgeon makes two [[/item Bone Saw]] attacks.

Bone Saw.name: Bone Saw
Bone Saw.description:
Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Critical Hit: If the target is a creature, its Intelligence score decreases by [[/r 1d4]]. The target dies if this reduces that score to 0.

Infested Spray.name: Infested Spray
Infested Spray.description:
The surgeon unleashes a spray of worm-ridden cerebral fluid.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature in a 20-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target is infested with larval parasitic worms. The target takes 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) Psychic damage at the end of each of its turns as the worms burrow toward its brain. The ongoing damage ends when the target takes Poison damage or is targeted by an effect that ends the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition.

Success: Half damage only.

Failure or Success: If the target is reduced to 0 Hit Points by this Psychic damage, the worms reach its brain and it dies. A Humanoid slain in this way rises 24 hours later as a wormhost surgeon.

Protective Parasite.name: Protective Parasite
Protective Parasite.description:
Trigger: The surgeon is reduced to 0 Hit Points.

Response: The parasite worm emerges from the surgeon’s exposed brain and spits acid—

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature in a 20-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Regeneration.name: Regeneration
Regeneration.description: The surgeon regains 10 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns. If it takes Poison damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of its next turn. The surgeon dies only if it starts its turn with 0 Hit Points and doesn’t regenerate.

Veiled Ignorance.name: Veiled Ignorance
Veiled Ignorance.description: A creature whose mind can’t be read, or that is under the effect of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.bllEWfm9xfEKynhv]{Mind Blank} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.aU62xVUBYkAQWIHv]{Nondetection} spell, has the &reference[invisible apply=false] condition toward the surgeon (this ignores the surgeon's Blindsight).

Training.name: Training
Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has proficiency in one skill of the DM's choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

Club.name: Club
Club.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Werewolf.name: Werewolf
Werewolf.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepLongbow000]{Longbow}

Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .mmScratch0000000]]{Scratch} or [[/item .mYM6o8kM9SDVm45w]]{Longbow} in any combination. It can replace one attack with a [[/item .mmBite0000000000]]{Bite} attack.

Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only).name: Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only).description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Humanoid, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=GBKhdBPogHNssDIa]].

Failure: The target is cursed. If the cursed target drops to 0 Hit Points, it instead becomes a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmWerewolf000000]{Werewolf} under the DM's control and has 10 Hit Points.

Success: The target is immune to this [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s curse for 24 hours.

Cursed.name: Cursed
Cursed.description: The target is cursed if they fail their save.

Shape-Shift.name: Shape-Shift
Shape-Shift.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] shape-shifts into a Large wolf-humanoid hybrid form or a Medium wolf, or it returns to its true humanoid form, or it returns to its true form. Its game statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

XOTu5r3xft443V9P.name: Wight
XOTu5r3xft443V9P.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmStuddedLea]{Studded Leather Armor}

Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .mmNecroticSword0]] or [[/item .mmNecroticBow000]] in any combination. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item .mmLifeDrain00000]].

Life Drain.name: Life Drain
Life Drain.description:
Life Drain.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=FA4Mt9cXsYfHDDcs]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=FA4Mt9cXsYfHDDcs]] within [[lookup @range.value activity=FA4Mt9cXsYfHDDcs]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target's Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

A Humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmZombie00000000]{Zombie} under the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s control, unless the Humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at a time.

Xcn9r6lnzzE4O85V.name: Pigeon Hag
Xcn9r6lnzzE4O85V.description:
Pigeon Hag

Vermin Hag of Deception and Control

Habitat: Mountain, Planar (Fey), Urban

Pigeon hags are vain witches who place themselves above every other being. They seek to reinforce that belief by controlling and undermining the knowledge and relationships of others. Pigeon hags often insinuate themselves into a mortal settlement and walk among the people, usually in a position to hear and spread gossip that they can twist and manipulate to their own ends.

Secret. The vanity of a pigeon hag is so overwhelming that polishing its ego can leave it flustered and briefly unable to act.

Command (as 2nd-level spell).name: Command (as 2nd-level spell)
Command (as 2nd-level spell).description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. The spell has no effect if the target is undead, if it doesn't understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it.

Some typical commands and their effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the DM determines how the target behaves. If the target can't follow your command, the spell ends.

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target falls prone and then ends its turn.

Halt. The target doesn't move and takes no actions. A flying creature stays aloft, provided that it is able to do so. If it must move to stay aloft, it flies the minimum distance needed to remain in the air.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be &Reference[paralyzed] for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional humanoid for each slot level above 2nd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

materials.value: A small, straight piece of iron

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description: The target is Paralyzed for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. The illusion also ends if you dismiss it as an action or cast this spell again.

If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it.

If a creature uses its action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Stinking Cloud.name: Stinking Cloud
Stinking Cloud.description:
You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of yellow, nauseating gas centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. The cloud lingers in the air for the duration.

Each creature that is completely within the cloud at the start of its turn must make a Constitution saving throw against poison. On a failed save, the creature spends its action that turn retching and reeling. Creatures that don't need to breathe or are immune to poison automatically succeed on this saving throw.

A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the cloud after 4 rounds. A strong wind (at least 20 miles per hour) disperses it after 1 round.

materials.value: A rotten egg or several skunk cabbage leaves

Feeblemind.name: Feeblemind
Feeblemind.description:
You blast the mind of a creature that you can see within range, attempting to shatter its intellect and personality. The target takes 4d6 psychic damage and must make an Intelligence saving throw.

On a failed save, the creature's Intelligence and Charisma scores become 1. The creature can't cast Spells, activate Magic Items, understand language, or communicate in any intelligible way. The creature can, however, identify its friends, follow them, and even protect them.

At the end of every 30 days, the creature can repeat its saving throw against this spell. If it succeeds on its saving throw, the spell ends.

The spell can also be ended by Greater Restoration, heal, or wish.

materials.value: A handful of clay, crystal, glass, or mineral spheres

Feeblemind.name: Feeblemind
Feeblemind.description: The creature's Intelligence and Charisma scores become 1. The creature can't cast Spells, activate Magic Items, understand language, or communicate in any intelligible way. The creature can, however, identify its friends, follow them, and even protect them.

Dominate Person.name: Dominate Person
Dominate Person.description:
You attempt to beguile a humanoid that you can see within range. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be &Reference[charmed] by you for the duration. If you or creatures that are friendly to you are fighting it, it has advantage on the saving throw.

While the target is charmed, you have a telepathic link with it as long as the two of you are on the same plane of existence. You can use this telepathic link to issue commands to the creature while you are conscious (no action required), which it does its best to obey. You can specify a simple and general course of action, such as "Attack that creature," "Run over there," or "Fetch that object." If the creature completes the order and doesn't receive further direction from you, it defends and preserves itself to the best of its ability.

You can use your action to take total and precise control of the target. Until the end of your next turn, the creature takes only the actions you choose, and doesn't do anything that you don't allow it to do. During this time you can also cause the creature to use a reaction, but this requires you to use your own reaction as well.

Each time the target takes damage, it makes a new Wisdom saving throw against the spell. If the saving throw succeeds, the spell ends.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a 6th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. When you use a 7th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 1 hour. When you use a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 8 hours.

Dominate Person.name: Dominate Person
Dominate Person.description: The target is Charmed and must do its best to obey any commands sent by the caster.

Scrying.name: Scrying
Scrying.description:
You can see and hear a particular creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. If a target knows you're casting this spell, it can fail the saving throw voluntarily if it wants to be observed.

Knowledge Save Modifier
Secondhand (you have heard of the target) +5
Firsthand (you have met the target) +0
Familiar (you know the target well) -5
Connection Save Modifier
Likeness or picture -2
Possession or garment -4
Body part, lock of hair, bit of nail, or the like -10

On a successful save, the target isn't affected, and you can't use this spell against it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an Invisible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the Duration. A creature that can see Invisile Objects sees the sensor as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can choose a location you have seen before as the target of this spell. When you do, the sensor appears at that location and doesn't move.

materials.value: A focus worth at least 1,000 gp, such as a crystal ball, a silver mirror, or a font filled with holy water.

Word of Recall (lair as sanctuary).name: Word of Recall (lair as sanctuary)
Word of Recall (lair as sanctuary).description:
You and up to five willing creatures within 5 feet of you instantly teleport to a previously designated sanctuary. You and any creatures that teleport with you appear in the nearest unoccupied space to the spot you designated when you prepared your sanctuary (see below). If you cast this spell without first preparing a sanctuary, the spell has no effect.

You must designate a sanctuary by casting this spell within a location, such as a temple, dedicated to or strongly linked to your deity. If you attempt to cast the spell in this manner in an area that isn't dedicated to your deity, the spell has no effect.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.arzCrMRgcNiQuh43], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3Lo9boi7P2ro6QV4], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.oIzA2MEHwxhtQneU], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.TwlD4PLcltv7Xh7j]

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.hYCrN82dMJFuJODB], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.91Sw6vOIaO7U8DvM], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.fVbCxFRaORalHB20], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.76C0FdcxlU8F9Rl2]

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The hag makes three [[/item Claw]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Spellcasting]] (at will spells only).

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Agonizing Cackle.name: Agonizing Cackle
Agonizing Cackle.description: The hag laughs maniacally, and each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 45 ([[/r 10d8]]) psychic damage and is &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] until the start of the hag’s next turn. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage only.

Shape-shift.name: Shape-shift
Shape-shift.description: The hag shape-shifts into a Small or Medium Humanoid, or it returns to its true form. Other than its size, its game statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Disarming Vanity.name: Disarming Vanity
Disarming Vanity.description: As an action, a creature that flatters the hag forces it to succeed on a DC 17 Charisma saving throw or be &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] until the end of the hag’s next turn.

Harrying Wings.name: Harrying Wings
Harrying Wings.description: When the hag rolls initiative, it is surrounded by fey spirits in the form of angry pigeons. The hag’s enemies within 10 feet of it have disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls. This trait doesn’t function if the hag is &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false].

Coven Magic.name: Coven Magic
Coven Magic.description:
While within 30 feet of at least two hag allies, the hag can cast one of the following spells, requiring no material components, using the spell’s normal casting time, and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.4v2H3hHb3Ph9XLNd]{Augury}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.JGT5bNqu9REL7Fuz]{Find Familiar}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3OZnNhunvRtPOQmH]{Identify}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.SleYkHovQ8NagmeV]{Locate Object}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.MVzM1hRdci2imGdJ]{Lucky Charm}* (lasts until the hag casts it again, or chooses to end it with no action required), or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ccduLIvutyNqvkgv]{Unseen Servant}. The hag must finish a long rest before using this trait to cast that spell again.

The Brimstone Behemoth.name: The Brimstone Behemoth
The Brimstone Behemoth.description:
The Brimstone Behemoth

Apocalyptic Colossus of Hellfire

Habitat: Planar (Lower Planes), Underground

The emergence of the Brimstone Behemoth means armageddon for whatever realm it erupts into. A Fiend as old as time itself, it is made of hellfire, brimstone, and dying worlds. It has a malevolent will that seeks only to bring about mass extinction and apocalypse. The only hope for many civilizations has been through the regular willing sacrifice of citizens to slow or delay the inevitable doom to come.

Secret. If a soul willingly perishes in flame or lava to ensure the behemoth’s demise, the Fiend will find its flame quenched.

The Brimstone Behemoth’s Lair

The Brimstone Behemoth’s lair is a vast underground cavern filled with magma, flames, and smoke. Once this colossus awakens, the crater that its cavern becomes serves as its lair. If encountered in its lair, the Brimstone Behemoth has a challenge rating of 26 (90,000 XP).

The region containing the Brimstone Behemoth’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Relentless Blaze. Within 10 miles of the lair, flames become driven to spread and consume. Every hour, contained fires in that area have a 10 percent chance of spreading to a flammable object within 10 feet. Uncontained fires spread out of control in 10 minutes.

Tenacious Lava. A creature that takes damage from lava within 1 mile of the lair ignites. Until a creature within 5 feet of the fire takes an action to douse the flames, the target takes 3 (1d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

If the Brimstone Behemoth dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Cataclysmic Spellcasting (1/Day).name: Cataclysmic Spellcasting (1/Day)
Cataclysmic Spellcasting (1/Day).description: The Brimstone Behemoth casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.x5JNBSyIBBZsjcGT]{Earthquake} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.mF52ldF79Cr7wfQo]{Meteor Swarm}, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 24).

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The behemoth makes one [[/item Bite]] attack, and it makes two Claw or Blazing Boulder attacks in any combination.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] (escape DC 20). Until the grapple ends, the target is &Reference[Restrained apply=false].

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Blazing Boulder.name: Blazing Boulder
Blazing Boulder.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, range 150 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target is knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The behemoth can take 3 legendary actions (4 in Lair), choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The behemoth regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Fire Rain.name: Fire Rain
Fire Rain.description: The behemoth makes one [[/item Blazing Boulder]] attack.

Trample.name: Trample
Trample.description: The behemoth moves up to half its speed, and it makes one [[/item Claw]] attack. On a hit, if the target is a creature, it is knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Lava Well.name: Lava Well
Lava Well.description: The behemoth causes lava to cover the ground in its space and in any unoccupied spaces in any tunnels it left by burrowing within 100 feet. A creature that touches the lava for the first time on a turn or starts its turn in the lava takes 55 ([[/r 10d10]]) fire damage. A creature takes this damage only once per round. The lava cools and hardens after 1 hour or when the behemoth uses this action again.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Brimstone Behemoth’s lair is a vast underground cavern filled with magma, flames, and smoke. Once this colossus awakens, the crater that its cavern becomes serves as its lair. If encountered in its lair, the Brimstone Behemoth has a challenge rating of 26 (90,000 XP). The region containing the Brimstone Behemoth’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Brimstone Behemoth dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Relentless Blaze.name: Relentless Blaze
Relentless Blaze.description: Within 10 miles of the lair, flames become driven to spread and consume. Every hour, contained fires in that area have a 10 percent chance of spreading to a flammable object within 10 feet. Uncontained fires spread out of control in 10 minutes.

Tenacious Lava.name: Tenacious Lava
Tenacious Lava.description: A creature that takes damage from lava within 1 mile of the lair ignites. Until a creature within 5 feet of the fire takes an action to douse the flames, the target takes 3 ([[/r 1d6]]) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

Hellish Rebuke.name: Hellish Rebuke
Hellish Rebuke.description: When the behemoth is damaged by a creature it can see within 60 feet of it, it casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.22dPoeXfaaAv4K3h]{Hellish Rebuke} on the creature, using the same spellcasting ability as Cataclysmic Spellcasting.

Burning Sacrifice.name: Burning Sacrifice
Burning Sacrifice.description: If a creature willingly sacrifices its life in fire or lava for the purpose of defeating the behemoth, the creature can’t be returned to life by any means. For the next 24 hours, the behemoth has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws, its speed is halved, it has vulnerability to radiant damage, and it loses its Legendary Resistance trait.

Consuming Flame.name: Consuming Flame
Consuming Flame.description: When the behemoth deals fire damage, it can choose to deal necrotic damage instead.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the behemoth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The behemoth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Siege Monster.name: Siege Monster
Siege Monster.description: The behemoth deals double damage to objects and structures.

Tunneler.name: Tunneler
Tunneler.description: The behemoth can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 20-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

R1BQinrzA1doIVzQ.name: Hellish Rebuke
R1BQinrzA1doIVzQ.description:
When you are damaged by a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see, you point your finger, and the creature that damaged you is momentarily surrounded by hellish flames. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes 2d10 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

activation.condition: Which you take in response to being damaged by a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see

Earthquake.name: Earthquake
Earthquake.description:
You create a seismic disturbance at a point on the ground that you can see within range. For the Duration, an intense tremor rips through the ground in a 100-foot-radius circle centered on that point and shakes creatures and structures in contact with the ground in that area.

The ground in the area becomes difficult terrain. Each creature on the ground that is concentrating must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's Concentration is broken.

When you cast this spell and at the end of each turn you spend concentrating on it, each creature on the ground in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is knocked prone.

This spell can have additional Effects depending on the terrain in the area, as determined by the DM.

Fissures. Fissures open throughout the spell's area at the start of your next turn after you cast the spell. A total of 1d6 such fissures open in locations chosen by the DM. Each is 1d10 × 10 feet deep, 10 feet wide, and extends from one edge of the spell's area to the opposite side. A creature standing on a spot where a fissure opens must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall in. A creature that successfully saves moves with the fissure's edge as it opens.

A fissure that opens beneath a structure causes it to automatically collapse (see below).

Structures. The tremor deals 50 bludgeoning damage to any structure in contact with the ground in the area when you cast the spell and at the start of each of your turns until the spell ends. If a structure drops to 0 Hit Points, it collapses and potentially damages nearby creatures. A creature within half the distance of a structure's height must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 5d6 bludgeoning damage, is knocked prone, and is buried in the rubble, requiring a DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check as an action to escape. The DM can adjust the DC higher or lower, depending on the Nature of the rubble. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall prone or become buried.

materials.value: A pinch of dirt, a piece of rock, and a lump of clay

Meteor Swarm.name: Meteor Swarm
Meteor Swarm.description:
Blazing orbs of fire plummet to the ground at four different points you can see within range. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 20d6 fire damage and 20d6 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one fiery burst is affected only once.

The spell damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried.

Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has proficiency in one skill of the DM's choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

YanMa8w09aAgP7oZ.name: Drakkenhob
YanMa8w09aAgP7oZ.description:
Drakkenhob

Dragon Disguised as a Festival Horse

Habitat: Grasslands, Hills, Urban

Treasure: Any

The drakkenhob is a draconic monster with a sinister disguise, presenting itself as an actor wearing a horse costume, such as a mounted knight or a festively clad rider. Its draconic head resembles a decorated or armored horse’s head, and its sharp teeth fit together to appear like blunt, harmless decorations. The drakkenhob uses this benign guise to get close to its prey, which are typically within crowds near festivals or parades, before it summons its similarly garbed hunting hounds and strikes. Its breath is a blood-curdling wave of terror that makes lesser victims drop dead from fright alone.

Secret. Unable to resist revelry and merriment, drakkenhob are driven away by payment offered in gold or alcohol.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The drakkenhob makes two [[/item Rend]] attacks.

Rend.name: Rend
Rend.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Terrifying Breath.name: Terrifying Breath
Terrifying Breath.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature in a 30-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target drops whatever it is holding and has the &reference[frightened apply=false] condition. A Frightened target takes the Dash action and moves away from the drakkenhob by the safest route on each of its turns unless there’s nowhere to move. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Success: Half damage only.

Call The Hounds.name: Call The Hounds
Call The Hounds.description: The drakkenhob lets out a wolf-like howl and magically summons three hunting hounds (use the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.yawTeS8u2FCfzzZH]{Wolf} stat block) that appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of it. The hounds take their turn immediately after the drakkenhob on the same Initiative count, and they obey the drakkenhob’s mental commands. The hounds vanish when they or the drakkenhob drop to 0 Hit Points, or when the drakkenhob uses this Bonus Action again.

Irresistible Payment.name: Irresistible Payment
Irresistible Payment.description: As an Influence action, a creature that offers the drakkenhob alcohol or any amount of gold and succeeds on a DC 16 Charisma (Persuasion) check forces the drakkenhob to accept the offer and immediately take a Reaction to move up to half its Speed to get away from the creature by the safest route possible.

YlLuWhpb0HwH9nzA.name: The Tall Man
YlLuWhpb0HwH9nzA.description:
The Tall Man

Murderous Archfey of the Dark Wood

Habitat: Forest, Planar (Fey)

The Tall Man is a mysterious entity that haunts an accursed forest. Once, he was an archfey who ruled a now-forgotten court, renowned for its dances that lasted for nights on end. Doomed now to walk his rotting forest, the Tall Man finds pleasure where he can by tempting travelers and forest denizens alike to play hide and seek with him—with deadly results.

Secret. Dancing forgotten steps once performed in the fey court that the Tall Man formerly ruled shreds his being.

The Tall Man’s Lair

The Tall Man’s lair is the dark forest he now haunts, where his forgotten Fey court once thrived. If encountered in his lair, the Tall Man has a challenge rating of 21 (33,000 XP).

The region containing the Tall Man’s lair is changed by his presence, creating the following effects:

Deepening Shadows. Within 1 mile of the lair, shadows stretch far beyond what they should. Creatures can find a sufficiently shadowy spot to hide in, even without cover, 50 percent of the time.

Too Quiet. Sounds are muffled within 1 mile of the lair, halving the distance at which sounds can be heard.

If the Tall Man dies or moves his lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description: The Tall Man uses Spellcasting.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Tall Man makes two [[/item Claw]] attacks and uses [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast Vicious Mockery ([[/r 4d6]] psychic damage).

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 15 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 14) from one of two claws, and has the &reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The Tall Man can take 3 legendary actions (4 in Lair), choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The Tall Man regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

Teleport.name: Teleport
Teleport.description: The Tall Man teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. When he teleports, he can force a creature he is grappling to succeed on a DC 18 Charisma saving throw or teleport with him, appearing in the closest unoccupied space to the Tall Man’s destination.

Strike.name: Strike
Strike.description: The Tall Man makes one [[/item Claw]] attack, then can’t take this action again until the start of his next turn.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Tall Man’s lair is the dark forest he now haunts, where his forgotten Fey court once thrived. If encountered in his lair, the Tall Man has a challenge rating of 21 (33,000 XP). The region containing the Tall Man’s lair is changed by his presence, creating the following effects: If the Tall Man dies or moves his lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Deepening Shadows.name: Deepening Shadows
Deepening Shadows.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, shadows stretch far beyond what they should. Creatures can find a sufficiently shadowy spot to hide in, even without cover, 50 percent of the time.

Too Quiet.name: Too Quiet
Too Quiet.description: Sounds are muffled within 1 mile of the lair, halving the distance at which sounds can be heard.

Elusive Disguise.name: Elusive Disguise
Elusive Disguise.description: The Tall Man magically transforms into a Small or Medium Humanoid, or back to his true form. His statistics, other than his size, are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying changes to accommodate his new form. He can take on any features he chooses, but he is always unnaturally tall for whatever guise he takes. He returns to his true form if he dies.

Evasive Blink.name: Evasive Blink
Evasive Blink.description: When the Tall Man takes damage, he gains resistance to the triggering damage and teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the Tall Man fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The Tall Man has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Memory’s Dance.name: Memory’s Dance
Memory’s Dance.description: As a Bonus Action, a creature can perform some steps from a dance of the Tall Man’s court and make a DC 20 Charisma (Performance) check. On a success, the Tall Man takes 20 Force damage and has Disadvantage on D20 Tests until the start of the creature’s next turn.

RcNFXsC5dOf3CAKy.name: Spellcasting
RcNFXsC5dOf3CAKy.description:
Spellcasting. The Tall Man casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplViciousMoc]{Vicious Mockery} (4d6 Psychic damage)

2/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDarkness00]{Darkness}

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Vicious Mockery.name: Vicious Mockery
Vicious Mockery.description:
You unleash a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at one creature you can see or hear within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d6 Psychic damage and have Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d6 when you reach levels 5 (2d6), 11 (3d6), and 17 (4d6).

Mocked.name: Mocked
Mocked.description: The target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

YrHNHb9ZwdMqv3KC.name: Weasel Hag
YrHNHb9ZwdMqv3KC.description:
Weasel Hag

Hag of Soul Twisting and Terror

Habitat: Forest, Planar (Fey), Urban

Covetous and bedecked in stolen and gifted teeth, weasel hags are Fey creatures that sow nightmares and temptation to wickedness. They often surround themselves with weasels and boogleswarms, using them as spies, thieves to steal trinkets (especially lost teeth), and to spread their malign influence.

Secret. Weasel hags’ love of teeth goes beyond a mere quirk. They can’t refuse a tooth willingly given by its owner and can’t harm the owner for a time.

Blindness/Deafness.name: Blindness/Deafness
Blindness/Deafness.description:
You can blind or deafen a foe. Choose one creature that you can see within range to make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, the target is either &Reference[blinded] or &Reference[deafened] (your choice) for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

Blindness.name: Blindness
Blindness.description: The target is Blinded for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.

Deafness.name: Deafness
Deafness.description: The target is Deafened for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any.

The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

Ray of Enfeeblement.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
Ray of Enfeeblement.description:
A black beam of enervating energy springs from your finger toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength until the spell ends.

At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

Confusion.name: Confusion
Confusion.description:
This spell assaults and twists creatures' minds, spawning delusions and provoking uncontrolled action. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw when you cast this spell or be affected by it.

An affected target can't take reactions and must roll from the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables.RollTable.LHEts1oDaDwcehuj]{Confusion} table at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the radius of the sphere increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 4th.

Dream.name: Dream
Dream.description:
This spell shapes a creature's dreams. Choose a creature known to you as the target of this spell. The target must be on the same plane of existence as you. Creatures that don't sleep, such as elves, can't be contacted by this spell. You, or a willing creature you touch, enters a trance state, acting as a messenger. While in the trance, the messenger is aware of his or her surroundings, but can't take Actions or move.

If the target is asleep, the messenger appears in the target's dreams and can converse with the target as long as it remains asleep, through the Duration of the spell. The messenger can also shape The Environment of the dream, creating landscapes, Objects, and other images. The messenger can emerge from the trance at any time, ending the effect of the spell early. The target recalls the dream perfectly upon waking. If the target is awake when you cast the spell, the messenger knows it, and can either end the trance (and the spell) or wait for the target to fall asleep, at which point the messenger appears in the target's dreams.

You can make the messenger appear monstrous and terrifying to the target. If you do, the messenger can deliver a message of no more than ten words and then the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, echoes of the phantasmal monstrosity spawn a nightmare that lasts the Duration of the target's sleep and prevents the target from gaining any benefit from that rest. In addition, when the target wakes up, it takes 3d6 psychic damage.

If you have a body part, lock of hair, clipping from a nail, or similar portion of the target's body, the target makes its saving throw with disadvantage.

materials.value: A handful of sand, a dab of ink, and a writing quill plucked from a sleeping bird

Waking Terrors.name: Waking Terrors
Waking Terrors.description: The hag assaults the mind of one creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw (with disadvantage If the hag has one of the target’s teeth). On a failed save, the target takes 21 ([[/r 6d6]]) psychic damage and is &Reference[Frightened apply=false] for 1 minute. While &Reference[Frightened apply=false] in this way, the target perceives its allies as enemies born from its nightmares, but it isn’t compelled to act against or harm them. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only. At the end of each of its turns, a &Reference[Frightened apply=false] target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Shape-shift.name: Shape-shift
Shape-shift.description: The hag shape-shifts to resemble a Tiny weasel (walking speed 30 ft., climbing speed 30 ft.) or a Small or Medium Humanoid, or back into her true form. Her game statistics, other than her speed as a weasel and her size, are the same in each form. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Biting Gift.name: Biting Gift
Biting Gift.description: If a creature willingly offers one of its teeth to the hag, the hag must accept it and be &Reference[Charmed apply=false] for 24 hours, or until the creature or its allies deal damage to the hag or force it to make a saving throw.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Coven Magic.name: Coven Magic
Coven Magic.description:
While within 30 feet of at least two hag allies, the hag can cast one of the following spells, requiring no material components, using the spell’s normal casting time, and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.4v2H3hHb3Ph9XLNd]{Augury}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.JGT5bNqu9REL7Fuz]{Find Familiar}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3OZnNhunvRtPOQmH]{Identify}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.SleYkHovQ8NagmeV]{Locate Object}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.MVzM1hRdci2imGdJ]{Lucky Charm}* (lasts until the hag casts it again, or chooses to end it with no action required), or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ccduLIvutyNqvkgv]{Unseen Servant}. The hag must finish a long rest before using this trait to cast that spell again.

Animate Trees.name: Animate Trees
Animate Trees.description:
The treant magically animates one or two trees it can see within 60 feet of it. These trees have the same statistics as a treant, except they have Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1, they can't speak, and they have only the Slam action option.

An animated tree acts as an ally of the treant. The tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies; until the treant dies or is more than 120 feet from the tree; or until the treant takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

ZpqpWxE5kzFjsW72.name: The Brimstone Behemoth
ZpqpWxE5kzFjsW72.description:
The Brimstone Behemoth

Apocalyptic Colossus of Hellfire

Habitat: Planar (Lower Planes), Underground

Treasure: None

The emergence of the Brimstone Behemoth means armageddon for whatever realm it erupts into. A Fiend as old as time itself, it is made of hellfire, brimstone, and dying worlds. It has a malevolent will that seeks only to bring about mass extinction and apocalypse. The only hope for many civilizations has been through the regular willing sacrifice of citizens to slow or delay the inevitable doom to come.

Secret. If a soul willingly perishes in flame or lava to ensure the behemoth’s demise, the Fiend will find its flame quenched.

The Brimstone Behemoth’s Lair

The Brimstone Behemoth’s lair is a vast underground cavern filled with magma, flames, and smoke. Once this colossus awakens, the crater that its cavern becomes serves as its lair. If encountered in its lair, the Brimstone Behemoth has a challenge rating of 26 (90,000 XP).

The region containing the Brimstone Behemoth’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Relentless Blaze. Within 10 miles of the lair, flames become driven to spread and consume. Every hour, contained fires in that area have a 10 percent chance of spreading to a flammable object within 10 feet. Uncontained fires spread out of control in 10 minutes.

Tenacious Lava. A creature that takes damage from lava within 1 mile of the lair ignites. Until a creature within 5 feet of the fire takes an action to douse the flames, the target takes 3 (1d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

If the Brimstone Behemoth dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Cataclysmic Spellcasting (1/Day).name: Cataclysmic Spellcasting (1/Day)
Cataclysmic Spellcasting (1/Day).description: The Brimstone Behemoth casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplEarthquake]{Earthquake} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMeteorSwar]{Meteor Swarm}, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 24).

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The behemoth makes one [[/item Bite]] attack, and it makes two Claw or Blazing Boulder attacks in any combination.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 15 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 20). Until the grapple ends, the target has the &reference[restrained apply=false] condition.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 15 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Blazing Boulder.name: Blazing Boulder
Blazing Boulder.description: Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], range 150 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[prone apply=false] condition.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: Legendary Action Uses: 3 (4 in Lair). Immediately after another creature’s turn, the behemoth can expend a use to take one of the following actions. The behemoth regains all expended uses at the start of each of its turns.

Fire Rain.name: Fire Rain
Fire Rain.description: The behemoth makes one [[/item Blazing Boulder]] attack.

Trample.name: Trample
Trample.description: The behemoth moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one [[/item Claw]] attack. On a hit, if the target is a creature, it has the Prone condition.

Lava Well.name: Lava Well
Lava Well.description: The behemoth causes lava to cover the ground in its space and in any unoccupied spaces in any tunnels it left by burrowing within 100 feet. A creature that touches the lava for the first time on a turn or starts its turn in the lava takes [[/damage average]]damage. A creature takes this damage only once per round. The lava cools and hardens after 1 hour or when the behemoth uses this action again. The behemoth can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description:

Relentless Blaze.description: Within 10 miles of the lair, flames become driven to spread and consume. Every hour, contained fires in that area have a 10 percent chance of spreading to a flammable object within 10 feet. Uncontained fires spread out of control in 10 minutes.

Tenacious Lava.name: Tenacious Lava
Tenacious Lava.description: A creature that takes damage from lava within 1 mile of the lair starts burning, and it takes [[/damage average]] damage instead of 1d4 when it burns.

Hellish Rebuke.name: Hellish Rebuke
Hellish Rebuke.description: The behemoth casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHellishReb]{Hellish Rebuke} in response to that spell’s trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Cataclysmic Spellcasting.

Burning Sacrifice.name: Burning Sacrifice
Burning Sacrifice.description: If a creature willingly sacrifices its life in fire or lava for the purpose of defeating the behemoth, the creature can’t be returned to life by any means. For the next 24 hours, the behemoth has Disadvantage on D20 Tests, its Speed is halved, it has Vulnerability to Radiant damage, and it loses its Legendary Resistance trait.

Burning Sacrifice.name: Burning Sacrifice

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: (4/Day, or 5/Day in Lair). If the behemoth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The behemoth has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Siege Monster.name: Siege Monster

Tunneler.description: The behemoth can burrow through solid rock at half its Burrow Speed and leaves a 20-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

R1BQinrzA1doIVzQ.name: Hellish Rebuke
R1BQinrzA1doIVzQ.description:
When you are damaged by a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see, you point your finger, and the creature that damaged you is momentarily surrounded by hellish flames. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes 2d10 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

activation.condition: Which you take in response to being damaged by a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see

Earthquake.name: Earthquake
Earthquake.description:
You create a seismic disturbance at a point on the ground that you can see within range. For the Duration, an intense tremor rips through the ground in a 100-foot-radius circle centered on that point and shakes creatures and structures in contact with the ground in that area.

The ground in the area becomes difficult terrain. Each creature on the ground that is concentrating must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's Concentration is broken.

When you cast this spell and at the end of each turn you spend concentrating on it, each creature on the ground in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is knocked prone.

This spell can have additional Effects depending on the terrain in the area, as determined by the DM.

Fissures. Fissures open throughout the spell's area at the start of your next turn after you cast the spell. A total of 1d6 such fissures open in locations chosen by the DM. Each is 1d10 × 10 feet deep, 10 feet wide, and extends from one edge of the spell's area to the opposite side. A creature standing on a spot where a fissure opens must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall in. A creature that successfully saves moves with the fissure's edge as it opens.

A fissure that opens beneath a structure causes it to automatically collapse (see below).

Structures. The tremor deals 50 bludgeoning damage to any structure in contact with the ground in the area when you cast the spell and at the start of each of your turns until the spell ends. If a structure drops to 0 Hit Points, it collapses and potentially damages nearby creatures. A creature within half the distance of a structure's height must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 5d6 bludgeoning damage, is knocked prone, and is buried in the rubble, requiring a DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check as an action to escape. The DM can adjust the DC higher or lower, depending on the Nature of the rubble. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall prone or become buried.

materials.value: A pinch of dirt, a piece of rock, and a lump of clay

Meteor Swarm.name: Meteor Swarm
Meteor Swarm.description:
Blazing orbs of fire plummet to the ground at four different points you can see within range. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 20d6 fire damage and 20d6 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one fiery burst is affected only once.

The spell damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried.

Each fissure is [[/r 1d10 * 10]] feet deep and 10 feet wide, and it extends from one edge of the spell's area to another edge. A creature in the same space as a fissure must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall in. A creature that successfully saves moves with the fissure's edge as it opens.

Structures. The tremor deals [[/damage 50 type=bludgeoning]] damage to any structure in contact with the ground in the area when you cast the spell and at the end of each of your turns until the spell ends. If a structure drops to 0 Hit Points, it collapses.

A creature within a distance from a collapsing structure equal to half the structure's height makes a Dexterity saving throw.
