Serum Brute.name: Serum Brute
Serum Brute.description:
Serum Brute

Cursed Giant Enhanced by Alchemy

Habitat: Underground, Urban

Treasure: Any

Serum brutes are descended from giants who suffered an enduring curse when they failed to take over a Fey domain. They have third eyes, usually in their foreheads, which channel the giants’ curse into the world around them. All three of their eyes are sewn or otherwise sealed shut to contain the curse. Serum brutes are further enhanced with—and get their name from—a series of alchemical infusions, often delivered through implanted vessels and tubes, which seek to deaden their sorrow and pain, as well as the disturbing power of their third eyes. They form deep emotional bonds with any who offer them comfort and an escape from the pain of their curse, and they are often willing to die for those allies.

Secret. Serum brutes are dependent upon their curse, and magic that breaks curses can leave the giants debilitated and bereft.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The brute makes two [[/item Fist]] attacks and can use Cursed Gaze if available.

Fist.name: Fist
Fist.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 10 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If Caustic Secretion is active, the target takes an extra 11 ([[/r 2d10]]) Acid damage.

Cursed Gaze (Unleashed Eyes Only).name: Cursed Gaze (Unleashed Eyes Only)
Cursed Gaze (Unleashed Eyes Only).description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature in a 30-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[frightened apply=false] condition until the start of the brute’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Devotion.name: Devotion
Devotion.description:
Trigger: An ally within 5 feet takes damage.

Response: The ally gains Resistance to the triggering damage, and the brute takes an amount of Psychic damage equal to the damage the ally takes.

Curse Dependent.name: Curse Dependent
Curse Dependent.description: If the brute is targeted by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XZhdgVK3cLoxNCQl]{Remove Curse} spell or similar magic, until it finishes a Long Rest, the brute loses its Blindsight, its [[/item Withering Eye (Unleashed Eyes Only)]]{Withering Eye} trait, and its [[/item Cursed Gaze (Unleashed Eyes Only)]]{Cursed Gaze} action.

Stimulant Rush.name: Stimulant Rush
Stimulant Rush.description:
At the start of its turn, the brute must choose one of the following options (it can’t use that option twice in a row):

  • Catalyst Infusion. Until the start of its next turn, the brute’s Speed increases to 50 feet, it doesn’t provoke an Opportunity Attack when it leaves an enemy’s reach, and its Long Jump is up to 30 feet and its High Jump is up to 15 feet with or without a running start.

  • Caustic Secretion. Until the start of its next turn,
    its Fist attack deals an extra [[/damage average]] damage.

  • Stim Boost. Gain 10 Temporary Hit Points.

Unleashed Eyes.name: Unleashed Eyes
Unleashed Eyes.description: When the brute is Bloodied, its sealed eyes rip open and unleash its curse. It is no longer blind beyond 60 feet, and it can use its Withering Eye trait and Cursed Gaze action until it finishes a Long Rest, whereupon its eyes seal shut again.

Withering Eye (Unleashed Eyes Only).name: Withering Eye (Unleashed Eyes Only)
Withering Eye (Unleashed Eyes Only).description: When the brute moves to within 5 feet of a creature, the creature takes [[/damage average]] damage. A creature takes this damage only once per turn.

Wayward Haint.name: Wayward Haint
Wayward Haint.description:
Wayward Haint

Lost Soul Bound to Regret

Habitat: Any

Treasure: None

Wayward haints are restless spirits stuck between the realms of the living and the dead. Be it a curse or an unresolved conflict from their previous life, a haint can’t rest until their unfinished business is resolved.

Haints only show hints of who they were in life, taking on a more symbolic form related to the hurt or loss they can’t let go of. They tend to repeat their monotonous actions—often imitating those performed in life or reenacting their sorrow—over and over for eternity. When provoked, they can display a volatile temper and lash out with a crushing wave of the grief and indecision that binds their spirit.

Secret. Wayward haints can be trapped in empty bottles if they’re tricked or forced to pass over one.

Draining Regret.name: Draining Regret
Draining Regret.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target gains 1 &reference[exhaustion apply=false] level. This can’t raise the target’s Exhaustion level above 5, and all Exhaustion levels gained from this action end when the target finishes a Short or Long Rest, or if it receives a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.F0GsG0SJzsIOacwV]{Lesser Restoration} spell or similar magic

Bottle Trap.name: Bottle Trap
Bottle Trap.description: A haint that enters the space of an upright, empty bottle must succeed on a DC 16 Charisma saving throw or be drawn into the bottle, and a cork or stopper appears to close the bottle. The trapped haint can see and hear through the bottle out to 10 feet, and any creature in that range can hear the haint. The haint is released if the bottle breaks or another creature opens it.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The haint can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. It takes [[/damage average]] damage if it ends its turn inside a solid object.

aHAfPdP24eevOUSO.name: Wormhost Surgeon
aHAfPdP24eevOUSO.description:
Wormhost Surgeon

Parasitical Physician

Habitat: Any

Alien parasitic worms that infest the brains of Humanoid bodies mutate their hosts into wormhost surgeons. These aberrant husks are obsessed with anatomical study and with finding new Humanoids to infest with larval worm slurry to propagate their kind. They can pass for ordinary people in most cases but must take care to hide their exposed brains and the wriggling worms within their flesh.

Secret. Wormhost surgeons are drawn to seek out and infest sapient victims, so intelligent creatures with veiled minds slip beneath the surgeons’ notice.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The surgeon makes two [[/item Bone Saw]] attacks.

Bone Saw.name: Bone Saw
Bone Saw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. On a critical hit, if the target is a creature, its Intelligence score decreases by [[/r 1d4]]. The target dies if this reduces that score to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest.

Infested Spray.name: Infested Spray
Infested Spray.description: The surgeon unleashes a spray of worm-ridden cerebral fluid in a 20-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 17 ([[/r 5d6]]) psychic damage, and it is infested with larval parasitic worms. An infested target takes 7 (2d6) psychic damage at the end of each of its turns as the worms burrow toward its brain. The ongoing damage ends when the target takes poison damage or is targeted by an effect that ends the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points by this psychic damage, the worms reach its brain and it dies. A Humanoid slain in this way rises 24 hours later as a wormhost surgeon.

Protective Parasite.name: Protective Parasite
Protective Parasite.description: When the surgeon is reduced to 0 hit points, the parasite worm emerges from the surgeon’s exposed brain and spits acid in a 20-foot-long, 5-foot-wide line. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Regeneration.name: Regeneration
Regeneration.description: The surgeon regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns. If it takes poison damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of its next turn. The surgeon dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

Veiled Ignorance.name: Veiled Ignorance
Veiled Ignorance.description: A creature whose mind can’t be read, or that is under the effect of a Mind Blank or Nondetection spell, becomes &Reference[Invisible apply=false] toward the surgeon (this ignores the surgeon’s blindsight).

Ethereal Sight.name: Ethereal Sight
Ethereal Sight.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. It takes [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .yf1Nf7oPWS4arOOL]] attacks.

Etherealness.name: Etherealness
Etherealness.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplEtherealne]{Etherealness} spell, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is visible on the Material Plane while on the Border Ethereal and vice versa, but it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

88qd0Ulz7AMzouDU.name: Etherealness
88qd0Ulz7AMzouDU.description:
You step into the border regions of the Ethereal Plane, where it overlaps with your current plane. You remain in the Border Ethereal for the duration. During this time, you can move in any direction. If you move up or down, every foot of movement costs an extra foot. You can perceive the plane you left, which looks gray, and you can't see anything there more than 60 feet away.

While on the Ethereal Plane, you can affect and be affected only by creatures, objects, and effects on that plane. Creatures that aren't on the Ethereal Plane can't perceive or interact with you unless a feature gives them the ability to do so.

When the spell ends, you return to the plane you left in the spot that corresponds to your space in the Border Ethereal. If you appear in an occupied space, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and take Force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved.

This spell ends instantly if you cast it while you are on the Ethereal Plane or a plane that doesn't border it, such as one of the Outer Planes.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.You can target up to three willing creatures (including yourself) for each spell slot level above 7. The creatures must be within 10 feet of you when you cast the spell.

Horrific Visage.name: Horrific Visage
Horrific Visage.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=v8KiqUloIE5eocSu]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=v8KiqUloIE5eocSu]]-foot Cone that can see the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and isn't an Undead.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Success: The target is immune to this [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Horrifying Visage for 24 hours.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the start of the attacking creature's next turn.

Possession.name: Possession
Possession.description:
Charisma Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=7gmNBVjwuYTyANMe]], one [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=7gmNBVjwuYTyANMe]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=7gmNBVjwuYTyANMe]] feet.

Failure: The target is possessed by the [[lookup @name lowercase]]; the [[lookup @name lowercase]] disappears, and the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and loses control of its body. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] now controls the body, but the target retains awareness. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that specifically target Undead. The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s game statistics are the same, except it uses the possessed target's Speed, as well as the target's Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution modifiers.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 Hit Points or the [[lookup @name lowercase]] leaves as a Bonus Action. When the possession ends, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target, and the target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours.

Success: The target is immune to this [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Possession for 24 hours.

Incapacitated.name: Incapacitated
Incapacitated.description: The target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and loses control of its body.

bdayUVvMhDxmeOI6.name: Boneflayer
bdayUVvMhDxmeOI6.description:
Boneflayer

Voracious Carrion Eater

Habitat: Desert, Forest, Grassland, Mountain

Treasure: Any

Boneflayers are cruel, vulture-like creatures that originated from a broken fey pact. The creatures aren’t content to wait for something to die and instead make their own carrion to gorge upon—they delight in snatching prey in their talons, carrying it into the air, and dropping it to its death. Boneflayers earn their name by using their sizeable, filth-riddled beaks to cleave flesh from bone and hoard the meat until it ages enough for them to enjoy.

Cults sometimes use boneflayer killing grounds as a source of bones to burn in ritual bonfires, occasionally making pacts with the creatures to pay or trade for the creature’s castoffs. Villages that fear boneflayer attacks ward them off with thundering drums or gongs whenever they circle overhead.

Secret. A lingering result of the fey bargain that created them, boneflayers are disoriented and diminished by loud, thunderous noises.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The boneflayer makes one [[/item Beak]] attack and one [[/item Talons]] attack.

Beak.name: Beak
Beak.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Talons.name: Talons
Talons.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &reference[grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 14) from both talons. While Grappled, the target has the &reference[restrained apply=false] condition.

Swoop.name: Swoop
Swoop.description: If the boneflayer has a creature &reference[grappled apply=false], the boneflayer flies up to half its Fly Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks and drops that creature.

Flyby.name: Flyby
Flyby.description: The boneflayer doesn’t provoke an Opportunity Attack when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

Thunderous Ward.name: Thunderous Ward
Thunderous Ward.description: When the boneflayer hears a drum or gong, or takes Thunder damage, it has Disadvantage on D20 Tests until the end of its next turn.

c4tc1WRlyXLnMOBe.description:
Wayward Haint

Lost Soul Bound to Regret

Habitat: Any

Wayward haints are restless spirits stuck between the realms of the living and the dead. Be it a curse or an unresolved conflict from their previous life, a haint can’t rest until their unfinished business is resolved.

Haints only show hints of who they were in life, taking on a more symbolic form related to the hurt or loss they can’t let go of. They tend to repeat their monotonous actions—often imitating those performed in life or reenacting their sorrow—over and over for eternity. When provoked, they can display a volatile temper and lash out with a crushing wave of the grief and indecision that binds their spirit.

Secret. Wayward haints can be trapped in empty bottles if they’re tricked or forced to pass over one.

The Galloping Headsman.name: The Galloping Headsman
The Galloping Headsman.description:
The Galloping Headsman

Headless Executioner of Vengeance

Habitat: Forest, Grassland, Hill, Urban

The Galloping Headsman is a formidable combination of human and horse musculature fused with nightmarish magic and dark revenge. Gouts of flame burst from where its head and tail should be and dance dangerously along the edge of its massive two-headed axe. A burning, skull-shaped pumpkin floats eerily in one hand, its fiery visage a constantly shifting train of agonized faces.

Secret. The Galloping Headsman’s original skull is its greatest weakness, and anyone holding the skull becomes the apparition’s bane.

The Galloping Headsman’s Lair

The Galloping Headsman’s lair is the stretch of road that serves as the anchor point of the creature’s search for vengeance. If encountered in his lair, the Galloping Headsman has a challenge rating of 19 (22,000 XP).

The region containing the Galloping Headsman’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Encroaching Doom. Within 6 miles of the lair, an air of doom clings to creatures. Creatures have disadvantage on saving throws made to avoid or end the frightened condition that aren’t caused by the Galloping Headsman.

Interminable Journey. Paths warp and stretch within 6 miles of the lair. In that area, travel pace outside of combat is halved.

If the Galloping Headsman dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The headsman makes two [[/item Headsman’s Axe]] attacks and one [[/item Hooves]] attack.

Headsman’s Axe.name: Headsman’s Axe
Headsman’s Axe.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a creature with at least one head and the headsman rolled a 20 on the attack roll, the target must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or it is decapitated and dies if it can’t survive without a head. A target is immune to this effect if it takes none of the damage, has Legendary Actions, or is Huge or larger. Such a creature takes an extra [[/damage 8d6 Force]] damage from the hit.

Hooves.name: Hooves
Hooves.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the headsman moved at least 20 feet immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra [[/damage 2d8 Necrotic]] damage and has the &reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Flaming Skull.name: Flaming Skull
Flaming Skull.description:
The headsman hurls its skull, after which it reappears in the headsman’s hand.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 20, each creature in a 90-foot-long, 10-foot-wide Line.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Failure or Success: The target starts burning.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The headsman can take 3 legendary actions (4 in Lair), choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The headsman regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Move.name: Move
Move.description: The headsman moves up to half its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

Rancorous Gaze.name: Rancorous Gaze
Rancorous Gaze.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 18, one creature the headsman can see within 90 feet.

Failure: The target has the &reference[Frightened apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Failure or Success: The headsman can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Relentless Execution.name: Relentless Execution
Relentless Execution.description: The headsman makes one Headsman’s Axe attack with Advantage. If the target has the &reference[Frightened apply=false] condition, treat a 19 on the d20 as a 20. The headsman can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Galloping Headsman’s lair is the stretch of road that serves as the anchor point of the creature’s search for vengeance. If encountered in his lair, the Galloping Headsman has a challenge rating of 19 (22,000 XP). Interminable Journey.name: Interminable Journey
Interminable Journey.description: Paths warp and stretch within 6 miles of the lair. In that area, travel pace outside of combat is halved.

Binding Skull.name: Binding Skull
Binding Skull.description: The headsman has Vulnerability to any damage dealt by a creature holding the headsman’s original skull, and it has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls made against that creature.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the headsman fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The headsman has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

cqngSsseMctLr7Y6.description:
Alpengrendel

Brute Born of Mountain Ice

Habitat: Arctic, Mountain

Alpengrendel are hulking creatures covered in bluish white fur, with great tusks and horns. They were born of the ice and darkness of their mountaintop homes, shaped by the unseen hands of a deity of cold stone and gloam. The bitter cold of the mountain peaks infuses both their touch and their breath.

Alpengrendel draw upon the timelessness of the mountains, healing from otherwise lethal wounds in the blink of an eye. They fear only the power of lightning, which can slay them, and the power of the gods, whom they bitterly resent.

Secret. Their disdain for deities runs so deep that alpengrendel are enraged and unnerved by the trappings of faith.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The alpengrendel makes one [[/item Claws]] attack and one [[/item Tusks]] attack.

Tusks.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Frost Breath.name: Frost Breath
Frost Breath.description: The alpengrendel breathes out a 30-foot cone of frost. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 21 ([[/r 6d6]]) cold damage, and until the start of the alpengrendel’s next turn, its speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on attack rolls. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only.

Aversion To Faith.name: Aversion To Faith
Aversion To Faith.description: The alpengrendel has disadvantage on attack rolls while in a consecrated area or on attack rolls against a creature holding or wearing a holy symbol.

Regeneration.description: The alpengrendel regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns. If the alpengrendel takes acid or lightning damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of its next turn. The alpengrendel dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

dIyqjDIqRxD56Njq.description:
Kackle

Laughing Lantern Bearer

Habitat: Any

Those who were particularly sadistic in life and died consumed by wicked mirth linger as Kackles—ghostly figures that drift above the ground, always flitting just out of sight. Adorned in tattered cloaks and concealing hoods or hats, their hollow laughter echoes through dark places, fading in and out to confuse and terrify their victims. Kackles always carry lanterns lit with ghostly flames, the color of which changes to reflect a kackle’s current cruelty of choice.

Secret. Kackles are bound to their lanterns, and smashing their lights can snuff out the spirits’ existence.

Lantern Flame.name: Lantern Flame
Lantern Flame.description:
Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 90 ft., one target. Hit: Varies by lantern color (kackle’s choice):

  • Blue. 7 ([[/r 1d6 + 4]]) cold damage, and the target is &Reference[Restrained apply=false] until the end of its next turn.

  • Green. 20 ([[/r 3d10 + 4]]) necrotic damage, and the target’s speed is 0 until the end of its next turn.

  • Purple. 10 ([[/r 1d12 + 4]]) psychic damage, and the target is &Reference[Frightened apply=false] until the end of its next turn.

  • Red. 15 ([[/r 2d10 + 4]]) fire damage, and if the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature within 5 feet of the target takes an action to douse the flames, the target takes 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

Flickering Teleport.name: Flickering Teleport
Flickering Teleport.description: The kackle teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. The kackle can then change its lantern color, and each creature within 5 feet of the kackle’s destination space must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 ([[/r 3d8]]) damage of the same type as the current Lantern Flame color on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flickering Defense.name: Flickering Defense
Flickering Defense.description: The kackle adds twice its Dexterity modifier to its AC.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The kackle can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Lantern Vulnerability.name: Lantern Vulnerability
Lantern Vulnerability.description: The kackle’s lantern has AC 15 and immunity to poison and psychic damage. Any damage the lantern takes deals half that amount of force damage to the kackle.

dNjGVwXYioTw7396.name: Centipede Hag
dNjGVwXYioTw7396.description:
Centipede Hag

Hag of Pestilence and Flesh-Shaping

Habitat: Hill, Planar (Fey), Urban, Underground

Treasure: Arcana

Centipede hags are grotesque witches that revel in disease and filth, filling their presence with the scuttling vermin they adore. Their magic thrives in the corruption and warping of bodies, and they often engage in horrifying experimentation in grafting, swapping, and combining body parts to create nightmarish new creatures.

Secret. Centipede hags draw more than strength from the filth that covers them; it is the essence of their being. Scrubbing it away dissolves the hag.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplContagion0]{Contagion}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDisguiseSe]{Disguise Self} (24-hour duration), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHoldMonste]{Hold Person}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility} (self only)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplInsectPlag]{Insect Plague} (level 8 version), Polymorph

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The hag makes two [[/item Bite]] attacks or uses [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast Contagion. It can also use Warping Caress.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the hag’s next turn.

Warping Caress.name: Warping Caress
Warping Caress.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC 17, one creature within 5 feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target gains 1 &reference[exhaustion apply=false] level. Until the target’s Exhaustion level is reduced to 0, its body is warped and twisted, and it has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws that use Strength or Dexterity.

Success: Half damage only.

Failure or Success: If a Humanoid dies from this action, the hag can spend 2 days of work to shape its corpse into a Deepdreck*, or it can combine it with the corpse of a horse to create a Fleshdobbin*.

Coven Magic.name: Coven Magic
Coven Magic.description: While within 30 feet of at least two hag allies, the hag can cast one of the following spells, requiring no Material components, using the spell’s normal casting time, and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.4v2H3hHb3Ph9XLNd]{Augury}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.JGT5bNqu9REL7Fuz]{Find Familiar}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3OZnNhunvRtPOQmH]{Identify}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.SleYkHovQ8NagmeV]{Locate Object}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2024.tcm2024-player-options.Item.cp5KkAHN0XLDh5gc]{Lucky Charm}* (lasts until the hag casts it again, or chooses to end it with no action required), or Unseen Servant. The hag must finish a Long Rest before using this trait to cast that spell again.

Scoured Filth.name: Scoured Filth
Scoured Filth.description: he hag is burned by soapy water. Treat a bucket or flask of it splashed on the hag as a vial of Acid. If the hag is fully immersed in soapy water at the start of its turn, it takes 20 Acid damage.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The hag can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Contagion.name: Contagion
Contagion.description:
Your touch inflicts a magical contagion. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 11d8 Necrotic damage and have the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. Also, choose one ability when you cast the spell. While Poisoned, the target has Disadvantage on saving throws made with the chosen ability.

The target must repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns until it gets three successes or failures. If the target succeeds on three of these saves, the spell ends on the target. If the target fails three of the saves, the spell lasts for 7 days on it.

Whenever the Poisoned target receives an effect that would end the Poisoned condition, the target must succeed on a [[/save ability=con dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]], or the Poisoned condition doesn't end on it.

Infected (Strength).description:
• While &Reference[Poisoned apply=false], the target has Disadvantage on saving throws made with the chosen ability.

Disguise Self.name: Disguise Self
Disguise Self.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear heavier or lighter. You must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs as you have. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC.

Disguised.name: Disguised
Disguised.description: To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv]] check against your spell save DC.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Insect Plague.name: Insect Plague
Insect Plague.description:
Swarming locusts fill a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point you choose within range. The Sphere remains for the duration, and its area is &Reference[LightlyObscured] and &Reference[DifficultTerrain].

When the swarm appears, each creature in it makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 4d10 Piercing damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature also makes this save when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 5.

Polymorph.name: Polymorph
Polymorph.description:
You attempt to transform a creature that you can see within range into a Beast. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or shape-shift into a Beast form for the duration. That form can be any Beast you choose that has a Challenge Rating equal to or less than the target's (or the target's level if it doesn't have a Challenge Rating). The target's game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the chosen Beast, but the target retains its alignment, personality, creature type, Hit Points, and Hit Point Dice. See appendix B for a sample of Beast stat blocks.

The target gains a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the Hit Points of the Beast form. These Temporary Hit Points vanish if any remain when the spell ends. The spell ends early on the target if it has no Temporary Hit Points left.

The target is limited in the actions it can perform by the anatomy of its new form, and it can't speak or cast spells.

The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't use or otherwise benefit from any of that equipment.

Woodwarped.name: Woodwarped
Woodwarped.description:
Woodwarped

Facsimile Grown of Root and Vine

Habitat: Forest

Treasure: Armaments

Whispered among forest dwellers is the tale of a cursed vine, said to creep into the bodies of the living or the dead, twisting them into woodwarped. These wooden creations of tangled roots and bark take shape into a crude yet eerily familiar imitation of their hosts. Those that slay their hosts are sometimes clad in the stolen clothing and armor of their victims, silently wandering the woods with hollow eyes that reflect the unnatural force that binds them to the forest. Cutting pieces from their bodies is a dangerous proposition, as the fragments quickly grow into new woodwarped.

Secret. Woodwarped possess a deep fear of axes—tools capable of severing not only their bodies but their bond to the forest. The mere sight of an axe is enough to hold the creatures at bay, and the bite of its blade slices them like smoke.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The woodwarped makes two [[/item Claw]] attacks.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &reference[grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 14) from one of two claws.

Thorn Spray.name: Thorn Spray
Thorn Spray.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature in a 15-foot Emanation originating from the woodwarped, with Disadvantage if Grappled by it.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Success: Half damage only.

Splintered Propagation.name: Splintered Propagation
Splintered Propagation.description:
Trigger: The woodwarped takes Slashing damage that isn’t from a Battleaxe, Greataxe, or Handaxe.

Response: A fragment of the woodwarped breaks off and rapidly grows into a new Woodwarped* in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the original. The new woodwarped is Small, has 10 Hit Points, only has the Claw action, lacks this Reaction, and takes its turn on the original woodwarped’s Initiative.

Aversion To Axes.name: Aversion To Axes
Aversion To Axes.description: At the start of the woodwarped’s turn, if it can see a creature holding a Battleaxe, a Greataxe, or a Handaxe, it has the &reference[frightened apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn.

Thorns.name: Thorns
Thorns.description: At the start of each of its turns, the woodwarped deals [[/damage average]] damage to any creature it is grappling or any creature grappling it.

Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
Leather Armor.description: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The thug has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the thug's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The thug makes two melee attacks.

dRfYCxZw2dWRayry.name: The Daydreamer
dRfYCxZw2dWRayry.description:
Wayward Haint

Lost Soul Bound to Regret

Habitat: Any

Treasure: None

Wayward haints are restless spirits stuck between the realms of the living and the dead. Be it a curse or an unresolved conflict from their previous life, a haint can’t rest until their unfinished business is resolved.

Haints only show hints of who they were in life, taking on a more symbolic form related to the hurt or loss they can’t let go of. They tend to repeat their monotonous actions—often imitating those performed in life or reenacting their sorrow—over and over for eternity. When provoked, they can display a volatile temper and lash out with a crushing wave of the grief and indecision that binds their spirit.

Secret. Wayward haints can be trapped in empty bottles if they’re tricked or forced to pass over one.

Bottle Trap.name: Bottle Trap
Bottle Trap.description: A haint that enters the space of an upright, empty bottle must succeed on a DC 16 Charisma saving throw or be drawn into the bottle, and a cork or stopper appears to close the bottle. The trapped haint can see and hear through the bottle out to 10 feet, and any creature in that range can hear the haint. The haint is released if the bottle breaks or another creature opens it.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The haint can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. It takes [[/damage average]] damage if it ends its turn inside a solid object.

Draining Regret.name: Draining Regret
Draining Regret.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target gains 1 &reference[exhaustion apply=false] level. This can’t raise the target’s Exhaustion level above 5, and all Exhaustion levels gained from this action end when the target finishes a Short or Long Rest, or if it receives a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.F0GsG0SJzsIOacwV]{Lesser Restoration} spell or similar magic

Gobblegeist.name: Gobblegeist
Gobblegeist.description:
Gobblegeist

Blood-Drinking Avian Predator

Habitat: Forest, Hill

Gobblegeists are massive birdlike monsters with earth-toned plumage, reptilian faces and claws, and a metallic beak edged with sharp teeth. These ravenous creatures descend from forest canopies or hilltops to snatch their prey unawares and carry them off to feed on their blood in solitude. Their single, unblinking eye can unnerve and dazzle more alert prey, making would-be threats an easy meal.

Secret. The folk who venerate the Old Ways believe that a seven-pointed star repels gobblegeists. They keep the monsters at bay by painting or weaving star sigils from wicker to hang from their homes or in trees.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The gobblegeist makes two [[/item Beak]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a Talons attack.

Beak.name: Beak
Beak.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. The target’s hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken until it finishes a long rest, and the gobblegeist regains hit points equal to that amount.

Talons.name: Talons
Talons.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] (escape DC 15) from both talons, and it is &Reference[Restrained apply=false] until the grapple ends.

Eye Beam.name: Eye Beam
Eye Beam.description: The gobblegeist unleashes a beam from its eye in a line that is 120 feet long, and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 6 ([[/r 1d12]]) psychic damage and become &Reference[Stunned apply=false] until the start of the gobblegeist’s next turn.

Flyby.name: Flyby
Flyby.description: The gobblegeist doesn’t provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

Repelled By Stars.name: Repelled By Stars
Repelled By Stars.description: The gobblegeist can’t willingly move to a space within 10 feet of a seven-pointed star drawn on a surface or woven from wicker.

Priest Acolyte.description:

Divine Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Sanctuary.name: Sanctuary
Sanctuary.description: You ward a creature within range. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack roll or a damaging spell must succeed on a [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]] or either choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn't protect the warded creature from areas of effect. The spell ends if the warded creature makes an attack roll, casts a spell, or deals damage.

materials.value: a shard of glass from a mirror

Warded.name: Warded
Warded.description:
Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack roll or a damaging spell must succeed on a [[/save ability=wis format=long]] or either choose a new target or lose the attack or spell.

The spell ends if the warded creature makes an attack roll, casts a spell, or deals damage.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

eFeU72gl8ACIPRg7.name: The Crimson Abbot
eFeU72gl8ACIPRg7.description:
The Crimson Abbot

Unholy Crusader of Blood

Habitat: Hill, Mountain, Urban

In life, the Crimson Abbot was a virtuous crusader named Sir Marius Renathyr but was seduced by the sweet whispers of an archdevil of deceit and pride who masqueraded as a goddess of righteousness. On the brink of death, the abbot accepted the whispered offer for eternal life, and in so doing, was transformed into a creature of unbearable pride with an unquenchable thirst for blood. He continues to work in the name of his “goddess” and has gathered a fanatically loyal congregation eager for his promise of pure, everlasting life.

Secret. The Crimson Abbot’s pride is nearly unshakable, but seeing a true reminder of the righteous man he once was can crack his façade.

The Crimson Abbot’s Lair

The Crimson Abbot’s lair is a blood-soaked monastery where unworthy mortals are burned in sacrifice, and vampire minions study truths hidden in blood.

The region containing the Crimson Abbot’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Fresh Blood. Within 1 mile of the lair, spilled blood doesn’t dry out or coagulate, instead remaining fresh for 24 hours.

Incinerate Heresy. Within 1 mile of the lair, when an enemy of the abbot’s takes fire damage, that creature starts burning, taking 2 (1d4) damage at the start of its next turn.

If the Crimson Abbot dies or moves his lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. The spell has no effect if the target is undead, if it doesn't understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it.

Some typical commands and their effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the DM determines how the target behaves. If the target can't follow your command, the spell ends.

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target falls prone and then ends its turn.

Halt. The target doesn't move and takes no actions. A flying creature stays aloft, provided that it is able to do so. If it must move to stay aloft, it flies the minimum distance needed to remain in the air.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Disguise Self (can appear as a Medium Hu.name: Disguise Self (can appear as a Medium Humanoid, 24-hour duration)
Disguise Self (can appear as a Medium Hu.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends or until you use your action to dismiss it. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear thin, fat, or in between. You can't change your body type, so you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing or would feel your head and hair. If you use this spell to appear thinner than you are, the hand of someone who reaches out to touch you would bump into you while it was seemingly still in midair.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature can use its action to inspect your appearance and must succeed on an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You create one of the following magical effects within range:

  • Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute.
  • You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.
  • You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.
  • You create a sound that originates from a point of your choice within range.
  • You cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.
  • You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

Word of Recall (to lair only).name: Word of Recall (to lair only)
Word of Recall (to lair only).description:
You and up to five willing creatures within 5 feet of you instantly teleport to a previously designated sanctuary. You and any creatures that teleport with you appear in the nearest unoccupied space to the spot you designated when you prepared your sanctuary (see below). If you cast this spell without first preparing a sanctuary, the spell has no effect.

You must designate a sanctuary by casting this spell within a location, such as a temple, dedicated to or strongly linked to your deity. If you attempt to cast the spell in this manner in an area that isn't dedicated to your deity, the spell has no effect.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The abbot casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.arzCrMRgcNiQuh43], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.A3q2gTNqG6fvNGrv], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.MUO1uYN7JR1hm4dR]

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.76C0FdcxlU8F9Rl2]

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The abbot makes two [[/item Sanguine Blade]] attacks. He can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Blood Call]].

Sanguine Blade.name: Sanguine Blade
Sanguine Blade.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Blood Call.name: Blood Call
Blood Call.description: One creature other than a Construct or Undead within 30 feet of the abbot must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) necrotic damage and its hit point maximum is reduced by the damage taken until it finishes a long rest. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only. The abbot regains hit points equal to the damage taken. A Humanoid reduced to 0 hit points by this damage and then buried rises the following sunset as a Crimson Clergy* under the abbot’s control.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The abbot can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The abbot regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

Castigate.name: Castigate
Castigate.description: One creature the abbot can see within 60 feet of himself must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become &Reference[Frightened apply=false] for 1 minute. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Bloody Strike.name: Bloody Strike
Bloody Strike.description: The abbot moves up to half his speed and makes one [[/item Sanguine Blade]] attack.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Crimson Abbot’s lair is a blood-soaked monastery where unworthy mortals are burned in sacrifice, and vampire minions study truths hidden in blood. The region containing the Crimson Abbot’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Crimson Abbot dies or moves his lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Fresh Blood.name: Fresh Blood
Fresh Blood.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, spilled blood doesn’t dry out or coagulate, instead remaining fresh for 24 hours.

Incinerate Heresy.name: Incinerate Heresy
Incinerate Heresy.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, when an enemy of the abbot’s takes fire damage, that creature starts burning, taking 2 ([[/r 1d4]]) damage at the start of its next turn.

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: When the abbot is hit by an attack roll while holding a weapon, he adds 3 to his AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Half Plate Armor.name: Half Plate Armor
Half Plate Armor.description: Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It does not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps.

Honor Lost.name: Honor Lost
Honor Lost.description: If a creature takes a bonus action to present a memento or recite a reminder of the abbot’s past and succeeds on a DC 15 Charisma (Persuasion) check, the abbot has disadvantage on the next ability check, attack roll, or saving throw he makes before the start of the creature’s next turn.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the abbot fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The abbot can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Sunlight Hypersensitivity.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
Sunlight Hypersensitivity.description: The abbot takes 20 radiant damage if he starts his turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, he has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Salmon of Knowledge.name: Salmon of Knowledge
Salmon of Knowledge.description:
Salmon of Knowledge

Elemental Font of Wisdom (Crushed opal)

Habitat: Coastal, Planar (Elemental Plane of Water), Underwater

Treasure: None

Legends speak of the salmon of knowledge—shimmering fish said to embody the wisdom of the ages. Their scales gleam with an iridescent light, and they are forever enveloped in a sphere of gently flowing water that defies gravity. This magical orb is said to carry the essence of the sacred Current of Wisdom—where knowledge of all time and space flows through the rivers of the cosmos.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The salmon makes two [[/item Water Spray]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Prophetic Guidance]].

Water Spray.name: Water Spray
Water Spray.description: Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], range 20/60 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Prophetic Guidance.name: Prophetic Guidance
Prophetic Guidance.description: A creature the salmon can see within 30 feet gains a flash of foresight. Once in the next minute, when the creature fails a D20 Test, it can roll [[/r 1d4]] and add it to the total, potentially turning the failure into a success.

Echo From The Current.name: Echo From The Current
Echo From The Current.description:
Trigger: A creature within 5 feet makes an Intelligence or Wisdom check.

Response: The creature can use the salmon’s Wisdom modifier (+4) in place of its own ability modifier for the check.

Orb Of Water.name: Orb Of Water
Orb Of Water.description: The salmon is surrounded by a sphere of flowing water that moves with it. While inside of the sphere, the salmon has Resistance to Fire damage. A creature that grapples the salmon can choose to pull it out of the orb of water. The orb of water moves up to 20 feet toward the salmon at the start of each of the salmon’s turns. If it enters the salmon’s space, the Grappled condition ends on the salmon.

Water Breathing.name: Water Breathing
Water Breathing.description: The salmon can breathe only underwater.

eIRYEE63UuB0WVnC.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+2 to hit,, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage.

Swarm.name: Swarm
Swarm.description: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny bat. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

Shadow Stealth.name: Shadow Stealth

Sunlight Weakness.name: Sunlight Weakness

Strength Drain.name: Strength Drain

Melee Weapon Attack:+4 to hit,, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage.

The target's Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.If a non-evil humanoid dies from this attack, a new shadow rises from the corpse 1d4 hours later.

Gloomwood.name: Gloomwood
Gloomwood.description:
Gloomwood

Blighted Treant

Habitat: Forest, Swamp

Treasure: None

Gloomwoods were once treants in service to an archfey, but they were corrupted by a supernatural fungal blight. The growth bores through their trunks and into their souls, making the gloomwoods cruel and vicious, interested only in spreading more decay. Fungal spores drift from their trunks and branches, rotting any flesh and digging into the ground around them to spread the blight.

Secret. Carving the Sylvan name of the forest the gloomwood once called home into the creature’s trunk quells its aggression.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The gloomwood makes two attacks, using [[/item Slam]] or [[/item Fungal Fling]] in any combination.

Slam.name: Slam
Slam.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 10 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &reference[grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 16) from one of two branches. Until the grapple ends, the target has the &reference[restrained apply=false] condition.

Fungal Fling.name: Fungal Fling
Fungal Fling.description: Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], range 60/180 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Spore Stomp.name: Spore Stomp
Spore Stomp.description:
Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]]damage.

Hit or Miss: Each creature within a 20-foot Sphere centered on the target must make the following saving throw.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15.

Failure: 36 ([[/r 8d8]]) Poison damage, and the target has the &reference[poisoned apply=false]condition until the end of its next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Blighted Aura.name: Blighted Aura
Blighted Aura.description: The ground in a 20-foot Emanation originating from the gloomwood is Difficult Terrain from mushrooms and fungus that grow in the area. A creature that ends its turn in the Emanation takes [[/damage average]] damage.

Carved Past.name: Carved Past
Carved Past.description: As an action, a creature can use a Dagger or Woodcarver’s Tools to carve the name in Sylvan of the ancient home of the gloomwoods into the gloomwood’s trunk. Until the gloomwood finishes a Long Rest, it can’t use its Fungal Fling or Spore Stomp actions.

Fungal Step.name: Fungal Step
Fungal Step.description: The gloomwood ignores Difficult Terrain caused by plants or fungi.

Goat.name: Goat
Goat.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Charge.name: Charge
Charge.description:
If the goat moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 10 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

Sure-Footed.name: Sure-Footed
Sure-Footed.description: The goat has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

Ram.name: Ram
Ram.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+3 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

Night Creature.name: Night Creature
Night Creature.description:
Night Creature

Bestial Blood Hunter

Habitat: Any

Treasure: None

Night creatures are fiendish spirits bound into vampire-blood-tainted corpses through profane rituals. The hulking brutes are fanatically loyal to their creators, a fact some vampire overlords learn too late when those they employ to create the night creatures develop ambitions of their own.

Secrets. Night creatures are quickly undone by the purity of salt if wiped on a weapon and driven into a wound.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The night creature makes one [[/item Claw]] attack and uses [[/item Bite]].

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]] reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &reference[grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 14) from one of two claws.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14, one creature within 5 feet that is willing or that has the &reference[grappled apply=false], &reference[incapacitated apply=false], or &reference[restrained apply=false] condition.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. The target’s Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and the night creature regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

Shape-shift.name: Shape-shift
Shape-shift.description: If the night creature isn’t in sunlight, it shape-shifts into a Medium Humanoid or returns to its true form. Its game statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Blood Stalker.name: Blood Stalker
Blood Stalker.description: The night creature has Advantage on Wisdom checks made to find or track a creature that is missing any Hit Points.

Salt Susceptibility.name: Salt Susceptibility
Salt Susceptibility.description: The night creature has Vulnerability to damage from weapons wiped with salt. A creature can take a Bonus Action to wipe salt onto a weapon, which remains coated for 1 minute, or until it hits a creature.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The night creature can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Sunlight Hypersensitivity.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
Sunlight Hypersensitivity.description: The night creature takes [[/damage average]] damage if it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Club.name: Club
Club.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Training.name: Training
Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has proficiency in one skill of the DM's choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

Stench.name: Stench
Stench.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=mJbwhj3beOIB3Jgj]], any creature (other than a [[lookup @name lowercase]]) that starts its turn in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=mJbwhj3beOIB3Jgj]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn.

Success: The target is immune to the Stench of all [[lookup @name lowercase]] for 1 hour.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a non-Undead creature, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=nDM4WpckiZjvBzfg]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

ezKYW9TTWDhxSDDM.name: Devil’s Glove
ezKYW9TTWDhxSDDM.description:
Devil’s Glove

Five-Fingered Fungus (Rare wood chips)

Habitat: Forest, Swamp, Underground

Treasure: None

Comprised of five twitching, blood-red tendrils lined with black slime, the devil’s glove fungus feeds voraciously off decaying matter, unwary insects, and small creatures. Resembling a long-fingered hand, they grow from bulbous roots that look like leathery, white eggs and constantly emit an overpowering scent of death and rot. Despite their unpleasant aura, these fungus creatures can form beneficial relationships with others, providing nourishment and resilience in exchange for protection and a ready supply of decaying material to feed upon.

Tendril.name: Tendril
Tendril.description:
Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the devil’s glove attaches to the target. While attached, the devil’s glove can’t make Tendril attacks against other targets, and if the target is a creature, the target has the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn if it can smell the devil’s glove.

The devil’s glove can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement.

The target or a creature within 5 feet of it can detach the devil’s glove as an action.

Decaying Bloom.name: Decaying Bloom
Decaying Bloom.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC 12, each creature in a 10-foot Emanation originating from the devil’s glove.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target can’t regain Hit Points until the start of the devil’s glove's next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Symbiosis.name: Symbiosis
Symbiosis.description: The devil’s glove forms a magical bond with a willing creature it touches. The bonded creature doesn’t need to eat or drink, and the creature has Advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition. The bond ends when the creature dies, the devil's glove dies, the devil's glove ends the bond (no action required), or when the devil's glove uses this Bonus Action again.

Scent Of Death.name: Scent Of Death
Scent Of Death.description: Creatures that can smell have Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to find the devil’s glove.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The devil’s glove can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
Chain Shirt.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmBite0000000000]] attacks.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=F0T3hYR3EtUEMhvs]].

First Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. While Poisoned, the target's Hit Point maximum doesn't return to normal when finishing a Long Rest, and it repeats the save every 24 hours that elapse, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Subsequent Failures: The Poisoned target's Hit Point maximum decreases by 5 ([[/r 1d10]]).

First CON Save Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. While Poisoned, the target’s Hit Point maximum doesn’t return to normal when finishing a Long Rest, and it repeats the save every 24 hours that elapse, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Subsequent CON Save Failures: The Poisoned target’s Hit Point maximum decreases by 5 ([[/r 1d10]]).</p>

Breastplate.name: Breastplate
Breastplate.description: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered.

Rapier.name: Rapier
Rapier.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+3 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: The noble adds 2 to its AC against one melee Attack that would hit it. To do so, the noble must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

fCG5qm0hX4DtsndY.name: The Wild Titan
fCG5qm0hX4DtsndY.description:
The Wild Titan

Ferocious Giant of the Wilderness

Habitat: Arctic, Forest, Hill, Mountain

Wandering the most inhospitable mountain ranges, the Wild Titan is the wilderness made manifest, created long ago by a forgotten will for a purpose that none know. Favoring solitude in the most remote places of the world, when it encounters settlements and “civilized” people, it wants only to turn them to primal savagery or crush them beneath its immense bulk.

Secret. The name of the Wild Titan’s forgotten creator is its undoing. Recovering the lost name and carving its glyph form into a stone creates a zone that severs the titan’s connection to the wild.

The Wild Titan’s Lair

The Wild Titan’s lair is a hollowed-out peak in the mountain range the creature stalks. If encountered in its lair, the Wild Titan has a challenge rating of 22 (41,000 XP).

The region containing the Wild Titan’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Whiteout. Within 1 mile of the lair, there is a 75 percent chance every day of heavy precipitation.

Wild Hunger. Within 1 mile of the lair, creatures always feel ravenously hungry, no matter how much they’ve eaten. A creature that finishes a long rest in this area must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or gain 1 level of exhaustion. A creature that doesn’t require food succeeds automatically.

If the Wild Titan dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The titan makes two [[/item Massive Fist]] attacks. It can replace one or both attacks with a use of [[/item Thrown Boulder]].

Massive Fist.name: Massive Fist
Massive Fist.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 20 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the &referenve[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 20) from one of two fists, and it has the &reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Thrown Boulder.name: Thrown Boulder
Thrown Boulder.description:
The titan hurls a boulder at a point it can see within 150 feet.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 25, each creature in a 10-foot radius Sphere centered on that point.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Success: Half damage only.

Wild Roar.name: Wild Roar
Wild Roar.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 19, each of the titan’s enemies in a 100-foot Emanation originating from the titan.

Failure: The target has the &reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the start of the titan’s next turn. While Charmed in this way, the creature must use its action to make its most powerful melee or ranged attacks against the nearest creature it can see.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The titan can take 3 legendary actions (4 in Lair), choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The titan regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Arm Sweep.name: Arm Sweep
Arm Sweep.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 25, each creature in a 20-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Success: Half damage only.

Failure or Success: The titan can’t use this action again until the start of its next turn.

Stomping Stride.name: Stomping Stride
Stomping Stride.description: The titan moves up to its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks. It can enter a Huge or smaller creature's space, and the creature is pushed to nearest unoccupied space.

Crushing Hurl.name: Crushing Hurl
Crushing Hurl.description:
The titan hurls an object it is holding, a creature it is grappling, or a Large clod of earth to a space within 100 feet.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 25, each creature in the projectile's space, including a hurled creature.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Success: Half damage only.

Success or Failure: The titan can't use this action again until the start of its next turn.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Wild Titan’s lair is a hollowed-out peak in the mountain range the creature stalks. If encountered in its lair, the Wild Titan has a challenge rating of 22 (41,000 XP). The region containing the Wild Titan’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Wild Titan dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Whiteout.name: Whiteout
Whiteout.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, there is a 75 percent chance every day of heavy precipitation.

Wild Hunger.name: Wild Hunger
Wild Hunger.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, creatures always feel ravenously hungry, no matter how much they’ve eaten. A creature that finishes a long rest in this area must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or gain 1 level of &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false]. A creature that doesn’t require food succeeds automatically.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the titan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The titan has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Runic Sever.name: Runic Sever
Runic Sever.description: If the titan starts its turn within 50 feet of a stone at least 10 feet high and 10 feet wide that is carved with the glyph representing its forgotten creator, the titan takes [[/damage average]] damage and has the &reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn.

Siege Monster.name: Siege Monster
Siege Monster.description: The titan deals double damage to objects and structures.

fuJHMByh1BJraTQi.name: Gobblegeist
fuJHMByh1BJraTQi.description:
Gobblegeist

Blood-Drinking Avian Predator

Habitat: Forest, Hill

Treasure: None

Gobblegeists are massive birdlike monsters with earth-toned plumage, reptilian faces and claws, and a metallic beak edged with sharp teeth. These ravenous creatures descend from forest canopies or hilltops to snatch their prey unawares and carry them off to feed on their blood in solitude. Their single, unblinking eye can unnerve and dazzle more alert prey, making would-be threats an easy meal.

Secret. The folk who venerate the Old Ways believe that a seven-pointed star repels gobblegeists. They keep the monsters at bay by painting or weaving star sigils from wicker to hang from their homes or in trees.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The gobblegeist makes two [[/item Beak]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a [[/item Talons]] attack.

Beak.name: Beak
Beak.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. The target’s Hit Point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and the gobblegeist regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

Talons.name: Talons
Talons.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &reference[grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 15) from both talons, and it has the &reference[restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Eye Beam.name: Eye Beam
Eye Beam.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature in a 120-foot-long, 5-foot-wide line.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[stunned apply=false] condition until the start of the gobblegeist’s next turn.

Flyby.name: Flyby
Flyby.description: The gobblegeist doesn’t provoke an Opportunity Attack when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

Repelled By Stars.name: Repelled By Stars
Repelled By Stars.description: The gobblegeist can’t willingly move to a space within 10 feet of a seven-pointed star drawn on a surface or woven from wicker.
