Limited Telepathy.name: 有限心灵感应
Limited Telepathy.description: 该食腐兽可以魔法性地向120尺内能理解语言的任何生物传递简易信息和图像。这种心灵感应形式不允许接收生物以心灵感应回应。

Bite.name: 啃咬
Bite.description:
近战武器攻击:命中+6,, 触及5尺, 单一目标。命中: 12 (2d8 + 3) 点穿刺伤害。

如果目标是一个生物, 它必须进行一次 DC15体质 豁免以抵抗疾病, 否则中毒直至疾病被治愈。每经过24小时, 目标必须重复该豁免, 失败则其生命值上限减少5 (1d10)。豁免成功则疾病被治愈。若疾病使目标的生命值上限降至0, 则目标死亡。此生命值上限的降低效果持续至疾病被治愈。

Tentacle.name: 触须
Tentacle.description:
近战武器攻击：命中+6，, 触及10尺，单一目标。命中：7（1d8 + 3）钝击伤害外加4（1d8）穿刺伤害。

若目标为中型或更小的生物，则其陷入受擒状态（逃脱DC 13）并在受擒持续期间同时陷入束缚状态。食腐兽有两条触手，每条触手可擒抱一个目标。

Tentacle Slam.name: 触须猛击
Tentacle Slam.description:
食腐兽将其擒抱的生物猛撞向彼此或坚固表面。每个生物必须进行一次DC14体质豁免，若失败则受到10 (2d6 + 3) 钝击伤害并被震慑直至食腐兽的下一回合结束。

若豁免成功，目标受到一半钝击伤害且不会被震慑。

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击Multiattack。
Multiattack.description: 该食腐兽发动三次攻击：一次啃咬和两次触须。

rAQGFdLEjXhY6W0Y.name: 魂火添柴者
rAQGFdLEjXhY6W0Y.description:
魂火司炉

引擎诞生的火焰与死亡精魄

栖息地：位面（火元素位面），城市

宝藏：无

魂火司炉是栖息于焚烧尸体或灵魂的熔炉，引擎和锅炉中的火焰元素精魄。由此诞生的生物由幽灵般的火焰与蒸汽构成，并环绕着形似其宿主机械的幻影铁板。作为火焰与负能量的噼啪混合物，魂火司炉既能焚毁肉体亦能灼烧灵魂。

隐秘。魂火司炉会被迫焚烧其视野内的尸体，因此死物可被用作引诱这些精魄的诱饵。

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击Multiattack。
Multiattack.description: 该司炉工发动两次[[/item Sear]]攻击。

Sear.name: 灼烧
Sear.description: 近战攻击检定: [[/attack]], 触及5尺. 命中: [[/damage average]] 伤害, 且目标在其下一次攻击检定中具有劣势, 直到该元素生物的下个回合开始.

Spectral Steam.name: 灵界蒸汽
Spectral Steam.description:
司炉工释放出一道发光的灵体蒸汽冲击。

敏捷豁免： DC 13，30尺锥状范围内的每个生物。

失败： 1分钟内，目标在10尺半径内散发微光光照，且无法从&reference[invisible apply=false]状态中获得效益。

Spectral Steam.name: 灵体蒸汽
Spectral Steam.description: 该生物在10尺半径内散发出微光光照，持续1分钟，在此期间，它无法躲藏或从隐形中获得效益。

Corpse Fuel.name: 尸体燃料
Corpse Fuel.description: 如果司炉在其回合开始时能看到一具尸体，它必须尽可能移动至进入该尸体的空间，并使用其动作将尸体焚化。中型或更小的尸体会化为灰烬，更大的尸体则会被部分焚化并缩小一级体型。

Fire Form.name: 火焰形态
Fire Form.description: 司炉工可以穿过仅1英寸宽的空间而无需为此消耗额外移动力，并且它能进入一个生物的空间并在那里停下。在它的回合中首次进入一个生物的空间时，该生物受到[[/damage average]]伤害。

Illumination.name: 照明
Illumination.description: 该司炉工在30尺半径范围内散发出微光光照。

Soul Burn.name: 灵魂灼烧
Soul Burn.description: 在司炉每回合结束时，源自司炉的5尺光环范围内的每个生物受到[[/damage average]]伤害。

rFMEL5osbYoxsJEZ.name: 迷途怨灵
rFMEL5osbYoxsJEZ.description:
迷途怨魂

被悔恨束缚的迷失灵魂

栖息地：任意

迷途怨魂是困在生者与亡者领域之间的不安精魄。无论是诅咒还是前世未解的冲突，怨魂在其未尽之事解决前都无法安息。

怨魂仅会显露生前身份的片段痕迹，呈现出与其无法释怀的伤痛或失落相关的象征形态。它们往往会永恒重复单调的行为——通常是模仿生前所作所为或重演其悲恸。被激怒时，它们会爆发出不稳定的脾气，并用束缚其精魄的哀恸与彷徨化作毁灭性的冲击。

秘密。若被诱骗或强迫穿过空瓶，迷途怨魂可被囚禁其中。

Draining Regret.name: 汲怨
Draining Regret.description: 近战武器攻击： [[/attack]] 命中，触及5尺，单一目标。命中：[[/damage average]] 伤害，且目标获得1级&Reference[Exhaustion apply=false]。这无法使目标的&Reference[Exhaustion apply=false]等级超过5级，且所有通过此动作获得的&Reference[Exhaustion apply=false]等级会在目标完成一次短休或长休时，或当它受到次级复原术法术或类似魔法时结束。

Bottle Trap.name: 瓶装陷阱
Bottle Trap.description: 一个进入直立空瓶空间的鬼魂必须进行一次DC 16的魅力豁免，若失败则被吸入瓶中，同时会出现一个软木塞或瓶塞封住瓶口。被困的鬼魂可以通过瓶子看到和听到10尺范围内的动静，该范围内的任何生物也能听见鬼魂的声音。如果瓶子破裂或其他生物打开瓶塞，鬼魂便会获得释放。

Incorporeal Movement.name: 虚体移动
Incorporeal Movement.description: 该鬼魂可以穿过其他生物和物件，如同它们是困难地形。如果它在固体物件内结束其回合，则受到5（[[/r 1d10]]）力场伤害。

The Weeping Widow.name: 哭泣的寡妇
The Weeping Widow.description:
悲泣寡妇

恶毒医术的主母

栖息地： 地下, 城市

悲泣寡妇曾是一位致力于通过神圣仪式治愈病患的女祭司，在经历个人悲剧后她背弃了众神，转而投身邪恶科学。她坚信自己懂得如何最好地治疗受苦者并让他们变得更强大，因而实施了一套令人毛骨悚然的炼金与医学实验方案——无论患者是否愿意接受治疗，她都会清除其心智并改造其身体。

秘密。 迫使悲泣寡妇名副其实的唯一方法，是让她想起失去的家人，例如她丈夫的剑或肖像，这会迫使她直面自己如今的蜕变。

悲泣寡妇的巢穴

悲泣寡妇的巢穴是她进行恐怖实验的疗养院。

包含悲泣寡妇巢穴的区域会因她的存在而产生以下变化：

记忆钝化。 在巢穴1英里范围内，生物在进行与痛苦或情感记忆相关的信息回忆时，其智力检定具有劣势。

梦境褪色。 在巢穴1英里范围内，睡眠或出神的生物仅能对梦境产生模糊印象，无法回忆起任何细节。

如果悲泣寡妇死亡或将巢穴迁至他处，这些效果会立即终止。

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击Multiattack。
Multiattack.description: 该寡妇发动两次[[/item Injection]]攻击。

Injection.name: 注入
Injection.description:
近战或远程武器攻击：[[/attack]] 命中，触及5尺或射程60尺，单一目标。命中：[[/damage average]]伤害。若目标是一个生物，则其陷入&Reference[Poisoned apply=false]状态直至其下一回合结束。处于&Reference[Poisoned apply=false]状态时，目标将遭受以下由黑寡妇抉择的效应之一（每个选项每回合只能使用一次）：

  • 恐骇刺激素。 目标陷入&Reference[Frightened apply=false]状态。在其回合开始时，目标必须成功通过一次DC16感知豁免，否则将执行疾走动作并沿最安全最短的可用路径远离黑寡妇，除非无处可移。

  • 催眠注入剂。 目标必须成功通过一次DC16体质豁免，否则其速度减半，且在其回合内只能选择执行一个动作或一个附赠动作（不可兼得），若执行攻击动作则仅能发动一次攻击。若豁免失败差值达到5或更高，目标将陷入&Reference[Unconscious apply=false]状态持续1分钟，直至受到伤害或有生物用动作将其摇醒。

  • 神迹抑制素。 若目标施展法术，则必须成功通过一次DC16体质豁免，否则法术失效，但用于施展该法术的法术位不会消耗。

Legendary Actions.name: 传奇动作
Legendary Actions.description: 该寡妇可以执行3次传奇动作，从下列选项中选择。每次只能使用一种传奇动作选项，且只能在另一个生物回合结束时执行。该寡妇在其回合开始时恢复所有已消耗的传奇动作。

Alacrity.name: 迅捷
Alacrity.description: 该寡妇或她骑乘的生物移动至多一半其速度，且不触发借机攻击。

Hypertrophic Injections.name: 增生注射剂
Hypertrophic Injections.description:
寡妇以自身或5尺内一名盟友为目标，并赋予目标一个她选择的下列效果；直到她的下个回合开始前，她无法再次以同一盟友为目标：

  • 侵略。目标在其下个回合结束前进行的攻击检定具有优势。

  • 坚韧。由寡妇选择的下列一项状态在目标身上结束：魅惑, 恐慌, 受擒, 麻痹, 中毒, 束缚, 震慑。

  • 活力。目标恢复10点生命值。

Lair Actions.name: 巢穴动作
Lair Actions.description: 哀恸寡妇的巢穴是她进行恐怖实验的疗养院。包含哀恸寡妇巢穴的区域会因其存在而发生改变，产生以下效果： 若哀恸寡妇死亡或将巢穴迁至他处，这些效果立即终止。

Dulled Memories.name: 迟钝的记忆
Dulled Memories.description: 在巢穴1英里范围内，生物在回忆与痛苦或情感记忆相关的信息时进行的智力检定具有劣势。

Faded Dreams.name: 褪色的梦
Faded Dreams.description: 在巢穴1英里范围内，睡眠或出神的生物只会对梦境产生模糊的印象，并且无法回忆起任何细节。

Calculating Defense.name: 计算防御
Calculating Defense.description: 该寡妇将其智力调整值而非敏捷调整值加到护甲等级上。

Legendary Resistance.name: 传奇抗性
Legendary Resistance.description: 如果寡妇在豁免检定中失败，她可以选择改为成功。

Reopened Memories.name: 重拾的记忆
Reopened Memories.description: 在她的回合开始时，如果寡妇能看到她丈夫的遗物或其他迫使她意识到自己失去了什么的提醒物，她在属性检定、攻击骰和豁免上具有劣势，并且直到她的下个回合开始前只能使用2次她的传奇动作。

rpVeW1GIxe9pyN64.name: 欢歌者
rpVeW1GIxe9pyN64.description:
欢歌狂宴魔

音乐与舞蹈的邪魔

栖息地：位面(下层位面), 城市

欢歌狂宴魔是精通音乐与放纵的邪魔,它们将艺术转化为毁灭性的共振来对抗敌人。这些狂宴魔几乎无时无刻不在舞蹈演奏,若其发出的庆典邀约遭到拒绝,便会陷入众所周知的杀戮狂暴。根据演奏乐器的不同,存在多种类型的欢歌狂宴魔:嗡鸣狂宴魔演奏手摇琴,周身环绕着蜂群和声;鼓点狂宴魔敲击鼓或铙钹,世界随其节拍震颤;钟鸣狂宴魔演奏各类铃铛,编钟或铜锣,其鸣响会淹没所有其他声音。

秘密。欢歌狂宴魔无法接受任何生物在乐器演奏上比它们更娴熟,因此绝不会拒绝音乐挑战。

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击Multiattack。
Multiattack.description: 该狂欢者发动两次[[/item Instrumental Blast]]攻击。

Instrumental Blast.name: 乐器爆鸣
Instrumental Blast.description: 近战或远程法术攻击：[[/attack]]命中，触及5尺或射程90尺，单一目标。命中：[[/damage average]]伤害。

Infectious Rhythm (Drum Only).name: 感染性节奏（仅限鼓）
Infectious Rhythm (Drum Only).description: 狂欢者奏响一段激动人心的节拍。狂欢者指定其30尺内可见的至多两个生物必须进行一次DC 16的感知豁免。豁免失败时，目标受到18（[[/r 4d8]]）心灵伤害并受@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.TfRzwEgBHHkCc6Ql]{狂舞术}法术影响（维持此法无需&Reference[Concentration]）。豁免成功时，目标仅受到一半伤害。

Stunning Clangor (Bell Only).name: 震耳钟鸣（仅限钟）
Stunning Clangor (Bell Only).description: 欢宴者摇响其铃铛。欢宴者在其自身60尺范围内可见的一个由它选择的单一生物必须进行一次DC 16体质豁免。豁免失败，目标受到40（[[/r 9d8]]）雷鸣伤害，并且直到欢宴者的下个回合结束前陷入&Reference[Stunned apply=false]状态。豁免成功，则目标仅受到一半伤害。

Compelled Contest.name: 强制对抗
Compelled Contest.description: 纵情者无法拒绝一场乐器技能的对抗。作为一个动作，一个生物可以使用乐器进行一次魅力（表演）检定。纵情者必须进行一次魅力豁免，其DC等于该检定的总值，否则受到20点心灵伤害并且被&Reference[Stunned apply=false]直到该生物的下个回合结束。

Dancing Step.name: 舞步
Dancing Step.description: 当狂欢者离开敌人的触及范围时，它不会引发借机攻击。

Ensemble Form.name: 合奏形态
Ensemble Form.description: 狂欢者会呈现一种特定形态：嗡鸣者、鼓手或钟鸣者。该形态决定了狂欢者的某些特质和动作，以及其所演奏的乐器（分别为手摇风琴、框鼓或手摇铃）。

Droning Swarm (Drone Only).name: 嗡鸣集群（仅限嗡鸣）
Droning Swarm (Drone Only).description: 一群嗡嗡作响的蜜蜂集群环绕着狂欢者。任何在其回合结束时位于狂欢者10尺范围内的生物必须进行一次DC 16体质豁免，若失败则直至其下一回合结束前陷入&Reference[Poisoned apply=false]状态。

Irresistible Dance.name: 无法抗拒的舞步
Irresistible Dance.description:
选择射程内你能看见的单一生物。目标开始原地跳起滑稽的舞蹈：在法术持续时间内，它会一直拖着步子、跺脚、跳跃。无法被魅惑的生物免疫此法术。

跳舞的生物必须用其全部移动力在其空间内跳舞，并且在敏捷豁免和攻击检定中具有劣势。当目标受此法术影响时，其他生物对其进行的攻击检定具有优势。跳舞的生物可以以一个动作进行一次感知豁免以重新控制自己。豁免成功则法术终止。

sBhEgppDRAyDr83t.name: 无名之物
sBhEgppDRAyDr83t.description:
无名之物

来自域外的不可知生命体（陨星碎片）

栖息地：任意

宝藏：无

无名之物是被束缚在物质容器中的异界心智，最常见的载体是小型动物、物品或怪物残片。当外界影响渗入现实时，这些生物可能悄然潜入世间，但通常是被刻意召唤而来。

Psychic Strike.name: 心灵打击
Psychic Strike.description: 近战攻击检定: [[/attack]], 触及5尺. 命中: [[/damage average]]伤害, 并且如果目标是一个生物, 它将获得&reference[frightened apply=false]状态直到无名之物下一回合开始.

Invisibility.name: 隐形术
Invisibility.description:
该无名之物对自身施放@{UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsterfeatures.Item.dA5X2eQuOtHywpQF]{隐形术}}, 无需任何法术部件并以智力作为施法关键属性。

当它施放该法术时, 该无名之物可将法术效果延伸至其接触的生物。

若任一生物自行解除法术效果, 或该无名之物停止接触另一生物, 则法术提前终止。当该无名之物以此方式延伸法术后, 直至完成一次长休前无法再次使用此能力。

Flyby.name: 飞掠
Flyby.description: 当这无名之物飞离敌人的触及范围时，不会引发借机攻击。

lreOluzngLGVgfTI.name: 隐形术
lreOluzngLGVgfTI.description:
你触及的一个生物变为隐形,直至法术终止。目标穿着或携带的任何物件只要在其身上也会保持隐形。若目标发动攻击或施展法术,则该法术对其终止。

升环施法效应. 施展该法术时,若你使用的法术位为3环或更高,则法术位每比2环高一环,你就能多指定一个生物作为目标。

materials.value: 包裹在阿拉伯树胶中的睫毛

Invisibility.name: 隐形术invisibility
Invisibility.description: 目标变为隐形，直至该法术结束。目标穿着或携带的任何物品，只要在其身上，也会变为隐形。若目标发动攻击或施展法术，则法术对其结束。

g0GqdOm8kbpLyBkw.name: 隐形术
g0GqdOm8kbpLyBkw.description:
你触及的一个生物获得&Reference[invisible apply=false]状态，直至该法术结束。在该目标进行攻击检定、造成伤害或施放法术之后，该法术立即提前结束。

使用更高法术位。你使用的法术位每比2环高1环，就可以多以一个生物作为目标。

materials.value: 阿拉伯胶中的一根睫毛

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Club.name: Club
Club.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Training.name: Training
Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has proficiency in one skill of the DM's choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

sQSy0zW3FJBAEguY.name: Sheridan Heyling
sQSy0zW3FJBAEguY.description:
Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Club.name: Club
Club.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+2 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

sRRjGK3Vncvf3WlS.name: The Weeping Widow
sRRjGK3Vncvf3WlS.description:
The Weeping Widow

Matron of Malevolent Medicine

Habitat: Underground, Urban

Once a priestess committed to healing the sick through divine rites, the Weeping Widow abandoned the gods after a personal tragedy and turned to sinister science. Believing she knows how to best treat the suffering and make them stronger, she employs a harrowing regimen of alchemical and medical experimentation to wipe minds and alter bodies, whether the patient wants the treatment or not.

Secret. The only way to force the Weeping Widow to live up to her moniker is to remind her of the family she lost, such as her husband’s sword or portrait, which forces her to confront what she has become.

The Weeping Widow’s Lair

The Weeping Widow’s lair is the sanitorium where she conducts her horrific experiments.

The region containing the Weeping Widow’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Dulled Memories. Within 1 mile of the lair, creatures have disadvantage on Intelligence checks made to recall information related to painful or emotional memories.

Faded Dreams. Within 1 mile of the lair, creatures who sleep or trance have only vague impressions of dreams and recall no details.

If the Weeping Widow dies or moves her lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The widow makes two [[/item Injection]] attacks.

Injection.name: Injection
Injection.description:
Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a creature, it has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn. While Poisoned, the target suffers one of the following effects of the widow’s choice (each option can only be used once per turn):

Hyperphobic Stimulant. The target has the &reference[Frightened apply=false] condition. At the start of its turn, the target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or take the Dash action and move away from the widow by the safest and shortest available route, unless there is nowhere to move.

Soporific Infusion.

  • Constitution Saving Throw: DC 16, the target hit by Injection.

  • Failure: The target’s Speed is halved. On its turn, it can take either an action or a Bonus Action, but not both, and it can make only one attack if it takes the Attack action.

  • Failure by 5 or More: The target has the Unconscious condition for 1 minute, until it takes damage, or until a creature takes an action to shake it awake.

Thaumaturgic Inhibitor. If the target casts a spell, it must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or the spell fails, but a spell slot used to cast the spell isn’t expended.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The widow can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The widow regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

Alacrity.name: Alacrity
Alacrity.description: The widow or a creature she is riding moves up to half its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

Hypertrophic Injections.name: Hypertrophic Injections
Hypertrophic Injections.description:
The widow targets herself or an ally within 5 feet and grants the target one of the following effects of her choice; she can’t take this action again until the start of her next turn:

Aggression. The target has Advantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

Fortitude. One of the following conditions of the widow’s choice ends on the target: &reference[Charmed apply=false], &reference[Frightened apply=false], &reference[Grappled apply=false], &reference[Paralyzed apply=false], &reference[Poisoned apply=false], &reference[Restrained apply=false], &reference[Stunned apply=false].

Vigor. The target regains 10 Hit Points.

Dose.name: Dose
Dose.description: The widow makes one [[/item Injection]] attack. She can’t take this action again until the start of her next turn.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Weeping Widow’s lair is the sanitorium where she conducts her horrific experiments. The region containing the Weeping Widow’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Weeping Widow dies or moves her lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Dulled Memories.name: Dulled Memories
Dulled Memories.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, creatures have disadvantage on Intelligence checks made to recall information related to painful or emotional memories.

Faded Dreams.name: Faded Dreams
Faded Dreams.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, creatures who sleep or trance have only vague impressions of dreams and recall no details.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the widow fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

Reopened Memories.name: Reopened Memories
Reopened Memories.description: At the start of her turn, if the widow can see a memento of her husband or some other reminder that forces her to realize what she’s lost, she has Disadvantage on D20 Tests and can only expend 2 uses of her Legendary Actions until the start of her next turn.

sT0JVpd1TGEWv540.name: Woodwarped
sT0JVpd1TGEWv540.description:
Woodwarped

Facsimile Grown of Root and Vine

Habitat: Forest

Whispered among forest dwellers is the tale of a cursed vine, said to creep into the bodies of the living or the dead, twisting them into woodwarped. These wooden creations of tangled roots and bark take shape into a crude yet eerily familiar imitation of their hosts. Those that slay their hosts are sometimes clad in the stolen clothing and armor of their victims, silently wandering the woods with hollow eyes that reflect the unnatural force that binds them to the forest. Cutting pieces from their bodies is a dangerous proposition, as the fragments quickly grow into new woodwarped.

Secret. Woodwarped possess a deep fear of axes—tools capable of severing not only their bodies but their bond to the forest. The mere sight of an axe is enough to hold the creatures at bay, and the bite of its blade slices them like smoke.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The woodwarped makes two [[/item Claw]] attacks.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] (escape DC 14) from one of two claws.

Thorn Spray.name: Thorn Spray
Thorn Spray.description: The woodwarped violently expels thorns around itself. Each creature within 15 feet of the woodwarped must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw (with disadvantage if &Reference[Grappled apply=false] by it). On a failed save, a target takes 14 ([[/r 4d6]]) piercing damage and is &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] for 1 minute. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only. A &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Splintered Propagation.name: Splintered Propagation
Splintered Propagation.description: When the woodwarped takes slashing damage that isn’t from a battleaxe, greataxe, or handaxe, a fragment of the woodwarped breaks off and rapidly grows into a new woodwarped in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the original. The new woodwarped is Small, has 10 hit points, only has the Claw action, lacks this reaction, and takes its turn on the original woodwarped’s initiative.

Aversion To Axes.name: Aversion To Axes
Aversion To Axes.description: At the start of the woodwarped’s turn, if it can see a creature holding a battleaxe, a greataxe, or a handaxe, it becomes &Reference[Frightened apply=false] until the start of its next turn.

Thorns.name: Thorns
Thorns.description: At the start of each of its turns, the woodwarped deals 5 ([[/r 2d4]]) piercing damage to any creature it is grappling or any creature grappling it.

Amorphous.name: Amorphous
Amorphous.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Split.name: Split
Split.description:
Trigger: While the [[lookup @name lowercase]] [[lookup @activation.condition activity=zoXFSgzmWq8frUjI]]

Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] splits into two new [[lookup @name capitalize]]. Each new [[lookup @name lowercase]] is one size smaller than the original [[lookup @name lowercase]] and acts on its Initiative. The original [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Hit Points are divided evenly between the new [[lookup @name lowercase]]s (round down).

Split.name: Split
Split.condition: is Large or Medium and has 10+ Hit Points, it becomes Bloodied or is subjected to Lightning or Slashing damage.

saFBY6zjByhqHaie.name: Herald of Fools
saFBY6zjByhqHaie.description:
Herald of Fools

Leader of Fiendish Revels

Habitat: Planar (Lower Planes), Urban

Treasure: Implements

Heralds of fools lead troupes of fiendish revelers in service to the enigmatic Lord of Fools, a clown or jester entity who is a curious mix of levity and cruelty (though always with a sense of irony). The heralds are agile and graceful, every movement a dance, spinning their banner poles in intricate displays that can swiftly turn from entertainment to death.

Secret. Heralds of fools are wonderful dancers, and they must never stop dancing, or they quickly perish.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The herald makes three [[/item Banner Pole]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Lethal Jape]].

Banner Pole.name: Banner Pole
Banner Pole.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]] (with Advantage if the target’s Speed is 0), reach 10 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, the herald can move it to any other unoccupied space within the Banner Pole’s reach.

Lethal Jape.name: Lethal Jape
Lethal Jape.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 15, a creature the herald can see within 60 feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target’s Speed is 0 until the end of its next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Wave The Banner.name: Wave The Banner
Wave The Banner.description:
Trigger: An ally of the herald’s within 60 feet misses with an attack roll or fails a saving throw.

Response: The ally can reroll the d20 and must use the new roll.

Endless Footwork.name: Endless Footwork
Endless Footwork.description: When the herald’s Speed is 0, attack rolls made against it have Advantage, and if its Speed is 0 at the start of its turn, it takes 20 Necrotic damage.

Perfect Grace.name: Perfect Grace
Perfect Grace.description: The herald doesn’t provoke an Opportunity Attack when it leaves an enemy’s reach.

ssrAmbsNOlsEbE3f.name: House of Horror
ssrAmbsNOlsEbE3f.description:
House of Horror

Cursed House Brought to Malevolent Life

Habitat: Any

Treasure: Arcana, Individual

Houses of horror are living houses, often angry or bitter due to the circumstances of their awakening. They were once mundane buildings or dwellings where powerful magics of life and death took place and infused the stones and timber.

Houses of horror jealously covet the true life that its former inhabitants enjoyed, or they carry echoes of the suffering that bodies and souls experienced within them. The houses vent this fury on any who enter, tormenting and terrifying trespassers. The souls of those who die inside are trapped, waiting to be unleashed upon future victims.

Secret. While not haunted houses in the traditional sense, houses of horror can have their consciousness quelled by the same exorcism or purification rituals that put unquiet spirits to rest or drive out possessing spirits.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The house makes three attacks, using [[/item Structure Slam]] or [[/item Object Fling]] in any combination, and it uses Agonized Souls.

Structure Slam.name: Structure Slam
Structure Slam.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &reference[grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 16). The house can grapple up to two creatures at a time, using animated furniture, objects, or fixtures such as stair railings.

Object Fling.name: Object Fling
Object Fling.description: Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], range 20/60 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage (house’s choice). If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &reference[prone apply=false]condition.

Agonized Souls.name: Agonized Souls
Agonized Souls.description:
The house’s stolen souls torment a victim.

Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 16, a creature within 10 feet of the house.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Alter Structure.name: Alter Structure
Alter Structure.description: The house can reshape itself to change the location of walls, doors, floors, and other features of its construction. When one of these features appears or disappears, a creature within 5 feet of a changing feature can make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, the creature chooses which side of a feature it ends up on, or it moves to the nearest unoccupied space to avoid falling.

Construction.name: Construction
Construction.description:
Creatures can enter the house’s space and navigate it as a normal building. The house makes attacks from any surface or object that isn’t being worn or carried within its space. It doesn’t have Disadvantage on ranged attack rolls due to an enemy being within 5 feet of it.

If a creature deals 30 or more damage in a single turn to a 5-foot section of the house’s structure, the house must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or a 5-foot opening appears in that space until the start of the creature’s next turn.

Exorcism Susceptibility.name: Exorcism Susceptibility
Exorcism Susceptibility.description: If the house is targeted by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.TkJ8Wtg1L7TZtspm]{Dispel Evil and Good} spell, it has the &reference[stunned apply=false] condition. At the end of each of its turns, it can make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw, ending the condition on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically. As a Magic action, a creature inside the house that throws a flask of Holy Water against the house and succeeds on a DC 20 Charisma check affects the house as above.

Soul Trap.name: Soul Trap
Soul Trap.description: A Humanoid that dies within the house has its soul trapped there until the house dies. The creature can’t be returned to life by any means short of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.qLeEXZDbW5y4bmLY]{True Resurrection} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz]{Wish} spell.

swqVOtcNjWP85c76.name: Shambling Mound
swqVOtcNjWP85c76.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Lightning Absorption.name: Lightning Absorption
Lightning Absorption.description: Whenever the shambling mound is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The shambling mound makes two slam attacks. If both attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the target is grappled escape DC 14, and the shambling mound uses its Engulf on it.

Engulf.name: Engulf
Engulf.description:
The shambling mound engulfs a Medium or smaller creature grappled by it. The engulfed target is blinded, restrained, and unable to breathe, and it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw at the start of each of the mound's turns or take 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

If the mound moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The mound can have only one creature engulfed at a time.

Slam.name: Slam
Slam.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+7 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .hRwqUlEyM9TjOmHy]] or [[/item .mmRadiantFlame00]] in any combination.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpiritGuar]{Spirit Guardians}

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Divine Aid.name: Divine Aid
Divine Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

tIf1U1kP0LfV29is.name: The Wicker Man
tIf1U1kP0LfV29is.description:
The Wicker Man

Blazing Sacrificial Colossus

Habitat: Any

The ultimate expression of a cult’s dedication to its patron is the Wicker Man. This massive Construct is woven from wicker and bound with wire and iron bands in the shape of a great bipedal effigy. The chest cavity and limbs are hollow where sacrifices can be secured, with the wicker skin forming cage-like bars and gaps. Celebrated and protected with a cult’s very existence, the Wicker Man stands silent and impassive until it is ignited while filled with living sacrifices. Then it comes to life and seeks to consume any nonbelievers—and sometimes even the faithful.

The Wicker Man’s Lair

The Wicker Man’s lair is the hilltop where it is constructed and venerated.

The region containing the Wicker Man’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Biting Flames. Within 1 mile of the lair, when fire damage is dealt to a creature outside the Wicker Man’s dedicated cult that has resistance or immunity to fire damage, the creature takes an extra 1d6 necrotic damage.

Endless Praise. Within 1 mile of the lair, cultists of the Wicker Man who sing their cult’s praises or hymns can be heard up to 300 feet away, even through a Silence spell.

If the Wicker Man dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Wicker Man makes two [[/item Blazing Slam]] attacks.

Blazing Slam.name: Blazing Slam
Blazing Slam.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 15 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Cremating Flame.name: Cremating Flame
Cremating Flame.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 18, each creature in a 60-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Failure or Success: A creature reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage is reduced to ash, and its soul is absorbed into the Wicker Man. The creature can’t be restored to life by any means until the wicker man is destroyed.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The Wicker Man can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The Wicker Man regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Burning Clutch.name: Burning Clutch
Burning Clutch.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC 19, one creature within 15 feet.

Failure: The target has the &reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 16) from one of two hands, and it has the Restrained condition until the grapple ends. At the start of the Wicker Man’s turn, the Grappled creature takes [[/damage average]]damage.

Failure or Success: The Wicker Man can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Stride.name: Stride
Stride.description: The Wicker Man moves up to half its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

Slam.name: Slam
Slam.description: The Wicker Man makes one [[/item Blazing Slam]] attack. The Wicker Man can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Wicker Man’s lair is the hilltop where it is constructed and venerated. The region containing the Wicker Man’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Wicker Man dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Biting Flames.name: Biting Flames
Biting Flames.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, when fire damage is dealt to a creature outside the Wicker Man’s dedicated cult that has resistance or immunity to fire damage, the creature takes an extra [[/r 1d6]] necrotic damage.

Endless Praise.name: Endless Praise
Endless Praise.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, cultists of the Wicker Man who sing their cult’s praises or hymns can be heard up to 300 feet away, even through a Silence spell.

Crushing Blow (Soul Mote).name: Crushing Blow (Soul Mote)
Crushing Blow (Soul Mote).description:
Trigger: The Wicker Man hits with an attack roll.

Response: The Wicker Man expends 1 Soul Mote, and the hit becomes a Critical Hit.

Repair (Soul Mote).name: Repair (Soul Mote)
Repair (Soul Mote).description:
Trigger: The Wicker Man starts its turn.

Response: The Wicker Man expends 1 Soul Mote and regains 20 Hit Points.

Burning Aura.name: Burning Aura
Burning Aura.description: At the end of the each of the Wicker Man’s turns, each creature of its choice in a 15-foot Emanation originating from the Wicker Man takes [[/damage average]] damage. Creatures and flammable objects in the Emanation start burning.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the Wicker Man fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The Wicker Man has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Reactive.name: Reactive
Reactive.description: The Wicker Man can take a Reaction on every turn of combat.

Soul Motes.name: Soul Motes
Soul Motes.description: The Wicker Man has 3 Soul Motes. It gains 1 Soul Mote when a creature that isn’t a Construct or Undead dies within 30 feet of it. The Wicker Man can expend Soul Motes to fuel Soul Mote Reactions. When the Wicker Man finishes a Long Rest, its Soul Mote total resets to 3.

Skitterswarm.name: Skitterswarm
Skitterswarm.description:
Skitterswarm

Fetid Fey Centipedes

Habitat: Planar (Fey), Underground, Urban

Treasure: None

Disgusting Fey who delight in warping flesh and spreading sickness can gather into squirming masses of centipedes known as skitterswarms. These swarms lurk in places where foulness accumulates and often serve centipede hags.

Secret. Skitterswarms can’t resist dead bodies and are drawn to the corpses of Humanoids.

Infesting Bite.name: Infesting Bite
Infesting Bite.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, or 3 ([[/r 1d6]]) Piercing damage if the swarm is Bloodied. If the target is a creature, a centipede infests its body. While infested, the target takes 3 ([[/r 1d6]]) Necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. The infestation ends when the target regains Hit Points or is targeted by an effect that ends the Poisoned condition.

Body Burrowing.name: Body Burrowing
Body Burrowing.description: If the swarm can see the corpse of a Humanoid at the start of its turn, it must move up to its Speed toward the corpse. Once it enters the corpse’s space, it must remain there for 1 hour, after which time the corpse’s flesh putrefies.

Swarm.name: Swarm
Swarm.description: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny centipede. The swarm can’t regain Hit Points or gain Temporary Hit Points.

Vile Vermin.name: Vile Vermin
Vile Vermin.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC 12, any creature that starts its turn in the swarm’s space.

Failure: The target contracts a magical contagion. While afflicted, the target can’t regain Hit Points, and it repeats the save when it finishes a Long Rest or when targeted by an effect that ends the Poisoned condition, recovering from the contagion on a success.

Success: The target is immune to the Vile Vermin trait of all skitterswarms for 24 hours.

tKTrAX9RUUNwcG9Q.name: Squabswarm
tKTrAX9RUUNwcG9Q.description:
Squabswarm

Peeping Fey Pigeons

Habitat: Mountain, Planar (Fey), Urban

Treasure: None

Fey messengers that take the form of pigeons can gather into flocks, or squabswarms. Hags and other influential Fey use squabswarms as spies and messengers—and sometimes as unerring trackers to locate any who flee responsibility or judgement.

Secret. Squabswarms’ drive to deliver letters or parcels is overwhelming, and they can be confused by delivery requests.

Peck.name: Peck
Peck.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, or 2 ([[/r 1d4]]) Piercing damage if the swarm is Bloodied. If the swarm isn’t Bloodied and the target is a creature, the target has the &reference[charmed apply=false] condition until the start of the swarm’s next turn.

Many Eyes, One Voice.name: Many Eyes, One Voice
Many Eyes, One Voice.description:
Trigger: A creature who tasked the swarm to deliver an item and is on the same plane as the swarm takes an action to see through the swarm.

Response: The swarm becomes a scrying sensor as if the creature cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.fVbCxFRaORalHB20]{Scrying}. For the duration, the creature can speak through the swarm.

Compelled Delivery.name: Compelled Delivery
Compelled Delivery.description: As an Influence action, a creature can direct the swarm to deliver a letter or parcel (which the creature must provide) to a recipient the creature knows. The swarm has the &reference[charmed apply=false] condition until it delivers the item to the specified recipient or until it takes damage. While Charmed in this way, the swarm must deliver the item to the specified recipient if it knows where the recipient is.

Swarm.name: Swarm
Swarm.description: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny pigeon. The swarm can’t regain Hit Points or gain Temporary Hit Points.

Unerring Delivery.name: Unerring Delivery
Unerring Delivery.description: If the swarm is tasked to deliver an item to a creature, the swarm knows the distance and direction to the creature while they are on the same plane.

tN4XJsdkOUnSekAc.name: Wraith
tN4XJsdkOUnSekAc.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Create Specter.name: Create Specter
Create Specter.description:
The wraith targets a humanoid within 10 feet of it that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute and died violently.

The target's spirit rises as a specter in the space of its corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space. The specter is under the wraith's control. The wraith can have no more than seven specters under its control at one time.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description:
The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain.

It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Wraith - Life Drain.name: Wraith - Life Drain
Wraith - Life Drain.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+6 to hit,, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 21 (4d8 + 3) necrotic damage.

The target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

tPcvhJQ8D9LRtu5z.name: The Beast of Blight
tPcvhJQ8D9LRtu5z.description:
The Beast of Blight

Manifestation of Rot and Decay

Habitat: Forest, Swamp

Treasure: Relics

The Beast of Blight was once known as Farryn of the Greenwood, a druidic protector of the natural cycle who delved into forbidden lore to save her dead lover. Her love was virtuous, but in the end, it caused nothing but pain. Rot overtook the druid, and she is now a monstrous being that spreads and thrives on decay. The Beast of Blight moves effortlessly through decay and spews putrid spores when roused to anger.

Secret. Buried deep within the Beast of Blight, a tiny fragment of Farryn still exists. If shown an image of her lost love, the ignited memory will burn away the rot.

The Beast of Blight’s Lair

The Beast of Blight’s lair is a cave in the heart of a rotten forest where blight creeps endlessly forth.

The region containing the Beast of Blight’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Fouling Blight. Within 6 miles of the lair, ability checks made to forage for food or water have disadvantage, and magic that creates food or water only produces half the normal amount.

Rapid Decay. Within 1 mile of the lair, objects that aren’t worn or carried have vulnerability to necrotic damage, and the length of time in which a dead creature can be brought back to life is halved.

If the Beast of Blight dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The beast makes two [[/item Claw]] attacks.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 10 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &reference[grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 17) from one of two claws. If the beast moved at least 20 feet immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) Poison damage.

Project Image.name: Project Image
Project Image.description: The beast casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ePhRKHXRE7l1sEoQ]{Project Image} spell, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability. During the spell’s duration, the beast can use its Spew Blight action and Rot Stride Bonus Action as if it were in the image’s space.

Spew Blight.name: Spew Blight
Spew Blight.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature in a 60-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition. The target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it automatically succeeds.

Success: Half damage only.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: Legendary Action Uses: 3. Immediately after another creature’s turn, the beast can expend a use to take one of the following actions. The beast regains all expended uses at the start of each of its turns.

Trample.name: Trample
Trample.description: The beast moves up to half its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks. A Large or smaller creature in a space the beast enters must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or have the &reference[prone apply=false] condition.

Impale.name: Impale
Impale.description:
The beast impales a creature it is grappling on one of its exposed ribs (it can have two creatures impaled at a time).

Strength Saving Throw: DC 19, one creature the beast is grappling.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target now has the &reference[grappled apply=false]condition (escape DC 17) from an impaling rib, and it has the &reference[restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Success: Half damage only.

Failure or Success: The beast can’t use this action again until the start of its next turn.

Hallucinate.name: Hallucinate
Hallucinate.description:
The beast exhales hallucinatory spores.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 17, one creature within 60 feet.

Failure: The target is affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.9hQXdMSmerkTsHDe]{Confusion} spell until the start of the beast’s next turn.

Failure or Success: The beast can’t use this action again until the start of its next turn.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description:
The Beast of Blight’s lair is a cave in the heart of a rotten forest where blight creeps endlessly forth.

The region containing the Beast of Blight’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

If the Beast of Blight dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Fouling Blight.name: Fouling Blight
Fouling Blight.description: Within 6 miles of the lair, ability checks made to forage for food or water have Disadvantage, and magic that creates food or water only produces half the normal amount.

Rapid Decay.name: Rapid Decay
Rapid Decay.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, objects that aren’t worn or carried have Vulnerability to Necrotic damage, and the length of time in which a dead creature can be brought back to life is halved.

Rot Stride.name: Rot Stride
Rot Stride.description: The beast teleports to an unoccupied space within 60 feet. Either its starting or destination space must contain fungus or rotting organic matter.

Blighted Overgrowth.name: Blighted Overgrowth
Blighted Overgrowth.description: While the beast is Bloodied, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls, its Spew Blight action recharges at the start of its turn, and if it has at least 1 Hit Point at the start of its turn, it regains 20 Hit Points. If it takes Fire damage, it doesn’t regain Hit Points at the start of its next turn.

Fungal Step.name: Fungal Step
Fungal Step.description: The beast ignores Difficult Terrain caused by plants or fungi.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the beast fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Unraveled Longing.name: Unraveled Longing
Unraveled Longing.description: If the beast can see the likeness of its long-lost love at the start of its turn, the beast takes [[/damage average]] damage and has Disadvantage on D20 Tests until the start of its next turn.

zWbNuAKTwOjD48zS.name: Project Image
zWbNuAKTwOjD48zS.description:
You create an illusory copy of yourself that lasts for the duration. The copy can appear at any location within range that you have seen before, regardless of intervening obstacles. The illusion looks and sounds like you, but it is intangible. If the illusion takes any damage, it disappears, and the spell ends.

You can see through the illusion's eyes and hear through its ears as if you were in its space. As a Magic action, you can move it up to 60 feet and make it gesture, speak, and behave in whatever way you choose. It mimics your mannerisms perfectly.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be illusory, since things can pass through it. A creature that takes the Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and any noise it makes sounds hollow to the creature.

materials.value: a statuette of yourself worth 5+ GP

tVIL7O6UEFgPmWev.name: Corn Dolly
tVIL7O6UEFgPmWev.description:
Corn Dolly

Grain Husk Companion (Curved blade plated in gold)

Habitat: Any

Crafted from dried husks and bound with twine, corn dollies’ delicate forms are stitched together with rustic care. Their faces are ink-brushed with simple, childlike expressions—smiling mouths that curve a bit too wide and hollow eyes that seem to stare far beyond the physical world. The Constructs are spirits of deceased Humanoids drawn to the hollow corn husk shell, seeking refuge. These spirits retain faint traces of who they once were—a protective instinct entwined with a simmering fury. Once animated, the dolls reflect this dual nature: acting as silent guardians one moment and vengeful specters the next.

Husk Cut.name: Husk Cut
Husk Cut.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Blank Stare.name: Blank Stare
Blank Stare.description: The corn dolly stares at one creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw, taking 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Sowing Dread.name: Sowing Dread
Sowing Dread.description: The corn dolly radiates dread in a 15-foot cone. Each creature of the corn dolly’s choice in that area must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or become &Reference[Frightened apply=false] until the end of its next turn.

Silent Protector.name: Silent Protector
Silent Protector.description: When a creature within 60 feet of the corn dolly fails a saving throw against an effect that doesn’t deal damage, the corn dolly suffers the effects of the failure instead of the creature.

Husk Body.name: Husk Body
Husk Body.description: The corn dolly can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

Uneasy Visage.name: Uneasy Visage
Uneasy Visage.description: The strange, childlike inked face unnerves onlookers. While a creature is holding the corn dolly, creatures within 10 feet of it have disadvantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks made against the creature.

tg7gMT759ls9CqOG.name: Deepdreck
tg7gMT759ls9CqOG.description:
Deepdreck

Poisoned Subterranean Wretch

Habitat: Underground

Treasure: Implements, Individual

Deepdrecks were miners long ago who found themselves far too deep beneath the earth, where they were cursed and corrupted by deforming powers. Now they tunnel and dig greedily, bloated with poisonous gases.

Astute observers have noted that these monsters occasionally bear a resemblance to missing loved ones who have long been thought dead.

Secret. The toxic essence of deepdrecks is disrupted by pleasant scents such as flowers, perfume, spices, or incense.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The deepdreck makes two attacks, using [[/item Claw]] or [[/item Putrid Emission]] in any combination.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Putrid Emission.name: Putrid Emission
Putrid Emission.description: Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], range 60 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the deepdreck’s next turn.

Explosive Death.name: Explosive Death
Explosive Death.description:
The deepdreck explodes when it dies.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature in a 15-foot Emanation originating from the deepdreck.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Fragrance Aversion.name: Fragrance Aversion
Fragrance Aversion.description: The deepdreck has Disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws while within 10 feet of burning incense or a creature wearing Perfume.

Tunneler.name: Tunneler
Tunneler.description: The deepdreck can burrow through solid rock at half its Burrow Speed and leaves a 5-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

tnAQx8Q0wb7w6cQ4.name: Priest
tnAQx8Q0wb7w6cQ4.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
Chain Shirt.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy

1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, guiding bolt, sanctuary

2nd level (3 slots): lesser restoration, spiritual weapon

3rd level (2 slots): dispel magic, spirit guardians

Divine Eminence.name: Divine Eminence
Divine Eminence.description:
As a bonus action, the priest can expend a spell slot to cause its melee weapon attacks to magically deal an extra 10 (3d6) radiant damage to a target on a hit.

This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If the priest expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d6 for each level above 1st.

Mace.name: Mace
Mace.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+2 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.

Sacred Flame.name: Sacred Flame
Sacred Flame.description:
Flame-like radiance descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw.

The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You create one of the following magical effects within range:

  • Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute.
  • You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.
  • You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.
  • You create a sound that originates from a point of your choice within range.
  • You cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.
  • You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

Guiding Bolt.name: Guiding Bolt
Guiding Bolt.description:
A flash of light streaks toward a creature of your choice within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 4d6 radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against this target before the end of your next turn has advantage, thanks to the mystical dim light glittering on the target until then.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

Sanctuary.name: Sanctuary
Sanctuary.description:
You ward a creature within range against attack. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn't protect the warded creature from area effects, such as the explosion of a Fireball.

If the warded creature makes an attack or casts a spell that affects an enemy creature, this spell ends.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and can end either one disease or one condition afflicting it. The condition can be blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral weapon within range that lasts for the duration or until you cast this spell again. When you cast the spell, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the weapon. On a hit, the target takes force damage equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the weapon up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

The weapon can take whatever form you choose. Clerics of deities who are associated with a particular weapon (as St. Cuthbert is known for his mace and Thor for his hammer) make this spell's effect resemble that weapon.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for every two slot levels above the 2nd.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

Spirit Guardians.name: Spirit Guardians
Spirit Guardians.description:
You call forth spirits to protect you. They flit around you to a distance of 15 feet for the duration. If you are good or neutral, their spectral form appears angelic or fey (your choice). If you are evil, they appear fiendish.

When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it. An affected creature's speed is halved in the area, and when the creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 3d8 radiant damage (if you are good or neutral) or 3d8 necrotic damage (if you are evil). On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. Until the spell ends, the object sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like. Completely covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action.

If you target an object held or worn by a hostile creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the spell.

Cure Wounds.name: Cure Wounds
Cure Wounds.description:
A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

tqzXmDO6SKt9B0wz.name: Cultist
tqzXmDO6SKt9B0wz.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
Leather Armor.description: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

Dark Devotion.name: Dark Devotion
Dark Devotion.description: The cultist has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

Scimitar.name: Scimitar
Scimitar.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+3 to hit,, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing damage.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Speak with Beasts and Plants.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
Speak with Beasts and Plants.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item .mmVineLash000000]] or [[/item .mmThornBurst0000]] attack, and it can use Spellcasting to cast [[/item .mmSpellcasting00.Activity.bAmZSyK4cn33HwwI]].

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplAnimalFrie]{Animal Friendship}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCharmMonst]{Charm Monster} (lasts 24 hours; ends early if the dryad casts the spell again), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDruidcraft]{Druidcraft}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplEntangle00]{Entangle}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPasswithou]{Pass without Trace}

Tree Stride.name: Tree Stride
Tree Stride.description: If within [[lookup @range.value activity=8av8Lh1jNLCrOJny]] feet of a [[lookup @range.special activity=8av8Lh1jNLCrOJny]], the [[lookup @name lowercase]] teleports to an unoccupied space within [[lookup @range.value activity=8av8Lh1jNLCrOJny]] feet of a second [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=8av8Lh1jNLCrOJny]] that is within 60 feet of the previous tree.

Animal Friendship.name: Animal Friendship
Animal Friendship.description:
Target a Beast that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. If you or one of your allies deals damage to the target, the spells ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Beast for each spell slot level above 1.

Charmed.name: Charmed
Charmed.description: The target has the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. If you or one of your allies deals damage to the target, the spells ends.

Charm Monster.name: Charm Monster
Charm Monster.description:
One creature you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. It does so with Advantage if you or your allies are fighting it. On a failed save, the target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the spell ends or until you or your allies damage it. The Charmed creature is Friendly to you. When the spell ends, the target knows it was Charmed by you.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 4.

Charmed.name: Charmed
Charmed.description: The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the spell ends or until you or your allies damage it. The Charmed creature is Friendly to you. When the spell ends, the target knows it was Charmed by you.

Druidcraft.name: Druidcraft
Druidcraft.description:
Whispering to the spirits of nature, you create one of the following effects within range.

Weather Sensor. You create a Tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round.

Bloom. You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom.

Sensory Effect. You create a harmless sensory effect, such as falling leaves, spectral dancing fairies, a gentle breeze, the sound of an animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot Cube.

Fire Play. You light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a campfire.

Entangle.name: Entangle
Entangle.description:
Grasping plants sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into &Reference[difficultterrain]. They disappear when the spell ends.

Each creature (other than you) in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the &Reference[restrained apply=false] condition until the spell ends. A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Pass without Trace.name: Pass without Trace
Pass without Trace.description: You radiate a concealing aura in a 30-foot Emanation for the duration. While in the aura, you and each creature you choose have a +10 bonus to [[/check ability=dex skill=ste]] checks and leave no tracks.

Concealed.name: Concealed
Concealed.description: While in the aura, you and each creature you choose have a +10 bonus to [[/check ability=dex skill=ste]] checks and leave no tracks.

u5pKJAtHzkur3ciJ.name: Boogleswarm
u5pKJAtHzkur3ciJ.description:
Boogleswarm

Tricksy Fey Weasels

Habitat: Forest, Planar (Fey), Urban

Treasure: Individual

Boogleswarms are mischievous Fey spirits that take the form of weasels gathered into a slinking mob. These spirits covet and collect teeth of all kinds, but they favor the teeth of Humanoids most of all. Tales of tooth faeries might have their origin in boogleswarms, as they are known to enter into agreements to trade for teeth—such as those lost by children and tucked under a pillow—for rewards, favors, or safety.

Secret. Boogleswarms go wild for sugar, whether pure or in heavily-sweetened foods like candy, and are compelled to take and consume any they find.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The swarm makes two [[/item Bite]] attacks that must have different targets.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, or 5 ([[/r 2d4]]) Piercing damage if the swarm is Bloodied. If the target is a creature that has teeth, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or lose one of its teeth. The swarm immediately implants the tooth into one of its mouths. A creature that has already lost a tooth to this attack automatically succeeds on the saving throw.

Mimicry (Only if the Swarm Can Speak).name: Mimicry (Only if the Swarm Can Speak)
Mimicry (Only if the Swarm Can Speak).description: The swarm can speak in the voice of a creature whose tooth it has implanted (see the Bite action). Listeners must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom (Insight) check to discern the mimicry.

Swarm.name: Swarm
Swarm.description: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny weasel. The swarm can’t regain Hit Points or gain Temporary Hit Points.

Sweet Tooth.name: Sweet Tooth
Sweet Tooth.description: If the swarm can see or smell sugar at the start of its turn, it must use all its movement to move closer to the sugar. If it reaches the sugar, the swarm has the &reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn as it consumes the sugar, and this trait doesn’t function again until the swarm finishes a Short or Long Rest.

u7xIJhx3HMKqVc4s.name: Old Ways Chosen
u7xIJhx3HMKqVc4s.description:
Old Ways Chosen

Devout Follower of Old Gods

Habitat: Any

Venerating old and forgotten gods who once held sway over the remote places of the world, the Old Ways chosen keep the last embers of belief and tradition burning. Many of the chosen are insular, keeping to the communities they foster. Some are more open to contact with outsiders, whether to be a beneficent presence or to draw in potential sacrifices to the Old Ways.

Secret. Old Ways chosen bind their power into a mask they use as a focus. Without the mask, their magic unravels.

Druidcraft.name: Druidcraft
Druidcraft.description:
Whispering to the spirits of Nature, you create one of the following Effects within range:

  • You create a tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, Falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round.
  • You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom.
  • You create an Instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as Falling leaves, a puff of wind, the sound of a small animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot cube.
  • You instantly light or snuff out a Candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. The illusion also ends if you dismiss it as an action or cast this spell again.

If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it.

If a creature uses its action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Entangle.name: Entangle
Entangle.description:
Grasping weeds and vines sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square starting from a point within range. For the Duration, these Plants turn the ground in the area into difficult terrain.

A creature in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be &Reference[Restrained] by the entangling Plants until the spell ends. A creature restrained by the plants can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

When the spell ends, the conjured Plants wilt away.

Entangle.name: Entangle
Entangle.description: A creature in the area is Restrained by the entangling Plants until the spell ends. A creature restrained by the plants can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

Scorching Ray.name: Scorching Ray
Scorching Ray.description:
You create three rays of fire and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several.

Make a ranged Spell Attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 fire damage.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you create one additional ray for each slot level above 2nd.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The chosen casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components other than its Animal Mask and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.SbSvZKkJASyk8jKo], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.oIzA2MEHwxhtQneU]

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.gMrWeG8fMDPRFiVe], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.7u2obDvuvtZBkTfq]

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The chosen makes three [[/item Ritual Dagger]] attacks.

Ritual Dagger.name: Ritual Dagger
Ritual Dagger.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage plus 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) radiant or necrotic damage (the chosen’s choice).

Songs Of The Old Ways.name: Songs Of The Old Ways
Songs Of The Old Ways.description:
The chosen sings one of the following songs:

  • Blessing Of The Harvest. Each creature of the chosen’s choice within 30 feet of the chosen regains 14 ([[/r 4d4 + 4]]) hit points.

  • Song Of Sacrifice. One creature of the chosen’s choice within 30 feet must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 40 ([[/r 9d8]]) necrotic damage and is &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] until the end of the chosen’s next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

  • Wicker Chant. Each creature of the chosen’s choice within 20 feet of the chosen must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ([[/r 9d6]]) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Animal Mask.name: Animal Mask
Animal Mask.description: The chosen wears the mask of an animal, imbuing it with the strength of the old gods. When a creature is grappling the chosen, the creature can remove the mask as an action, or as an attack during the Attack action, with a successful DC 12 Strength (Athletics) check. Without its mask, the chosen can’t cast spells, its &Reference[Concentration] on any existing spells ends, and the save DC of Song of the Old Ways is reduced by 4.

Shapechanger.name: Shapechanger
Shapechanger.description:

Antimagic Susceptibility.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
Antimagic Susceptibility.description:
The rug is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field.

If targeted by dispel magic, the rug must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

Damage Transfer.name: Damage Transfer

Melee Weapon Attack:+5 to hit,, 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Hit:

v1WqqEPtBHN6w2V4.name: Bat Hound
v1WqqEPtBHN6w2V4.description:
Bat Hound

Bloodthirsty Hunter of the Night

Habitat: Forest, Mountain, Underground, Urban

Treasure: None

Bat hounds are created through blood magic rituals that manipulate the curse of vampirism to transform a hound into a relentless stalker. Unswervingly loyal companions, bat hounds aid vampiric masters in tracking prey, able to outrun horses and their riders once they smell blood. They seek out stragglers or quarry that are escaping during a hunt and drag them back for capture.

Secret. Running water keeps bat hounds at bay and can destroy them, a lingering remnant from the vampiric curse that spawned them.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a creature, the bat hound regains a number of Hit Points equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &reference[grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 13).

Outmaneuver.name: Outmaneuver
Outmaneuver.description: The bat hound takes the Dash and Disengage actions, and until the end of the turn, needn’t spend extra movement to move a creature it is grappling.

Safe Descent.name: Safe Descent
Safe Descent.description: Trigger: The bat hound takes damage from a fall and isn’t wearing heavy armor. Response: The bat hound extends its wings and reduces the fall’s damage to 0.

Barred By Water.name: Barred By Water
Barred By Water.description: The bat hound can’t willingly move into running water or to a space up to 20 feet above running water. If it starts its turn in running water, it takes 10 Acid damage and has the &reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn.

Glide.name: Glide
Glide.description: If it doesn’t have the &reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and isn’t wearing heavy armor, the bat hound can extend its membranous wings to move up to 5 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it descends in the air.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The bat hound can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

v2BY6TWKFSVSA0nv.description:
